If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and potato seeds

loans.name: Calixtra De Jesus

texts.es: Calixtra de 65 años, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación León 2000, pues los financiamientos le han sido de mucha ayuda gracias a este tipo de apoyo ha logrado aumentar su negocio. Ella es una persona responsable que disfruta de este medio de vida, su familia está conformada por 4 personas quienes tiene que brindarles el alimento diario. La mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos y familiares atiende desde muy temprano desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos y detergentes.
texts.en: Calixtra, age 65, has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. The loans have been a great help to her, and thanks to this support she has been able to expand her business. She is a responsible person who benefits from this lifestyle. Her family is made up of four people for whom she has to provide daily. The majority of her customers are her neighbours, friends and family. She runs the store from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm. This loan is for the purchase of candies, drinks, bread, basic grains and detergents.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela  solicito 900 $us; ella trabaja como cajera de una empresa. Vive en la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz; está casada.
 El crédito lo destinara en la continuación de estudios superiores, costo de su tesis y título en provisión nacional;  de esta manera ella estará en condiciones de mejorar sus aspiraciones laborales y conseguir un ascenso en su trabajo o un mejor trabajo en otro lado.
 Es el tercer crédito  que solicita en Impro y el segundo  vía Kiva. Su historial de pagos la califica como cliente 1, con un excelente historial.
texts.en:
Pamela  is requesting $900 USD. She works as a cashier in a business. She lives in the Munaypata zone of the city of La Paz. She is married.
She will use this loan to continue her higher education; for the cost of her thesis and professional certification. This way, she will be in the position to improve her job prospects and get a promotion or a better job elsewhere.
This is her third loan with Impro and her second with Kiva. Her payment history qualifies her as a 'client 1', with an excellent record.

loans.use: the cost of the preparation and defense of her thesis in the University, and the cost to apply for her professional certification.

loans.name: Karungule Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Aliphose is a member of Karungule Tweimukye group which has twenty nine members, ,two of his group members were willing to guarantee the others although they didnot take the loan and they include T. Peace and Nyagyendo Sofia. Aliphose is a farmer living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His desire is to educate his children and expand his cattle business. Aliphose wants a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: Buying cattle to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita P. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Clarita is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a single woman with seven children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a coconut-selling business for the past nine years, selling them retail at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Nyevu faces a major challenge of theft and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to become a dairy farmer in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a dairy cow and pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Dios Es Bueno 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group Dios es bueno 4 & 5 (God is Great). She makes her home here in a simple structure with two children and her long term partner. She plans to continue enjoying being at home with her children and doing business.

Margarita is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for one and a half years, starting out with some savings she had accumulated. In less than 4 months, she joined this group for a loan to increase her sales. Margarita plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing chains, bracelets, rings, earrings and plastic jewels. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She would like to have an improved business and to travel to different countries.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to expand her business and needed the capital to increase her sales. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Katikko Small Scale Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Justine N., 35, belongs to Katikko Small Scale Farmers Association-Mityana. The mother of four has been running a retail shop in Katikko for the past decade and she says because of the hard work she has put in, it has been worthwhile. 

Justine says she used profits from her farming business to take root in her general merchandise retail shop. Weekly, she says, this business generates her 20,000 UGX and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell at her shop

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky T. is from the village of Tipolohon, Calaveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Pinky is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Pinky sells green and yellow bananas in the local community. Pinky has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. Pinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Pinky is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green bananas. This will be the third loan taken out by Pinky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has owned a clothing store since 2010, where she sells clothes designed for all genders and ages. This young woman learned this business by working in a clothing center for a couple of years.  With her business income, she is able to help her father pay the household expenses.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. She says that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to add shoes to sell in her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 65 years old. She has eight children who are ages 6 to 47 years old. They have all been to school. 

She sells green bananas and traditionally made alcohol and she is also a farmer. This business has enabled her to pay garden employees and meet the needs of her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas and some other type of bananas used to make alcohol. With the profits she plans to feed her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana sells fish.  She is 30 years old, married, with 3 children.  Two of her children go to school.  Ana borrowed a loan to stock more fish for sale.  With the extra profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more fish for sale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid off 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of rice for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. América tiene 42 años D. edad ella es  madre soltera tiene 5 hijos donD. 3 dependen D. ella, sus hijos fueron su inspiración para salir adelante, ella empezó trabajando como ayudante en la producción juego recreativos  pirotécnicos. Gracias al buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos y a sus conocimientos pudo invertir en su propio negocio D. juegos pirotécnicos que lleva  el nombre D. “El Trueno”,  también nos manifiesta que  por las noches trabaja en un restaurante como  cocinera a la cual asiste 4 veces a la semana siendo la  mayoría D. sus clientes   personas que viajan al centro del país, gracias a su trabajo pueD. cubrir los gastos esenciales D. su familia además D. sentirse bien porque trabajando ha encontrado estabilidad emocional, para el futuro piensa construir su vivienda ya que solo esta D. material D. adobe. Con el préstamo solicitado ella va invertir en su negocio en la compra D. pabilos, carrizos, carbón, azufre, y otros artículos para seguir trabajando. Todas las socias D. la Alcancía “Comunal Julio C. Tello al Progreso” son recurrentes y responsables en sus créditos. En la fotografía podemos verlas reunidas en su reunión D. desembolso aunque Carmen Maritza tuvo que retirarse por motivo D. trabajo,   todas están agradecidas y comprometidas con el Programa.
texts.en:
Mrs. América, 42, is a single mother of five children, three of whom are still in her care.  Her children are her greatest inspiration to get ahead.  She began working as a production assistant in a recreational fireworks company.  Thanks to the fact that she was able to save some of her income, she used her expertise to set up her own fireworks business called "El Trueno" (thunder).  She also works at night as a cook in a restaurant four times a week.  Most of her customers are people who visit the central part of the country.  

With her income she is able to cover the essential household expenses.  She also feels good because working gives her emotional stability.  In the future she would like to build a house, since she now lives in an adobe dwelling.  She plans to use the loan to buy wicks, reeds, coal, sulphur and other items to continue her work.  All of the members of the communal bank "Comunal Julio C. Tello al Progreso" are responsible in paying back the loans they have taken out several times.  In the photograph the members are holding a meeting althouh Carmen Martiza could not attend because of work.  They are all very grateful and committed to the Program.

loans.use: To buy wicks, reeds, coal, and sulphur.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Annabel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and detergents. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Annabel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Annabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.es:
Los más coloridos y bonitos cobertores para camas hechos a mano en Santo Domingo son vendidos por Arcadia, una mujer de 51 años madre de dos hijos. Ella vive sola con su pequeño nieto de 5 años de quien se hizo cargo. Nos cuenta que su vida ha sido muy dura ya que crio sola a sus hijos que hoy en día no viven con ella. Ella siempre solvento sola los gastos del hogar y al mismo tiempo fue padre y madre de sus hijos.

Ella únicamente ha estudiado la primaria, y desde hace unos años se dedica a comprar y vender cobertores y juegos de cama tejidos, también sábanas y edredones. Empezó por iniciativa de sus amistades quienes la motivaron para que tome el negocio. Ella trabaja sola, en su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con su nieto y ver telenovelas. Ella desea hacer arreglos a su vivienda para lo cual solicitó un crédito en Fundación Alternativa.

Ella desea poder tener una casa más bonita y ayudar económicamente a sus dos hijos que ya no están con ella.
texts.en:
The prettiest and most colorful handmade blankets in Santo Domingo are sold by Arcadia, a fifty-one-year-old mother of two.  She lives alone with her little five-year-old grandson, for whom she was given responsibility.  She tells us that her life has been very hard because she raised her kids, who no longer live with her, by herself.  She always worked out household expenses while serving as both mother and father to her children.

Arcadia has has only a primary school education, and for some years has earned her living buying and selling knit blankets and bedspreads as well as comforters and sheets.  She started out at the initiative of her friends, who motivated her to start a business. She works by herself, and she likes to spend her free time with her grandson and watching soap operas. She requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa because she wants to do repairs on her house.

Arcadia would like to have a nicer house and help her two children, who no longer live with her.

loans.use: to do repairs on her house.

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath (in the photo) is a rice farmer, assisted by her children. She also sells "onsorm" when she is not at the farm. "Onsorm" is a type of Cambodian cake that has rice and coconut with soybeans and pork in the middle.

Nath is a widow with two sons and two daughters. She is requesting a loan of $700 to continue her farming business by purchasing a motorized hand tiller and buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized hand tiller and buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 29 years old and married to Magdaline. They have two children. Jeremiah has a business selling paraffin, which he has been doing for the last five years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more paraffin to add to his inventory. He hopes to build a family home in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more paraffin

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a hardworking businessman aged 44. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the past two years, he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. In the next 5 years he wants to expand his business. His dream is to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Merida

texts.es: Mérida de 27 años de edad, casado con Aquilino de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza distrito de Pichari. La agricultura ha sido la actividad que se ha dedicado durante toda su vida, pues no logró culminar los estudios por faltas de medio económicos. Con el pasar del tiempo se compró su propio terreno agrícola, desde entonces se ha esforzado mucho para que sus frutos sean de calidad, pues su método de fertilización es órganica, lo cual lo hace mucho más saludable. Además que contribuye al cuidado del medio ambiente, utilizando solo estiércol de animales. Para ella éste trabajo es importante y desea que sus hijos también apliquen esta técnica cuando tengan sus propias tierras. Hoy sus frutos tiene mucha demanda por parte de los mayoristas, quienes realizan buena paga por cada kilo que compran, por tanto desea ampliar la siembra para aumentar la producción de café y cacaco. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 soles que solicita, Comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Mérida is 27, and married to Aquilino, 34.  They have two children, and live in their own house in the community of Nueva Fortaleza, in Pichari district. She has farmed all her life, as she didn't manage to complete her schooling due to lack of financial means. 

In the course of time, she bought her own land. Since then, she has tried very hard to grow quality crops, as she fertilizes using organic methods, which are much better for your health.  In addition, this contributes to caring for the environment, as only animal manure is used. This work is important to her, and she wants her children to also apply this technique when they have their own land. 

Today there is a lot of demand for her crops from the wholesalers, who pay well for every kilo they buy. Therefore she wants to expand her plantings in order to increase her production of coffee and cacao. 

This will be her first loan from MFP, so she is committed to making her payments on time. With the 1000 soles she is applying for, she will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a farmer. The children are employed and live independently from their parents. Ten years ago Zamira purchased two calves for breeding and since that time she has been engaged in cattle breeding. She sells milk products.  In this way she earns about 4000 soms to meet the family needs. At the moment, she applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase feed for cattle. In the future she plans to increase the number of cattle and expand her milk sales business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Made and the other members of the Putri Sari group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize their income. Ni Made hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Made will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as breeding.  With her profits, she will help support her family by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer.  Ultimately, Ni Made hopes that the increased income will enable her to save for the family's future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Twiyubakebahinzi Group

texts.fr:
Ananie fait partie du groupe Twiyubake Bahinzi. Le nom du groupe signifie «renforçons-nous agriculteurs». Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 5 à 9 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de primaire.

Ananie est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Ananie voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ananie is part of the group Twiyubake Bahinzi. The name means something like "strengthening farmers". He is 30 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 9, 3 are in school. He has 3 years of schooling.

Ananie is a rice farmer. It is his second round of financing with ACB. He is going to use the loan to purchase chemical fertilizer for his rice crops.

His business growth strategy is to only use specially selected seeds. In the next few years, Ananie would like to become the main rice producer in his region. With his profits, he intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer for his rice crops.

loans.name: Ronelin

texts.en:
Ronelin is 23 years old and is married with a child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, Ronelin has run a business selling a variety of dried fish using a motorcycle with her husband as the driver. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

Ronelin is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. Her business is well, clean, and good. She owns a hardware business. She has two years experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business runs from 6:30am until 7:30pm every day. 

Mariam has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her hardware business by purchasing more goods for resale. With any profit from the loan, Mariam will expand her business, save for her family, and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to expand her hardware business by purchasing more goods for resale.

loans.name: Joyceryn

texts.en:
Joyceryn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Joyceryn has a shop that sells electronic loads (pre-paid cell phone credits) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.

Joyceryn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joyceryn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has twelve children. 

Isabelo provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for fifteen years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline and service.

Isabelo became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Isabelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and service.

loans.name: El Cisne Group

texts.es:
El grupo el cisne esta conformado por 7 integrantes dos de ellos hombres y 5 mujeres todos los integrantes pertenecen  a  la misma comunidad, el nombre del grupo lo eligió una persona que ya no esta en le grupo, el grupo lleva mucho tiempo trabajando con la institución algunos integrantes han salido pero también ingresan nuevos, así que el nombre lo eligió don Manuel suponen los integrantes recientes porque el criaba gansos en ese entonces.
Doña Eva quien tambien forma parte del grupo tiene 63 años de edad es viuda ya no tiene quien dependa de ella ahora slo vive cercas de uno de sus hijos y convive con sus nietos aparte del grupo gracias al crédito se ha beneficiado con los prestamos, ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a compra y venta de cerdos y con eso pudo mejorar su vivienda y poner una tienda de abarrotes, esta vez ha esta invirtiendo en su negocio de renta de sillas y mesas para eventos especiales en la comunidad o en otras comunidades vecinas, se las van a pedir rentadas cuando tiene bautizos, primeras comuniones, salidas de escuela y es cuando le va mejor.
Tiene 60 mesas con 108 sillas, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 60 manteles para sus mesas, las mesas las trajo de México y casi cumple un año en el negocio su esperanza es llegar a tener mas sillas para darle un mejor servicios a su clientes ya que era uno de sus desafíos porque no luego no puede a completar el muro de sillas o mesas que le solicitan. los integrantes del grupo están agradecidos y contentos por el préstamo se han comprometido a no quedar con el préstamo, cada uno de ellos invertirá en actividades diferentes, Luisa en cerdos, Lucila comprara maíz para su tortillas, Marco Antonio comprar pollo para su pollería, Juana invertirá en maíz y alimenta para cerdos, Hermelinda para asbestos,Manuel comprara borregos.
texts.en:
The group “El Cisne” (The Swan) consists of seven members, two men and five women. All of them are from the same community. The name of the group was chosen by a person who is no longer a member. This group has worked a long time with Fundación Realidad, so some members have left while new ones have joined. This name was chosen by Don Manuel and the more recent members believe he was raising geese at the time.

Doña Eva is also a member of this group. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has no dependents. Eva currently lives near one of her children, but she has a grandchild who lives with her now that her family is not together. Thanks to her access to credit, she has been able to benefit from the loans. Eva previously bought and sold pigs and used her profits to improve her home. She opened a grocery store, but also invested in a business of renting out chairs and tables for special events in the community and the surrounding areas. Her services are requested for baptisms, first communions, school graduations, and other events in which she does her best. Eva has 60 tables and 108 chairs, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy 60 tablecloths for covering the tables. The tables were brought in from Mexico City and she has been in business for almost a year. She hopes to have more chairs so that she can provide better service to her customers. One of her challenges is not being able to fulfill a request for enough tables and chairs.

The other members of the group are appreciative and pleased with their loans, so they have promised to keep up with them. Each member will invest in different activities: • Luisa will buy pigs. • Lucila will buy corn for making tortillas. • Marco Antonio will buy chickens for his chicken shop. • Juana will invest in corn and feed for her pigs. • Hermelinda will buy provisions. • Manuel will buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Massavo Ii Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MASSAVO II est composé de vingt-trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Blandine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 33 ans, a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Blandine est mariée a un carreleur du nom de Mathias. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et aucun a leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Blandine vend de l’huile d’arachide par la technique de distribution depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Blandine vend du charbon bois et des tissus. Blandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Blandine ensemble avec les membres du MASSAVO II groupe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé

loans.use: Acheter des bidons d'huile et des charbons de bois.

loans.name: Heremakono 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO 4sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide et le mais avec YESSO DITE BEBE la 2ème personne de la gauche à la droite sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Zounogo Group

texts.fr: Aoua est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle vend du céréales dans son quartier et cela fait 6 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Aoua a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil à 20 000 f ensuite acheter 2 sacs d'arachide à 28 000 f enfin le reste des 102 000 f pour le transport et le fonds de roulement afin de vendre. Dans le quartier de Aoua il n'y a pas de marché à coté ce qui fait que la vente du céréale marche bien et en plus de cela, elle propose des céréales de bonne qualité à ses clients et respect ses clients.Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et de continuer ses activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Aoua is married and the mother of 6 children. She is 53 years old. She sells cereals in her neighbourhood, she has been exercising this activity for six years.

Aoua needs a loan to buy three bags of millet for 20,000f, then to buy 2 bags of groundnuts for 28,000f, finally the remainder of the 102,000f for transport in order to sell. In Aoua's neighbourhood there is no market nearby which means that the cereal sales are doing well, in addition to which she offers good quality cereals to her clients and respects her clients.

After her sales, she will have a profit that will allow her to grow her savings, to take care of her family and to continue her activities. She has already received a loan twice and has reimbursed at the agreed dates to ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy millet for 20,000f, ground nuts for 25,000f, beans for 28,000f and the remaining 102,000f for transport and working capital.

loans.name: Marie May

texts.fr: Marie a 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de produits alimentaires à domicile. Cette boutique lui procure des revenus nécessaires pour prendre soin de la famille et déposer un peu d’argent sur son compte d’épargne. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de chips et des caisses de jus en bouteille.

loans.use: acheter des sacs de chips et des caisses de jus en bouteille

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.en:
Sandra and her husband have had to work very hard to be able to give only what is necessary to their three children. They live in the city of Escobedo in the state of Nuevo Leon. But it has been two years since she was left unemployed and started to look for another job, but it was long before she could find one. With desparation in not having enough to cover all the expenses, she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue, and in this manner be able to help her husband and cover the basic necessities for their children.

The love of her family carried Sandra to find a business that would permit her to have some extra income, but now she needs a loan of $200 to continue with her project, of which she will repay in a term of 3-6 months. Help Sandra maintain what she has achieved so far. Don\'t hesitate and help her. She needs your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra y su esposo han tenido que trabajar muy duro para poder dar solo lo necesario a sus 3 hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Sin embargo hace 2 años ella se quedó sin empleo y comenzó a buscar otro, pero tardo mucho tiempo sin encontrarlo. Ante la desesperación de no tener lo suficiente para hacer frente a los gastos, ella comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, y de esta forma poder ayudar a su esposo y cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.

El amor a su familia llevó a Sandra a encontrar una actividad que le permitiera tener algunos ingresos extras, pero ahora ella necesita un préstamo de $200 dólares para continuar con su proyecto, mismo que planea regresar en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Ayuda a Sandra a sostener lo que hasta ahora ha logrado, no lo dudes y apóyala, ella requiere de tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flora Wanjiku intends to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Doum

texts.en:
Mrs. Doum S. is a 41 year old mother of 5 children who are students and lives with her husband (pictured here because S. is at home) in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking meals for her family. To supplement the family's income, S.'s husband, meanwhile, makes about $16/day in revenue by purchasing, feeding and selling cows to retail businesses. To help with this, S. is asking for $1000 loan to purchase more cows to invest in this business activity. 
For the coming years her husband plans to increase more cows in his livestock, so that two or three years ahead he will make additional income for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for a business.

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.en: Nancy owns a very unique business in Ayacucho, Peru, a vegetarian restaurant.  She opened the restaurant over seven years ago in hopes that locals would enjoy the new style of food.  Nancy has been a vegetarian for nine years and thinks it is a healthy way of life.  “Carne D. soya” or soy meat was not a popular choice at first, but recently many customers have caught on to the delicious and nutritious meals.  The restaurant serves traditional Peruvian food, with the exchange of soy for meat.  She has six children, two of whom live with her and four of whom are on their own.  Nancy has been a loyal member of FINCA for 4 years and hopes to receive a next loan of $500 to purchase more tables and chairs to seat and serve her increasing number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs.

loans.name: Marleni Maruja

texts.es:
Senora Marleni is 38 years old. She completed her secondary education, and she lives in the neighborhood of the Virgin de la Puerta in San Isidro. She has 2 young daughters who depend on her.

Marleni has a general store in her house. Two years ago she decided to dedicate herself to this business, selling from her house to be able to take care of her children. She started with a few products such as rice, oil and milk. She wanted to grow her business but she did not have capital. Then her mother in law, who worked in a communal bank in Carabamba, told her about the institution and the communal bank "San Judas Tadeo". with the first loan of approximately $95 that she received, Marleni was able to open the store, buying other products such as sodas, crackers, bathroom tissue, etc.

Marleni tells us that she will continue to work as long as God allows her to, because she wants to continue to improve her situation, especially for her children.

La señora Marleni tiene 38 años de edad y estudió secundaria completa, vive en el barrio Virgen de la Puerta del sector San Isidro, del Distrito de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 2 hijas menores de edad que dependen de ella. Tiene una bodega en su domicilio. Hace doce años decidió dedicarse a la bodega vendiendo en su casa para que de ese modo pueda cuidar a sus hijas; empezó con unos cuantos productos como: arroz, aceite y leche; deseaba implementar su negocio pero no tenía capital, es ahí cuando su suegra socia de un banco comunal de Carabamba le informa sobre la institución y forma el Banco Comunal “San Judas Tadeo”, con el primer préstamos que recibió de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $96) pudo implementar la bodega, comprando otros productos como gaseosas, galletas, papel higiénico, etc. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,100 ($ 354.00 aprox.) comprará productos al por mayor para obtener mejores precios: arroz, leche, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. La señora Marleni nos dice que continuará trabajando hasta que Dios le permita porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia especialmente a sus hijas.

loans.use: Buy every day products such as rice, sugar, milk, etc for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Krut

texts.en:
Mr. K. Krut, 63, and his wife, Mrs. Aum Ram, 57, have been married since 1969. They have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and living in different houses. One of his sons does construction work with him and the other three children are studying in local school. Krut’s home is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been a construction contractor since 2000 and does farming since he was young. His wife is doing farming too. They both work hard for supporting their children’s studies to the highest possible level. After getting loans from Maxima many times, his life is getting better and better.

Now he is requesting his fifth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700. He will use this loan to buy materials for construction work and buying fertilizer and pesticides for farming business.

loans.use: Buying materials for construction work and buying fertilizer and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Gilas

texts.ru:
Ms. Gilas M. lives in the suburb of the town of Saatli, Azerbaijan located in the South Caucasus. Gilas is 44. She shares a small village house with her parents providing for them in their old age. Gilas small income comes from sale of milk of the two cows that she purchased two years ago. The daily 8 liters of milk from the two cows sell for about $1.50. Obviously, this is not enough to sustain Ms. M.’s family. She plans to use this loan to purchase another milk cow. Gilas hopes that in 8 months she will be able to increase her income from milk sales by 100%.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Г-жа Гилас живет в пригороде Саатлы Республики Азербайджан расположенном в Южном Кавказе. Ей 44 года и она живёт в месте с её родителями в деревенском домике, обеспечивая как можно их старость. Она имеет доход, очень низкий с2-x коров, которых они купили 2 года тому назад, продавая молоко на местном рынке. Ежедневный надой с коров составляет 8 литров, т.е. приблизительно 1 доллар и 50 центов. Этого конечно не хватает на удовлетворение нужд семьи. В настоящее время Гилас обратилась в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА с заявлением о предоставлении ей кредита на сумму $600 для покупки телёнка дойной породы. Таким образом через 8 месяцев она планирует увеличить свой доход от продажи молока на 100 процентов

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina invests all the time she can in her fields and in caring for her three children, whom she adores and for whom she works very hard. She grants us a clear indicator when we see her in her house disinfecting the seeds that will soon be carried to her fields for planting. They will yield a harvest in 6 months and will become food for her family and for other consumers. Farmers always have to be very careful with the planting since that is the first step in achieving their production goals and in increasing their income. This is why they disinfect the seeds so carefully. A big limiting factor for her is not being able to buy more seeds due to the fact that their price is very significant in the local market of her city. She needs a loan to so as not to leave unachieved her hopes for her production. You can collaborate with Ricardina just by being a participant in such a noble cause.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ricardina invierte el mayor tiempo posible a su chacra y al cuidado de sus tres hijos quienes son su adoración y por quienes trabaja arduamente. Nos otorga un claro indicador cuando la observamos trabajando en su casa desinfectando las semillas que prontamente serán llevadas a sus terrenos para comenzar la siembra los mismos que después de 6 meses darán frutos y se convertirán en alimento para su familia y sus consumidores.Siempre los agricultores tienen que ser muy cuidadosos en la siembra pues es el primer paso para lograr sus metas de producción y el aumento de sus ingresos económicos, es por ello que desinfectan minuciosamente las semillas.Una gran limitación para ella es el no poder tener la capacidad de comprar mayor cantidad de semillas puesto que su precio es muy significativo en el mercado local de su ciudad, es así que ahora necesita de un préstamo para no dejar inconcluso sus deseos de producción.Usted puede hoy colaborar con Ricardina con tan solo ser partícipe de tan noble causa

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of seeds

loans.name: Wanyama West C (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to start a business selling clothes. Betty is 39 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from ages 12 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Mugabi B. and Jennifer K.. Mugabi B. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge and add stock. Jennifer K. is currently operating a business selling beer and wants a loan to add to her business.

loans.use: To venture into a business selling clothes

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Mr. Kann N. is 52 years old, and he drives a motorbike equipped with a cart to transport coal and firewood to Phnom Penh, where it is used to cook food. He lives in Kong Roth Village in the Kampong Speu Province, and he has six children. Four of his children are enrolled in a local school, while the other two children work in a garment factory. His wife, Phos Hang, pictured on the right, is a farmer, and she usually travels with her husband so that they can sell their coal and wood together. Mr. Kann N. has encountered problems with the police because they often fine him on the road. He has received one loan previously from AMK, the proceeds of which were used to buy pigs and to build a pig stall. Last year, Mr. Kann N. contracted tuberculosis, and he had to pay approximately $750 to treat the disease. However, he is now in good health, and is seeking another loan to repair his house. In addition, any excess loan proceeds would be used to buy more coal and firewood to sell in order to generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: To repair his family's house and to purchase additional coal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is one of the Kiva clients who received a previous loan of $175 to increase her stock of palm oil. With the profit Marie was able to send her children back to school, as they were sent away due to a lack of required school fees. She said that the loan opened an opportunity for her to expand her business and earn more income than before. Marie is therefore requesting a loan of Le.800,000 to purchase 70 gallons of palm oil to further expand her business.

loans.use: Marie would like to increase her stock of palm oil.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mr. An S., 52, lives in the Kean Svay district, a rural region about 12 kilometers from the capital city of Cambodia, Phnom Penh. He lives with his wife of nearly thirty years, Jam They, and two of their six children (pictured above). An buys bananas from local farmers and transports them to Phnom Penh, where he sells them in the market. He is also a mason, constructing and repairing nearby homes. His wife Jam collects flowers from farmers and also travels to Phnom Penh to sell them in markets to local customers. 

An is seeking his first loan from Kiva and its field partner Maxima of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for two of his children who work in Phnom Penh. One son works as a bus driver while his sister has a job as a cashier nearby. Because of the rising cost of fuel, and the long distance between Phnom Penh and Kean Svay, they are forced to live in the city. This is both expensive and difficult for the family, who would both enjoy and benefit financially from the two children living at home. A motor taxi costs 20,000 Cambodian Riel (about $5) to drive from Phnom Penh to Kean Svay, much more than the family can afford.

With the motor, An’s children can live at home with him and his wife. They will be able to save money transporting them back and forth to Phnom Penh and can use the money to help expand their banana and flower businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chuon S. is a woodman in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Nil So, helps his wife with her current business. They have eight children, two of whom are employed while the remaining six are enrolled in school. In order to support her family, Mrs. Chuon S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Previously, Mrs. Chuon S. has obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart to transport her firewood to sell. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Allah Ditti

texts.en:
Allah Ditti Baji is the wife of M. A. and has been living in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the last 30 years. Her family consists of twelve members. She is the mother of nice children. Her husband has a decorative embroidery business, having an experience of 25 years.

Allah Ditti Baji is a housewife and helps her husband in making dresses with decorative embroidery. Her husband also sells crockery. She owns a double-storey four-room brick house. She successfully completed her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (cloth, needles, thread) for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Carlos Rafael

texts.es:
Carlos Rafael M. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi . Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. 

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.
El  es una persona de mediana edad esta trabajando en una empresa de bebidas y su esposa la señora Sarai labora en una empresa como cajera y juntos como familia están solicitando este préstamo para construir un baño para su casa, así en un futuro brindarle una comodidad a su familia y tener un mejor modo de vivir.
texts.en:
Carlos Rafael M. M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. He is a middle aged person who is working in a drink business. His spouse, Señora Sarai labora, works in a business as a cashier. Together, as a family, they are asking for this loan in order to build a bathroom for their house, which in the future would offer convenience to the family and enable them to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma C. Quicana, a member of FINCA Perú in the community bank, Lila, is a single mom living in Ayacucho with her two children aged 16 and 14. To support her family Norma sells fruit at a busy market in Ayacucho. From her home, she also sells guinea pig (a traditional Ayacuchan dish) and pork.

Norma is requesting a loan to purchase more products to sell including more pork, guinea pigs, bananas, oranges, mandarins and apples. She dreams of being able to pay for her wedding and to purchase a store in Ayacucho where she will be able to sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell including more pork, guinea pigs, bananas, oranges, mandarins and apples.

loans.name: Norita

texts.es: La señora Norita pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Fernando II”, ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytia Nº 571, distrito D. Manantay, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, 5 D. ellos mayores D. edad y uno que aún depenD. D. ella y está separada D. su esposo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio, la venta D. comida. Trabaja con la ayuda D. su hermana y ambas se dedican a su hogar y a su negocio. n nCon este préstamo D. S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 kilos D. arroz, 5 pollos, 6 kilos D. carne, 7 kilos D. pescado, verduras y otros.nnNorita manifiesta que Manuela Ramos apoya a todas aquellas mujeres trabajadoras y tiene el deseo D. surgir en la vida.nn
texts.en:
Norita belongs to the Communal Bank, "San Fernando II", located in the district of Manantay in the city of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali state. She is 49 years old and is the mother of 6 children- 5 of which are of age and 1 that still depends on her. She is separated from her husband. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling food. She has worked with the communal bank for 2 years. Currently, she is dedicated to the same business, the sale of food. She works with the help of her sister. Both are dedicated to their home and their business. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 6 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 6 kilos of meat, 7 kilos of fish, vegetables, and other foods. Norita claims that Manuela Ramos supports all working women and has the desire to rise up in life.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, chickens, meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Los Rebeldes Group

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FANNY ES LA REPRESENTA DEL GRUPO  "LOS REBELDES"  ELLOS SON PERSONAS QUE SE CONOCEN Y QUE YA HAN TRABAJO JUNTAS EN ANTERIORES OPORTUNIDADES. CADA SOCIOS TIENE SU PROPIO RUBRO COMERCIAL COMO LA VENTA D. COMIDA, ROPA, COSMÉTICOS ALGUNOS SE DEDICAN A LA PLOMERÍA Y A LA EDUCACIÓN RURAL SUS ACTIVADADES SON EL SUSTENTO D. SU FAMILIA POR LO QUE LE PONEN MUCHAS GANAS AL PROGRESO D. SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA. EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO D. SUS NEGOCIOS ASÍ COMO PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÍA  Y HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO. ALGUNAS D. LAS INTEGRANTES COMENTA QUE ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE TRABAJARA CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS PERO QUE SABE LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE IMPLICA UN FINANCIAMIENTO EN ESPECIAL CUANDO ESTA DESTINADO A MEJOR SUS INGRESOS Y LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
Fany represents the group "Los Rebeldes" (meaning, The Rebels). They are individuals that know each other and have already worked together in previous opportunities. Each one of the members has their own business, such as the sales of foods, clothing, cosmetics, and some others are plumbers and teachers in rural areas. Their businesses are the means to support their family which is why they work so hard to advance the progress of their stands. The loan will be used to improve the businesses and to increase the merchandise and purchase work tools. Some of the members have commented that this wll be the first time working in a community group but they are aware of the responsibility imposed by a loan. The loan will be used to improve their earnings and to improve the quality of life for their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Razia Waris Masih Sahoutra Group

texts.en:
My name is Razia and I’m 37 years old and a married lady. I reside in a famous historical place named Yadgar of City Lahore, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 20 years. I got my education up until the 8th grade but for more education, I didn’t show any interest. From the beginning I have had an interest in sewing clothes and embroidery. My husband's name is W. M. S. and he has a scrap business. He sells scrap to the community. In particular, he keeps iron in his stock, and people come to sell and buy iron and other iron items from him. 

I have six children: four daughters and two sons. My eldest daughter is in the 9th grade. The one next to her is in the 8th standard. The youngest to her is in the 7th standard, and my youngest daughter is in the 4th standard. My sons are also read in the 4th standard. I and my husband have decided to share the financial burden. I help him by paying the children’s education expenses through sewing clothes, and he bears the house expenses through his income. I successfully repaid my five loans which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for a loan to buy more scrap (iron) to increase the income of my husband. 

I am a group leader of a few more women of my locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy paint for her paint business. Shahnaz baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap (iron) for the scrap business

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea P. was born in 1958 and she now lives in Sotep village in Kampong Cham province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock then re-sell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her current business. Her husband, Mr. Y. Oeurn, owns a small rice mill with which he can make an income. Mrs. Kea P. has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are construction workers and the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her current business.

loans.name: Giwa

texts.en: Giwa A. is 63 years old and married with 9 children. He has a shop where he sells spare motor parts. A. is requesting the loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says, "Thanks!" to Kiva and all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem M., 27, is married and resides in the Prey Veng province with her husband. She works in a garment factory and makes US$3 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is a blacksmith and is able to make US$5 every day. This couple has one young child. Chhem M. would like to purchase blacksmith materials so that her husband can expand his business to have more income to raise their family.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Justina has been a soap seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She belongs to the Urafiki group loan (Group code 2007). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Justina is 40 years old, married, and has four children: ages 21, 19, 8 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rose, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more soap for resale

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора - молодая девушка 22 лет. Незамужем. Занимается откормом скота, помогает родителям. Её отец пастух. Пасет свой скот и заодно чужой скот за деньги. Через 3-4 месяца он продает свой скот на рынке. Её мать занимается переработкой пряжи и тоже продает на рынке. Нигора старается помогать маме и отцу, чтобы их бизнес улучшился и они могли получать больше дохода.
texts.en:
Nigora is a young woman of 22. She is unmarried, and assists her parents in raising cattle. Her father is a herder, who grazes his own cattle and hires out his services to herd other people's livestock. Every three to four months he sells his cattle at the market. Nigora's mother spins yarn and also sells at the market. Nigora is trying to assist her mother and father to improve their business and increase their profits.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa B., 39, lives in Labakid, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte with her husband Rolando and their six children. The big family was once a happy family but unfortunately they suffered financial problems due to the costs of educating their children at the college level. To cope, Narcisa became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative so that she could borrow additional capital for her vegetable-growing business. Now applying for her fourth loan of Php 7,000.00, she wants to buy farm inputs for her vegetable garden so that it will grow healthy. The small amounts previously borrowed from Paglaum MPC have helped to augment the production of her garden and send their children to school.

Narcisa plans to add more seedlings to increase production to earn more income. She and her husband also plan to improve their lifestyle. As Narcisa says, "Paglaum is the bridge to our better future".

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Mamatkul

texts.ru: Барлибаев Маматкул- мужчина 50 лет. Женат имеет 4-х детей. Маматкул имеет 12 летный стаж в сфере жывотновотства. Маматкулу помогают жене и дочка. Маматкул подрабатывает на стройке. Каждый месяц сын Маматкула с Росии присылает деньги. Его жена домохозяйка. Она также помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Утром и вечером она доит корову и продаёт молоко. Овцы и козы пасутся в горах на пастбище. Маматкул очень любить свою работу так как он этим занимается с юношеского возраста.
texts.en:
Mamatkul B. is a 50 year old man. He is married and has four children. Mamatkul has twelve years of experience in the field of agriculture. Mamatkul's wife and daughter help him. He also works part time in construction. Every month Mamatkul's son sends money from Russia. His wife is a housewife and she also helps take care of the cattle. In the mornings and evenings she milks the cow and sells the milk. The sheep and goats are on the pastures in the mountains. Mamatkul loves his work very much and he has been doing it since he was a young man.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo  vive en la calle # 22 de la zona villa Tunari en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es soltero vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos en casa de sus familiares. 

Trabaja como ayudante en un taller de carpintería,  donde realizan muebles tallados en madera, los días jueves y domingos vende material de plomería al por menor en la feria principal de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de más material de plomería para incrementar sus ventas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Rodrigo lives on the Calle #22 in the Villa Tunari zone in the city of El Alto. He is single, and he lives with his mother and siblings in the family house. He works as a helper in a carpentry shop where they carve furniture from wood. On Thursdays and Sundays he makes retail sales of plumbing material in his city’s main fair. The loan is to buy more plumbing material to increase his sales. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Маматкулова Мавлюда-  женщина 1955-го года рождения, замужем, имеет 4-х детей.Занимается откормом и  купля-продажей скота . Её муж  Маматкулов Абдулажон  покупает скот на скотных рынках кишлаков и сёл по низким ценам. Мавлюда  откармливает купленный скот дома в течении недели и продает на скотном рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района. Кроме этого она и её муж работают в колхозе. Там они имеют небольшой земельный участок и выращивают овощи и пшеницу. Мавлюда и её муж рады, что кредитуются у нас и намерены продолжить сотрудничество с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mavluda M. is a woman who was born in 1955, married and has four children. She feeds and sells cattle. Her husband Abdulajon Mamatkulov buys the cattle on the markets of other villages at low prices. Mavluda feeds the cattle at home for a period of one week and then sells on the cattle market of the Jabbor-Rasulov region. Besides that her husband works in a collective farm. There they have a small plot of land and grow vegetables and wheat. Mavluda and her husband are glad that they take out loans from us and are determined to continue working with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder tiene 25 años, es un joven muy responsable, el mayor de 6 hermanos que viven en la casa de sus padres. En vista de la enfermedad de su padre decidió hacerse cargo de la educación de sus hermanos menores, desde entonces siembra papas, arvejas y habas en chacras alquiladas, pagando por el arriendo entre 600 a 700 soles por cada siembra. Para esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y los fines de semana, de sus hermano y su padre. Wilder está muy contento de labrar la tierra y ser útil para su familia, eso lo llena de mucha alegría. Últimamente ha decidido sembrar sus propios cultivos para sus gastos personales, ahora en la chacra de papas, donde posa para la foto, va sembrar arvejas aprovechando los nutrientes del abonado de la siembra anterior. Nos cuenta que lo que requiere de mayor inversión es el cultivo de la papa, debido a la necesidad de fertilizantes y cuando no obtiene un buen precio en el mercado no alcanza las ganancias esperadas, es por ello que se va a dedicar más a la siembra de arvejas para alcanzar sus anhelos de contar con sus propias chacras. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, durante los tres ciclos pasados demostró honestidad y puntualidad en sus pagos y trata de asistir a todas la reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy cómodo con todos los demás integrantes. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de dos bolsas de arvejas (semilla) en una variedad mejorada para que resista las diversas circunstancias climáticas.
texts.en:
Wilder, 25, is a very responsible young man. He is the oldest of six siblings who live at home with their parents. In light his father’s illness, Wilder decided to be in charge of his younger siblings’ education. From then on he planted potatoes, peas, and beans in rented fields. He pays between 600 and 700 PEN for each planting. His mother helps him with the work. During the week ends his father and his siblings help him. Wilder is very happy to work the land and to be useful to his family. This fills him with joy. He has decided to plant his own crops for his own personal expenses. In the potato fields, where he poses for the photo, he will plant peas to take advantage of the fertilizer’s nutrients from the last planting. He needs more investment in his potato crop due to the need for fertilizers. When he does not get a good price at the market, he does not reach his expected income. That is why he is going to plant more peas to reach his goal of having his own fields. This is his fourth loan with MFP. During the past three loan cycles he has demonstrated honesty and punctuality in his payments. He tries to attend all of his community bank’s meetings. He feels very comfortable with all of the other members. The money he is asking for is to buy two bags of peas (seeds) in a better variety so that they resist the diverse climate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalina P. is from the village of Sta. Cruz Jimenez. She is 29 years old. Magdalina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalina raises pigs for sale. Magdalina has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately Php 2,000.00 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Magdalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalina is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This will be Magdalina's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en: Nafisa is fort years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and three daughters. All of her children are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. Nafisa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings by the roadside. She buys her raw material such as maize, sugar, etc. from Techiman where she claims cost is effective. She has been in business for over twenty – nine years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Nokwaredie Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 55 years old she is married and the mother of six children. Two of her children are in school whiles the rest are working. She is very resourceful to her family in provision of food and payment of bills. She is a farmer, food vendor and sells kenkey with fried fish taking with pepper spice. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nokwaredie’ which literary means ‘Truthfulness’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Rona Lorraine

texts.en:
Rona Lorraine is managing a grocery store located in Echague public market. She is 29 years old and still single.  She is very eager to improve her business and with her strong determination to succeed in life, she now wanted to expand her grocery to further generate bigger capital to help in providing the needs of her family.  

Rona wanted to request for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP25, 000 that she will use for her grocery store. She is hoping that she could buy additional merchandise for her store to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: 40-year-old Estelita B. lives on rice farming in her hometown in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She lives with her husband and their 4 children. She experienced failure in her farming business especially when in short of financial assistance. A new member of CEV, she is requesting for a loan of Php6, 000. Estelita will use the loan to purchase farm inputs. Hopefully, this loan will help Estelita grow her farm and eventually produce a good harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Mrs. Vorleak Oem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vorleak O. is the president of the Pun Phnum village bank in Takeo province. She is the leader of an eight member group. All of the members of the group will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Vorleak O., a 25 year old widow, sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Since her business is doing well, she would like to expand it by purchasing more produce to resell in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 35, lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang, Cambodia, where she owns a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year.  She was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of two school-aged children. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, her husband climbs the palm trees to tap the palm juice and turns it into palm sugar for a profit. Neang S. will use her first loan to purchase a cow. She will use the cow to help reduce her hard labor on the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Jackline Nangami

texts.en:
Jackline K. is married to Lloyd and they have two children, Samuel and Zebedi. The client was introduced to KADET by existing clients, and has no previous credit history. She intends to use the loan to add stock of beauty products in the shop.

Her business is within a highly populated residential area. With the extra profit she anticipates to get, the client intends to re-stock her beauty shop.

Jackline hopes to own a cosmetic shop in future as she believes she is hard-working and sincere.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add stock in her salon

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has owned a blacksmith shop in his town since 1997. He is a 25-year-old single man and living with his parents and three brothers and sisters. He helps his father towards providing better life conditions for the family. Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy iron and welding equipment for his business.

loans.use: To buy iron and welding equipment

loans.name: Kodirchon

texts.ru: Рахмонов Кодирчон проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Кодирчон более 5 лет работал бухгалтером в местной компании. Вот как более 7 лет предоставляет услугу "такси". Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины, т.к. эта автомашина является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Kodirchon R. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Kodirchon had worked as an accountant at a local company for over 5 years. Since then, he has been providing taxi service for over 7 years. He is requesting a loan in order to repair his car because this car is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina A. sells dried cassava, which is a primary ingredient of the flour for "ugali,"  a porridge-like side dish that is a food staple in Kenya. She buys the cassava every week and her current plan is to increase her inventory because it is the cassava harvest time for most farmers. She would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to buy cassava to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B., 52, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Carlos B., a machine operator, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for more than a year. She also sells prepaid mobile phone credits.

Rebecca has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for eight months now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow few times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy added stock for her store. Her two businesses let her earn an extra profit of 18,000 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as added capital for her expanding business, buying assorted beverages, snacks, and toiletries.

She dreams that her business will grow and that their standard of living will improve as well.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying assorted beverages, snacks and toiletries for her inventory

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan S., age 50, and her husband, Mr. Pheap Phoung, age 51, live in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
