They were married in 1979 and have five children, one of whom is a truck driver, one is a construction worker, and another two are in school.
 
Mrs. Nan S. has been a farmer for twenty years, growing rice and lotus. Her husband has been working for the council of the commune office for two years. When he is free, he also assists his wife with her farming business.

Nan is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase a water pump and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to use on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl D. has an 8 year old child. She is doing her best to be the best mom. That is why she is also doing her best in her seashells business. Seashells are expensive and popular in the market. She would like to invest more money in this business.

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 21,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy seashells to resell.

loans.use: To buy seashells to resell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El    Señor Juan José M. F., Labora como Colector  de ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, el tiene  cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y  tres se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, bloques y mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto en su casa de habitación.

 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Juan  dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan José M. F. works as a collector at the Roberto Huembés Market in Managua. He is married and has four dependent children, three of whom are attending school. Juan has been working with CEPRODEL for three years and has received three loans. During this time, he has invested the three loans into making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and blocks. He will also pay for the labor to build a room in his house. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children. Juan says that the loans he has received have all been designated for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build a room

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie F. is from the village of Macapare, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 64 years old. Rosemarie is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store which sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en casa propia con su esposo en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es jubilada rentista.

El crédito que solicita es para cambiar todo el sistema eléctrico de su casa, ya que como es casa antigua la humedad fue deteriorando los cables.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home with her husband in La Paz’s San Pedro neighborhood; she’s a retired dentist. She needs funds to replace the entire electrical wiring system in her house because, since her house is very old, humidity has damaged the electrical cables. She has been an Impro client since 2008 and always repays on time so she is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay to replace electrical wiring in her home because it’s very old and the cables are in poor condition due to humidity and weather.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 32, is the mother of three young children who are enrolled in the local public school and who are dependent on her. She is married to Yoeung Chan, 34, who works for a small firm in the building field.

C. is a garment laborer who has been doing her job since she was single, earning a specific salary of $110 a month. She has also been using her income to help solve the family’s financial crisis.

In the paste, C. hired a taxi to go to work or anywhere else because she doesn’t own a vehicle. She right now hopes to avoid the taxi fares and is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation for her family

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 39 años, vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos pequeños.Juntos viven en su casa que es propia.Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a la venta de ropa, actividad que realiza en  su casa. Su negocio lo maneja  de la siguiente manera : entrega  pedidos a la clientela, que usualmente son sus amigas y vecinas de barrio , pues la zona por donde vive es de dificil acceso , es por esta razón que a todas sus vecinas se les hace muy difícil salir a comprarlas al mercado del lugar . También destina una parte de su mercadería al norte del país donde tiene  familiares,  para que ellos mismos realicen las ventas en ese lugar . A María  le gusta mucho su trabajo pues puede realizarlo en los ratos libres y así puede dedicarse a su familia. En el  futuro  tiene pensado seguir mejorando su negocio e instalar una  tienda estable de ropa o un bazar.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos y no quiere defraudar a su grupo solidario.Tiene pensado destinar el dinero del crédito en la compra de  ropa para de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and lives with her partner and their 4 young children in their own home. This hardworking woman has been selling clothing out of her home for some time now. Her business is driven by orders from customers, who are usually her friends and neighbors. Her neighborhood is not easy to access and, for this reason, all her neighbors have difficulty going out to buy products. She also sends part of her merchandise to the north of the country where she has relatives that can carry out her sales in this area. María really enjoys her work as she can accomplish it in her spare time and still take care of her family. In the future, she is thinking about improving her business and installing an established clothing store or a variety store. This is the first loan she has had with MFP and she promised to be on time with her repayments as she doesn’t want to disappoint her solidarity group. She is thinking of using the money from the loan to buy clothing in order to improve her earnings and continue to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing in order to stock up her business.

loans.name: Rosa Eligia

texts.es: Rosa Eligia tiene 47 años.  No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues siempre son necesarios en su vida y negocio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de especies, por lo que tiene más de 8 años con este negocio, pues tiene que buscar como sufragar los gastos de los estudios de su hijo. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado adquirir más experiencia en el negocio y mejorar la comunicación con sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como leña, azúcar, arroz, saborizantes, bolsas entre otras cosas. sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa Eligia is 47 years old. This is not the first time that she has had loans; they have always been necessary in her life and her business. Her economic activity is preparing and selling spices. She has been in this business for more than 8 years, since she has to figure out how to deal with the expenses of her son's schooling. As time has passed, she has acquired more experience in the business and has improved communication with her customers. At this time she is asking for this loan to buy raw materials such as firewood, sugar, rice, seasonings and bags among other things. Her dream is for her children to finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Merencia

texts.en: Merencia M. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Merencia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas, coconuts and cassava in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merencia is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir trabaja como ayudante en una carpintería en aluminio; también es estudiante de la Universidad UPEA (Universidad Pública de El Alto); no tiene familia, vive solo en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una computadora para realizar sus trabajos en la universidad.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago y la buena inversión de coedito anterior le faculta la aprobación de otro  préstamo solicitado por Bladimir.
texts.en:
Bladimir is employed as an assistant in an aluminum carpentry shop. He is also enrolled at the UPEA University (El Alto Public University). He has no family. He lives alone in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto. He will use the funds to buy a computer for his university work. This is his 3rd loan with IMPRO. His good repayment history and investment of previous loan qualifies Bladimir for the new requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.name: Fresas ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Vitalina Pérez P., es originaria de Copainala Estado de Chiapas, México. Tiene 69 años de edad, está casada con el señor: José Pérez Rodríguez. En el cual tuvieron ocho hijos quien cada uno está casado. Ella tiene a su cargo a seis nietos de una hija que trabaja fuera de su pueblo.

 Vitalina, se dedica a comprar y vender productos de la región como son: puntas de chayote, frijol, durazno, entre otros. Y  tiene practicando esta actividad desde hace nueve años y ocho meses, el cual nos comenta  le ha ido muy bien desde que inicio esta actividad y la ha sacado de problemas, aunque tiene  que salir de su pueblo para vender su producto.

 Comenta que su inspiración por esta actividad es para obtener ganancias y aportar en los gastos de la casa, ya que su esposo ya no puede realizar las actividades en el campo por su estado de salud. De esa manera trabaja para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

 Con las ganancias piensa ahorrar para comprar más producto de la región y siga trabajando el préstamo que fundación realidad le otorga hasta que Dios le preste vida.

Ella es representante del grupo que solicitó el préstamo a FRAC por la invitación de una de las coordinadoras quien frecuentemente la visitaba y la animó a participar, el grupo se llama “Fresas” la razón del nombre es porque en ese lugar se cosecha esta fruta.

 Las personas que integran este grupo son:

 Isabel Muñoz García: se dedica a vender antojitos.
 Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: vende antojitos.
 María Nelly Pérez P.: se dedica a vender carnes.
 Vitalina Pérez P.: es la persona que se tomó la entrevista y vende productos de la región.
texts.en:
Vitalina Pérez P. is from Copainala in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is 69 years old, and she is married to José Pérez Rodríguez. They have eight children, and each one of them is married. She has eight grandchildren under her care because their mother, who is one of her daughters, works outside of their town. Vitalina buys and sells regional products like “chayote” (a type of squash) shoots, beans, and peaches among others. She has been doing this activity for nine years and eight months. She tells us that it has gone very well for her since she started, even though she has to leave her town to be able to sell her product. Her business has solved her problems. She comments that she was inspired to do this work to get earnings and to contribute to the household expenses. Her husband cannot do field work because of his health. She works to cover the household expenses. With her earnings she plans to save to buy more regional products. She will continue working with the loan from Fundación Realidad as long as God gives her life. She represents the group that requested the loan from FRAC. She joined because she was invited by one of the coordinators who frequently visited her and encouraged her to participate. The group is called “Fresas” (Strawberries) because this fruit is grown in the area. The people who comprise this group are: Isabel Muñoz García: Sells snacks Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: Sells snacks María Nelly Pérez P.: Sells meat Vitalina Pérez P.: The person who was interviewed; she sells regional products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The products sold at the market like beans, peaches, and chayote roots, among other things

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary Ann A. is from the P Malig-on, Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years of age and married to Maurolito A., an overseas seaman who is a Chief cook. She is blessed with 4 children whom are all now school aged. To make a living, she is presently engaged in food business and opened up a new Food Grill near her residence. She also receives support from her husband from his salary. She’s just started this business and earns approximately Php7,000.00 a month from this business activity. 

In the year 2007, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program has successfully repaid a loan of Php30,000.00 She is now requesting a loan amount of Php50,000.00 as her 7th loan to be used for her capital for operating her food grill business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, children’s education, loan repayments, insurance, and possible business expansion. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her newly opened Food Grill business.

location.town: Ozamis-P Malig-on, Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Oc

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu A. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu A. is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ratna S. (PK-10256).

Ni Putu A. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Putu A. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Putu A. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 250,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Putu A. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Putu A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,400,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Putu A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.

Ni Putu A. 0 (0) merupakan 35 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu A. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Ratna S. (PK-10256).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu A. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu A. menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 IDR.  Dalam 2008, Ni Putu A. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu A. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,400,000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,400,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a 42-year-old woman that has been blessed with six children, ranging in age from 9 to 19 years old. All of her children are still in school. She and her family live in Botbot, Pandan in the province of Antique. Though their village is far from the market and the main municipality, Eunice never allowed these circumstances hinder her from earning money. 

Eunice wanted to start a fishing business but was unable to do so because there was no business capital to start with. The vision of profiting from this kind of business made her join ASHI in 2004 and get a loan. At that point her fishing business was born, and with the help of her husband, Rolito, she has tried to keep it profitable.

Her husband catches the fish and she sells them around the village and nearby town. She is used to walking through the rough and narrow road covered with trees to earn money for her children and their education. She works despite rain, heat, and fatigue.

With her family and ASHI, Eunice can have her own business which will enable her to send all of her children to school through college, in the hopes that she can give them a better life.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of her fishing business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos y otros, la socia junto con otras socias venden productos secos en el mercado de Huancaro. Ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local para vender los productos secos.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos como trigo, maíz.moraya y quinua. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata." The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata which is in the province of Cusco and Cusco department. The member is Gladys. She is 28 years old and is a single mother who has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried goods and other products. Along with other members, she sells dried goods in the Huancaro market. She works from 6:00am until 5:00pm. She is building a good life for her children with this business. She wants to have a store to sell her dried goods. She is requesting a loan to buy dried goods such as wheat, corn, dried potatoes, and quinoa. The member is grateful to everyone who is part of this dream through this loan and promises to make her repayments according to the established timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried goods like wheat, corn, dried potatoes and quinoa.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo F. is from the city of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City.  He is 27 years old.  Bernardo is married and has an infant child.  To make a living, Bernardo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members.  Bernardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

Bernardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI.  Bernardo is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bernardo from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
La  Señora Nicolaza V. Muñoz tiene 33 años madre soltera tiene 2 hijos menores dependientes y la madre que tiene 61 años viven en sector de Aguirre está ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Doña Nicolaza V. Muñoz es agricultor produce papa, haba, avena forrajera en su terreno que tiene 1.2 hectáreas, también tiene ganado vacuno, es una persona humilde pero trabajadora,  necesitaba dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico y semilla de papa porque el capital que tenia ha gastado en la curación de sus madre que padece de una enfermedad gastritis, para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad y les piden muchos requisitos.
 
Pero se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona y ofertar crédito, la Sra. Nicolaza V. Muñoz está muy contenta de haber conseguido un crédito, ahora comprara los insumos agrícolas para sembrar, así recuperara su capital y poder ahorrar dinero para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos. La Sra. Nicolaza esta feliz porque podra comprar al abono y las semillas que estaba ncesitando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolaza V. Muñoz is 33 years old and a single mother to two dependent children. She also takes care of her 61-year-old mother. She lives in the Aguirre area, located 42 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Mrs. Nicolaza V. Muñoz is a farmer and produces potatoes, beans, and oats on her 1.2-hectare plot of land. She also has cattle, and is a humble but hard-working person. She needed money to buy agricultural inputs, like organic fertilizer and potato seeds, because she spent the money she had on her mother's gastritis treatments. It is very difficult for Nicolaza to go to banks in the city, since they ask her for many requirements. 

She did, however, take the initiative to travel to that area and offer loans. She is very pleased to have received this loan, and she will now buy seeds in order to earn the money back and save money so that she can send her two children to school. Nicolaza is happy to finally be able to buy the fertilizer and seeds she needed.

loans.use: Buy agricultural inputs (seeds and fertilizers)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret J. is 48 years old and a food kiosk owner in Magongo Mombasa.  She is married to Patrick Makoko and they are blessed with three children.
Margaret has been in this business for the last three years and has a good income. 

This is her second loan from KADET she would like to use the loan of 50,000 KES to carry out renovations to her kiosk and to purchase more food stuff to stock her kiosk. She will then use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  In the future she hopes to open up a restaurant

loans.use: To carry out renovations to her kiosk and purchase more food stuff to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Myraflor

texts.en: Myraflor T. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 23 years old. Myraflor is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Myraflor makes and sells chicken and pork barbecue. Myraflor has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Myraflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myraflor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients to make and sell. Myraflor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Myraflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Everlyne Achieng

texts.en:
Everlyne O. is 27 years old, is from Usenge in Kisumu, and is married to Joseph Oduor. They have three children between the ages of nine years and three and half years.

Everlyne has a stall selling green groceries like tomatoes and onions. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first one. She will use the money to buy more onions and tomatoes to add to her stock, and also build a better stall as the one she is in  is old and worn out.

Her desire is to have a big grocery in the market centre.

loans.use: To buy onions and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K. is a widower who lives with his school-going child in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a local trader of local natural seasoning products. Recently he bought a plot of land in the village.  He is looking for a loan of US$ 400 to pay for this purchase. He dreams of becoming a major seller of local products in a bigger place.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land in the village

loans.name: G.s. Santiaga Group

texts.es: La señora Matilde Rosa tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y plátanos.  Otra integrante de este grupo es Reyna tiene 34 años de edad, la señora obtiene ingresos de la venta de cosméticos, las cuales vende en el M.. La última integrante de este grupo es Dora Del Socorro, tiene 40 años es madre soltera  y tiene un hijo. Dora se dedica a una pulpería y venta de comida, pues además imparte clases como profesora es una persona muy emprendedora y juntas se han unido para realizar este crédito con el fin de invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Matilde Rosa is 40 years old, married and has one child in her care.  Her business is selling fruit and bananas.

Another member of the group is 34 year-old Reyna who makes income from selling cosmetics in the market.

The last member of this group is Dora Del Socorro.  She is 40 years old and a single mother with one child.  Dora runs a small grocery store and sells meals.  She also gives classes as a teacher.  She is a very enterprising person.

These women have come together to request this loan which they will invest in their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia tiene un kiosco escolar donde vende todo tipo de golosinas como chizitos, galletas, dulces, chicles, chupetines entre otros más, 
la socia es una persona muy optimista y con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que por este medio ella saca a su familia adelante,ella trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes desde las 08:00 hasta la 13:00pm.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería de golosinas para su negocio y así tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Victoria is 42 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has five children.  She has a school kiosk where she sells all types of things like puffed cheese snacks, cookies, sweets, gum, lollipops, and many more things.  She is a very optimistic person with a great desire to get ahead.  This is the way she gets her family ahead.  She works all day Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.

She is requesting the loan to buy more sweets for her business.  That way she will have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more sweets for her business in order to offer her customers a greater variety of merchandise

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with one young child. He lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, food and clothing.

Suleiman has operated a hawking business (small-scale trade) for the past 7 years, selling beans, rice and maize to his neighbors and passersby. Suleiman faces a major challenge of competition in his business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, Suleiman wants to establish another business; starting a beauty salon. He wants to purchase a hair dryer. 

Suleiman decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To establish a beauty salon and purchase a hair dryer machine

loans.name: Lucito

texts.en:
Lucito A. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old and single. Lucito owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. Lucito has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Lucito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucito has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Lucito is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide repair services

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru:
Гулзада Аязова родилась в селе Кожоке  (Ноокатский район, Ош обл., Кыргызская Республика). Ей 46 лет. С супругом воспитывает четверых детей (три сына и дочь). 
Гулзада родилась в простой семье. Она была средним ребенком среди детей, большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшими братьями и сестрами, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. Гулзада очень хорошо училась и мечтала стать учительницей. Окончив школу, она поступила в Ошский Государственный Университет на физико – математический факультет. После окончания ВУЗа, в 1984 году вышла замуж и планировала работать по профессии, но на заработную плату учителя было тяжело прожить, и Гулзада с мужем решают заняться разведением скота. За 10 лет, начав с одного ягненка, супруги увеличили поголовье скота,на собранные деньги от его реализации, они построили небольшой дом в селе. В то время на каждую семью выделялось лишь  4 сотки земли, на которой практически нечего было сажать, затраты не покрывались полученным урожаем. В 2000 году семья решает переехать в Чуйскую долину, так как существовать  в родном селе было уже тяжело, продают дом и весь скот. Переехав в село Алексеевка (северная часть страны), семья Гулзады покупает дом и на остальные средства приобретает одну дойную корову и двух овец. С тех пор прошло 11 лет, через многие испытания прошла семья: в 2005 году Гулзада с мужем решают посадить пшеницу, но из-за спада сцен на зерно, супруги потеряли большие средства. Для покрытия расходов и возврата долгов, Гулзаде пришлось продать  почти весь скот.  Благодаря упорству,  трудолюбию и взаимной поддержке, семья Гулзады выстояла и продолжает свой бизнес. Сегодня в хозяйстве Гулзады - два бычка на откорме, две головы телят, также она дополнительно занимается выращиванием картофеля.  
Гульзада обратилась в Компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков и овцематок. Доходы Гульзада планирует использовать для оплаты контрактов на обучение детей. 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.
texts.en:
Gulzada A. was born in the village of Kozhoke (in the Nookatsky area of the Osh region of the Kirghiz Republic). She is 46 years old. She and her husband have four children (three sons and a daughter).

Gulzada was born into a simple family. She was the middle child, and spent most of her time working around the house: she looked after younger brothers and sisters, did her homework and did some housework.  Gulzada did very well in school and dreamed of becoming a teacher. After graduationg, she entered Osh State University in the physics and mathematics department. After finishing school, she married in 1984 and planned to work in her trade, but it was too difficult to live on a teacher’s wages.  Gulzada and her husband decided to raise cattle. They began with one single lamb, and for ten years increased their livestock.  With the money they made, they constructed a small house in the village. At that time, 400 square meters of undeveloped land were allocated to each family.  Unfortunately, the income from selling the crop did not cover the expense of planting.  In 2000 the family decided to move to the Chuysky valley to their native village.  It was very difficult to sell their house and all of the cattle. When they moved to the village of Alekseyevka (in the northern part of the country), Gulzada’s family bought a house, one milk cow, and two sheep. Eleven years have passed since then.  The family has had many hardships: in 2005 Gulzada and her husband decided to plant wheat, but because of a recession affecting the price of grain, the couple lost a great deal of money.  To pay their debts, Gulzada had to sell all of their cattle. Thanks to persistence, diligence, and family support, Gulzada’s family has made it through and continues to work in their business. Today Gulzada’s farm has two calves being fattened, two young cows, and she is cultivating potatoes.  

Gulzada had approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and ewes.  Gulzada plans to use any money she makes to pay to educate her children.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: San Buenaventura Group

texts.es:
En la zona denominada Peguajho, ciudad de Paraguari, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el fín de interiorizarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, resultándoles una excelente oportunidad, decidieron realizar la reunión para la conformación del comité.   
El comite lleva por nombre San Buenaventura por haberse creado en fecha próxima a la celebración del día del Santo patrono de dicha ciudad, ellas se comprometen a mantenerse unidas y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mútuo entre todas, actualmente se encuentran en el  sexto ciclo con calificación excelente.
La sra. Feliciana se dedica a vender comestibles preparados por ella misma, es una mujer muy sacrificada pero desea poder prosperar junto con su familia, trabaja mucho para poder pagar sus deudas en tiempo y forma, ella espera que los inversionistas puedan apoyarle económicamente mediante Kiva. Si se le otorga el crédito lo invertiría en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los comestibles que luego vende.
texts.en:
In the Peguajho area of the town of Paraguari a group of women met in order to familiarize themselves with the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya; as it seemed to be an excellent opportunity for them, they decided to meet again to discuss the structure of the group.
The group was named San Buenaventura for having been established on a date close to Paraguari’s Patron Saint’s celebration day. They commit to keeping together and to working in mutual respect of all the members, and they are currently working their sixth cycle with an excellent result.
Feliciana engages in selling food she herself prepares. She is a very self-sacrificing woman, but she desires to prosper together with her family. She works a lot in order to be able to punctually repay her debts, and she hopes the lenders will be able to help her through Kiva. If the loan is granted to her, she will invest it in the purchase of ingredients to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to preare meals to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años, una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad hace 8 años con una nevera pequeña vendiendo hielo para sus clientes que tiene negocio en sus hogares.

Ella vende diariamente o cuando sus clientes lo necesitan, es viuda y tiene una hija de 16 años que todavía estudia. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar lana, hilo, productos Yanbal para aumentar sus ingresos. Ella en un futuro quiere abrir una papelería y  poder ayudar a su hija en sus próximos estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old; she is a hardworking woman that began working 8 years ago with a small refrigerator selling ice to her customers who have businesses in their homes.

Juana sells her items everyday or when her customers need her. She is a widow and has a 16 year old daughter that is still attending school. With the loan she will buy yarn, thread and Yanbal products to increase her income. In the future Juana hopes to have a stationary store and to help her daughter with her upcoming university education.

loans.use: buy yarn, threads and yanbal products.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie B. is from the village of Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old. Virgie is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling school products such pencils, pen and notebooks in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Virgie is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase products for her store. This will be the second loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her father). Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.    

Sarah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income with her motorcycle. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business. She lives in a home that she owns where she has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María Concepción T. C. tiene 58 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura tiene dos cuadras de terreno en las cuales siembra papas, maíz, arveja, habas chochos, cebada trigo, melloco, tiene dos cabezas de ganado, cerdos y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar más ganado y un terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta dedicarse a las labores de la casa, (cocinar, lavar), festejar las fiestas del carnaval y las del María Auxiliadora.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion T. C., 58, lives in Bolivar province with her husband and children.  She has 4 children.

The members of the GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA community bank meet in Carbon Chinipamba, some 20 minutes from our office.  Most of the group's members make a living from farming, raising livestock or running small businesses.  Some grow rice, beans, quinoa, potatoes, etc. and some raise dairy cows and other farm animals.  

Maria farms two parcels of land where she grows potatoes, maize, peas, beans, corn, wheat and other crops.  She also raises cattle, pigs and chickens.  She buys the supplies she needs in the market at Guaranda and sells what she produces in the wholesale market there.  

Maria is applying for a loan to buy animal feed and other supplies she needs for her livestock business.  The loan will help her generate the income she needs to live.  She faces challenges that include crop diseases and poor weather conditions.  She wants to buy more cattle and more land for sowing her crops.

Maria enjoys her daily routine (cooking, washing) and the holidays around Carnaval and the Feast of Maria Auxiliadora.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her livestock business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 50 years old, married and has four school-going children.  To earn a living, she sells radios, sockets and shoes.  She has operated the business for two years.  So far, she has employed one person in her business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records and this has helped her to run her business well.  She wants 50,000 KES to buy radios.

loans.use: To buy radios to sell

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Thong, age 53, is widow, as her husband died of senility years ago. Currently, she lives with her four children, two of whom are married and the other two who are single. All of the children are employed in different occupations. To make a living, Thong plants rice and some vegetable crops, which she sells out in the market when they are mature. One of her children is a fisherman, but now he is lacking tools to fish. Therefore, Thong is applying for a loan for her son to purchase a boat, a machine, and nets in order to support his business activities.

loans.use: to purchase a boat, a machine, and nets in order to support her son's business activities.

loans.name: Adelaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Adelaida, tiene  57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace algunos años, sus otros hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella viven dos nietas de 8 y 6 años que son de su hijo fallecido, ellas estudian en escuela .El marido es comerciante de material para reciclar.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para ayudad a su esposo el mismo que se  dedica a la comprar y venta de embases tanto de plástico como de aluminio (reciclar), el se desplaza por toda la ciudad comprando estos embases en las casas, lo que más compra son los tarros de leche, una vez que ha conseguido suficientes de estos embases el los lleva hasta los depósitos y locales donde venden pintura para que estos los utilicen para la venta de la pintura, nos cuenta que su esposo lleva más de 10 años que  se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a esto ellos siguen adelante y no les falta para sus sustento diario.

Este crédito es para comprar embases plásticos, aluminio y hierro entre otras cosas que sirven para reciclaje, Esta desde el principio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a su marido.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su marido realice el trabajo de una forma mas fácil.
texts.en:
In the sector know as Ascent to Heaven in the San Pablo neighborhood in the city of  Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank Subidita al Cielo [Ascent to Heaven] meet twice monthly.  It is in a very populated part of the city on the edge of the urban zone.  

Here lives Señora Adelaida.  She is 57 years old and is in a common law relationship from which she has seven children.  One of her children died several years ago and the others are older and independent.   Her son who passed away has two children ages 8 and 6 that live with her.  They both attend school.  Her husband works as a dealer of recycling materials.  

She is requesting a loan to help her husband who buys and sells plastic and aluminum containers (to recycle).  He travels around the city, house to house,  buying these containers.  He mostly buys milk cans.  Once he has enough of these he takes them to the places that fill and sell paint so that they can use them to sell the paint.  She tells us that her husband has been doing this for more than 10 years and thankfully, this has allowed them to get ahead and meet their daily needs.  

This loan will be use to purchase plastic, aluminum and iron containers for recycling.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning.  She likes the loans because they are a great help to her husband.  
 
Her dream is to buy a car to make her husband's job is easier.

loans.use: buy plastic, aluminum and iron containers.

loans.name: Kubanichbek

texts.en:
Kubanichbek is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in Echki-Bashy village. He graduated from State University and works as a trainer at the local school.

Unfortunately, the salaries of teachers in rural areas are very low and do not cover all household expenses. To create another source of income, in 2001 Kubanichbek started breeding cattle. With initial capital of 25,000 KGS, he bought cattle and managed to enlarge their number. Today he has an income of 8,000 KGS a month.

Now Kubanichbek is requesting a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from this loan, Kubanichbek plans to expand his livestock operation.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Batdulam

texts.en: Batdulam is  a 28 year old hard-working single woman who lives in her brother’s apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She runs a  business selling brand cosmetics in a shopping center.  Recently, she had a car accident and spent a lot of money on her medication. Her business was stopped for 5 months and it has not been working well since she came back from her accident. Batdulam is now planning  to reconstruct and expand  her  business.  She has had  some experience with loans and knows how to use her loan and how to repay it efficiently. The loan Batdulam is taking will be dedicated to reorganizing and expanding her cosmetics business.

loans.use: To reconstruct and expand her commercial business.

loans.name: Alfonso`s Group

texts.es:
Alfonso`s Group está conformado por tres miembros, el presidente es Alfonso.

Alfonso tiene 51 años vive en San Gabriel con su esposa y sus dos hijos los cuales tienen 25 y 19 años de edad y se decribe como una persona muy trabajadora ya que quiere sacar adelante su familia.

Trabaja en una pequeña carpintería con José donde procesa todo tipo de madera hace tres años aproximadamente.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con FODEMI desde el 2009, el crédito que requiere es para la compra de una máquina cepilladora de madera para optimizar tiempo y realizar mejor su trabajo.

Con la compra de esta cepilladora mejoraría la calidad de su trabajo y tendría mayor clientela, su sueño es de tener su propio local para instalar de una mejor manera su carpintería y ayudar economicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso`s Group is made up of three members; the president is Alfonso.

Alfonso is 51 years old, and lives in San Gabriel with his wife and two sons who are 25 and 19.  He describes himself as a hard worker and one who wants to move his family ahead in life.

For about the last three years, he has been working in a small carpentry shop with José, where he works with all types of wood.

This is his second time working with FODEMI since 2009.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a wood planing machine to optimize his time and allow him to do a better job.

By purchasing this planer, he will improve the quality of his work and have more customers.  His dream is to have his own premises to set up his carpentry shop in a better way, and to help his family financially.

loans.use: to buy a wood planing machine.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother). 

Hadjah   has a business selling soft drinks.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Hadjah sells her products door-to-door, retail.     

Hadjah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and passion fruit.  The main business challenges for   Hadjah include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she can get permanent business premises.   

 Hadjah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda and passion fruit.

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Rita’s group is comprised of three hard working women. Ritah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kamala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Ritah has a business of selling clothes. She has had this business for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Ritah hopes to expand her business. Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eralyn

texts.en:
Eralyn is 33 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Eralyn has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more goods such as soap, soft drinks etc. for resale.
Eralyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, soft drinks, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes such as pants, shirts, sweaters, and ponchos

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo Jr. is now 41 years old and chooses to be single. He lives with his parents in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for nearly 20 years and usually earns a profit of P25,000 in every harvest season. Eduardo uses his income for his daily consumption and saves some for future emergencies. He dreams of becoming financially stable in the future to help his parents who are rapidly aging.

Due to the high cost of commodities, Eduardo is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his rice farming business. He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will make improvements to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for rice farming.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Imelda has a flower shop where she provides decoration services for any occasion.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy flowers & materials for decorations.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flowers & materials for decorations

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 28-year-old single Lebanese man living with one parent and a sibling. Despite his young age, he chose to work as a painter four years ago in order to cover his family’s expenses. Today, he is a freelance painter. He’s asking to borrow 1,100 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools to properly do his job. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business by taking more Kiva loans and therefore be able to save enough money to get married.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 42 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has two children. She has a general store where she sells dry goods, such as sugar, salt, noodles, instant noodles, garlic, rice and many other things. She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has needed loans to expand her business, so she has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the 5th time she is borrowing money from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more dry goods to sell, like rice, beans, noodles and other goods.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is married and has two children. Lelia is 27 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga.

Lelia have general store from which she earns a living. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP14000 to purchase beverages and stocks for her general store. Lelia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Concordia has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more stock to resell.
Concordia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Concordia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 51 years old and is married with three children. For the past ten years she has had a sari-sari store (a food shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. She is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Corazon hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and a single lady.  She has been a tailor for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to cover her basic needs. 

Rose is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy textile materials to add to her shop. With the anticipated profit, she will expand her business. Her hope is to open a boutique shop, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To stock up on textile materials.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Doña María de oficio comerciante, se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace tres años , tiene 6 hijos es casada, vive en  la ciudad de Granada. La idea de empezar con su propio negocio surgió con la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares pues la situación económica es mas difícil y criar a 6 hijos todos ellos en edades escolares no es tarea fácil para una sola persona así que ella le ayuda a su marido atravez de su negocio y juntos aportan para el bienestar de su familia. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña para elaborar tortillas. Uno de sus sueños es tener una cocina industrial que le ayude a mejorar su nivel de producción y seguir  haciendo productivo su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a merchant who has worked making and selling tortillas for the past three years. She has six children, is married, and lives in the city of Granada. She decided to start her own business out of her need to help her husband with the family expenses since the economy is not doing well and raising six school-aged children is not an easy task for one person alone. As a result, she helps her husband through her business and together, they contribute to their family’s well-being.

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn and firewood for making tortillas. One of her dreams is to have an industrial kitchen to help her improve production and continue doing well in her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA GLOIRE DE DIEU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jacqueline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 52 ans arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire mais a appris la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis quinze ans à son domicile. Jacqueline est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Raoul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Jacqueline et son mari. Pour cette raison, Jacqueline vend divers articles de mercerie et du charbon de bois de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jacqueline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe LA GLOIRE DE DIEU, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter divers articles de mercerie et du charbon de bois .

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, 30, is a smallholder farmer residing in Nkubu, an agricultural town in the central region of Kenya. She is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Mercy's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Mercy made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. 

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan for expanding her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations and increase her overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to her children's education. With your loan, Mercy’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Elise

texts.en: In 2008, Elise learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Elise tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Elise loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income a big boost. Elise looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Cesar Alejandro

texts.en:
Cesar lives with his wife and their little one in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. Unfortunately two years ago he suffered an accident and now he finds himself unable to do heavy labour or anything requiring great physical effort. This is why he found himself in need to find some business that would permit him to keep providing sustenance for his family, and this is how he started a small grocery store. The situation has not been easy for him, for what he had to go through, but now with the great support of his loved ones he continues to struggle day after day.

Now Cesar needs a loan to be able to add variety to his small store and provide for his family. He needs $200, you have the ability to help, don’t leave him alone during this difficult time. Make your decision and help him. He will forever be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar, vive con su esposa y con su pequeño en la localidad de Monclova Coahuila. Desafortunadamente hace 2 años él sufrió un accidente y ahora se encuentra imposibilitado para laborar en trabajos pesados o que requieren de mucho esfuerzo, es por eso que se vio en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le permitiera poder llevar el sustento su familia, así es como inició con un pequeño puesto de abarrotes. No ha sido fácil para él la situación por la que ha tenido que pasar, pero con el gran a poyo de sus seres queridos el continua luchando día a día.

Ahora César requiere un préstamo para poder surtir su pequeña tienda y mantener a su familia, él necesita 200 DLLS, tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarlo, no lo dejes sólo en estos difíciles momentos, decídete y apóyalo, el te lo agradecederá por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs Thuy’s husband died 6 yeas ago. She has a daughter, Tram. Tram is 14 years old and is in grade 9. Mrs Thuy has no land and no capital. Thuy and her daughter are weak. Thuy suffers from stomach ache and sinusitis. Her daughter caught hepatitis B, so Thuy can’t work as a daily laborer.

She earns money by selling groceries at her hut. She is a good member of the project. She has always repaid her loan on time. She repaid her fifth loan of $60. Now she wants a $100 loan to buy goods in larger quantities and pay cash, which is cheaper, and to raise pigs. Their income increased by 2$/person/month to an average income of 12$/ person/month.

loans.use: Small selling

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din C. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  C. sells delicious traditional Khmer cakes in her village and can make about $5 per day.  Her husband is a security guard and makes about $3 per day.  Of their four children, two are employed at a local gas station, while the other two are still students.  They hope to use this loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for transportation to and from work.  Currently, they must hire a taxi to take them to and from work, which costs the family too much money.  In the future, they hope that their children will be able to finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to reduce their transportation costs to and from work

loans.name: Eirene

texts.en:
Eirene and her husband are hardworking people who do not want to rely on their families overseas to assist them financially so each of them specializes in areas of fishing and planting. After all their hard work in planting crops and catching fish,they sell their produce at the market.

The family earns $500 from the fish and root crops they sell, and they are happy with how things at home are improving. They are also really thankful for the SPBD's assistance, which they hope will continue. Eirence and her husband are now requesting a loan of $800 to help expand their fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a boat, gears, fishing net, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof.

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Purnawati

texts.id:
As a wife, Gusti Ayu Purnawati has to help her husband to increase the household income. Pig farming while selling animal feed seems to be the right choice, since it could be done from home. With a loan of Rp 5000,000 (about US$550) Gusti Ayu would cover all feed assortment for pig farming. Types of animal feed, she sells are: rice shells, wheat shells, concentrate and medicine specially for pig farming. Capital needed monthly to buy sales items are about Rp5,000,000 (about $550). Since she already have customers, she only needs to wait for the buyers come to her home. Every month Gusti Ayu orders supply 2 or 3 times, or she could sell 6 tons of assortments of animal feed. With a profit of Rp350,000 (about $38.50) she could clearly use it to support the family's income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang istri, Gusti Ayu Purnawati harus membantu suami dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga. Beternak babi dan sekaligus berjualan pakan ternak merupakan pilihan tepat karena semua aktifitas usaha dapat dilakukan di rumah. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dianari sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- Gusti Ayu melengkapi semua jenis kebutuhan pakan bagi peternak babi. Jenis pakan ternak yang dijualnya seperti : Dedak Padi, Dedak Gandum, Konsentrat dan obat-obatan khusus untuk ternak babi . Modal yang diperlukan per bulan untuk membeli barang dagangan sekitar Rp.5.000.000,-. Karena sudah memiliki langganan, Gusti Ayu hanya menunggu pembeli datang kerumahnya. Dalam setiap bulannya Gusti Ayu mengorder barang sebanyak 2 sampai 3 kali atau bisa menjual 6 ton pakan ternak dengan berbagai jenis. Dengan keuntungan Rp. 350.000.- per bulan jelas dapat dimanfaatkan untuk menunjang pendapatan keluarga.

loans.use:
Buying animal feed to supply customers from surrounding areas

Membeli pakan ternak untuk melayani pelanggan dari masyarakat sekitarnya

loans.name: Audrey

texts.es:
Business Description

Autrey has been working for 6 years selling clothing, cosmetics, and costume jewelry. Her husband helped her to start with $100 in capital. She works the areas near her home every day, in the afternoons. In the mornings, and into the afternoon she works providing domestic help in a private home.

Loan Use

This loan will be invested in supplying the business with merchandise. This is a good time of the year, and she has pending orders for various articles.

Personal Information

Audrey is 42 years old and married. She has just one daughter, who is about to graduate from the national police academy. Her husband works as a security guard at a company in the north part of the city. They have a small car which she uses for work in the evenings after her husband gets off work. Their home is made of cement. They have been able to finish it thanks to their income.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Autrey tiene una experiencia de 6 años con la venta de diferentes artículos como lo son: prendas de vestir, cosméticos, bisutería. Su esposo le ayudo con un capital de 100 dólares con que se inicio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana por las tardes. Recorriendo los sectores cercanos a su domicilio. Por las mañana y parte de la tarde trabaja realizando quehaceres domésticos en casa particular.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio con mercadería. Esta época del año es muy buena. Además ya tiene pedidos de varios artículos.

Información Personal

Audrey es casada. Tiene 42 años y una sola hija la cual esta próxima a graduarse de policía nacional. Su esposo trabaja de guardia de seguridad en una empresa del norte de la cuidad. Poseen un carrito el cual el lo trabaja por las noches después que ha salido de su guardianía. Su casa es de cemento. Gracias a sus ingresos han logrado terminarla.

loans.use: Supply business with merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice and blinds for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To relocate his shop and to purchase additional goods

loans.name: Yabteclum 6 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 48 years old and bears a great responsibility: she has 12 children. For the past 10 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables; she used to take her products with her and offer them in different areas, but because of her age and tiredness, Maria has decided to set up a small business at her home. Some of her fruits and vegetables are grown in the region, while the rest comes from the nearest village.

Maria uses her income to buy more produce and to support her children. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to expand her business a little bit more and earn more income. The other members of this group are Maria Pérez and Juana Pérez, both of which own grocery store, and Catarina Pérez, who sells fruits.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CUENTA CON 48 AÑOS, ES UNA MUJER QUE TIENE UNA GRAN RESPONSABILIDAD YA QUE ES MADRE DE 12 HIJOS , DESDE HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 10 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, ANTERIORMENTE LO HACIA DE FORMA AMBULANTE, PERO DEBIDO A SU EDAD Y AL CANSANCIO DECIDIO ESTABLECERSE EN SU CASA, ALGUNOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS QUE VENDE SON COSECHADOS EN LA REGION Y OTRAS LAS COMPRA EN LA LOCALIDAD MAS CERCANA, SUS GANANCIAS SERA DISTRIBUIDA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS Y A LA MANTENCION DE SUS HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO ESPERA PODER AGRANDAR UN POCO SU NEGOCIO Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON MARIA PÉREZ Y JUANA PÉREZ QUIENES TIENEN TIENDA DE ABARROTES, CATARINA PÉREZ SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS.

loans.use: Purchase more products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace T. is married with 5 children. She is 52 years old and owns a rental business. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan of $450 to buy more canopies for renting.

loans.use: To buy canopies

loans.name: Sudiartinik

texts.id:
Sudiartinik (53 tyears) lives in Resimuka Barat street with her husband Badur an independent electrician. Both children Sandy and Yulianto are independent. The family is healthy, and the house clean. Sudiartinik daily activities as rujak (indonesian type salad), and chicken satay (chicken on sticks barbecued) includes normally buying the ingredients at Saera market. Specially for chicken satay, Sudiartinik bought 6-8 lbs of chicken intestine, while for rujak usually not fixed, depending on how many buyers. Daily income could reach Rp 50,000 (about US$ 6), and that is enough for daily needs. Sudiartinik very much hope for additional capital so that her business could grow.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sudiartinik (53 tahun) tinggal di Jl. Resimuka Barat bersama suaminya Badur yang berprofesi sebagai Tukang Listrik keliling. Kedua anaknya Sandy dan Yulianto sudah mandiri, dan keadaan keluarganya sehat, begitu juga dengan keadaan rumahnya bersih. Kegiatan Sudiartinik sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual rujak dan sate ayam dan biasanya dia belanja bahan-bahan jualannya di Pasar Saera. Khusus untuk sate ayam, biasanya Sudiartinik menghabiskan 3-4 kg usus ayam sedangkan untuk rujaknya biasanya tidak tentu, tergantung banyaknya pembeli. Pendapatan dalam sehari bisa mencapai Rp. 50.000 dan itu cukup untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari. Sudiartinik sangant mengharapkan bantuan modal sehingga usahanya semakin berkembang.
