loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Every day Maria, with help from her husband, dedicates herself to the administration of her business and attends to clients in their small shopping centre. They both have the desire and are willing to improve their work space and their earnings so that their 12 year old son will benefit, as he has a very painful illness.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria, diariamente se dedica a la administración y a la atención de sus clientes en compañía y con apoyo de su esposo en su pequeño centro de ventas.Ambos tienen el deseo y compromiso de mejorar su espacio de trabajo y ganacias para procurarle bienestar a su pequeño niño de doce años quien padece de una dolencia sumamente penosa.

loans.use: An increase in capital to reboot commercial activity/Incremento de capital para reflotar su actividad comercial.

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodolfo has been selling clothing in the markets for the past 10 years. He started off helping his brother, but because of the need to help his family get ahead, he decided to work on his own. For the past 5 years the sale of clothing has been the main source of income for his family. He has two children, a 17-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl.

He is requesting a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise in order to have a greater variety to offer his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rodolfo se dedica a la venta de ropa en tianguis desde hace 10 años. El empezó como ayudante de su hermano, y ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia decidió dedicarse al negocio por su propia cuenta, y es así como desde hace 5 años la venta de ropa es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. El tiene 2 hijos un varon de 17 años y una niña de 10 años

El solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y asi ener mas variedad para ofrecerle a su clientela.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is a widow. She runs a small business selling clothing in the local market in Novaya Kahovka. Raisa lost her husband and had to find ways to support herself and her children. She started this business about 20 years ago. Her small venture has grown a lot since then. Presently, her turnover capital is over $2000. Monthly net profit is about $300.

Raisa would like to get a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase available products in her kiosks. She would like to buy more clothing items for this sunny summer season. We believe her hard work, natural friendliness, good customer service and self-discipline will help Raisa use the funds received wisely and repay her loan in time.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana Baji is the wife of Mr. Rafaqat A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-story brick house. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and one son. Her son is enrolled in a local school in the neighborhood. Her husband has an embroidery business and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. She is a housewife and helps her husband make embroidered dresses. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an embroidery machine for her husband so that he can extend his orders and earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Mrs. Chhak Nam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This bank of 14 members is located in Thmey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chhak N. is the village bank president. This is the second time she has to asked for a loan to improve her business activity. Mrs. Chhak N. is a farmer who cultivates two times a year and her husband, Mr. Duong Tork, is a cow and chicken breeder. Aside from this business, he sells firewood. Since his second business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife, Mrs. Chhak N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to re-sell. Mrs. Chhak N. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who all currently attend school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more firewood to re-sell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier trabaja muy alegre en su chacra produciendo maíz, producto que por temporada  le viene ayudando a solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus 3 hijos, quienes son escolares y requieren de varios útiles para seguir estudiando.Su deseo como padre es darles lo necesario a sus pequeños para que ellos progresen a través del estudio y puedan dedicarse a otras actividades fuera de tareas de agricultor.  Es por esta forma de pensar que muchos lo consideran un padre abnegado y trabajador.  Sin embargo, ahora requiere de ayuda para continuar con su trabajo, necesita adquirir abono y fertilizantes, que son tan indispensables para lograr cosechar productos acorde a las exigencias del mercado.
texts.en:
Javier happily works on his small farm growing corn, a crop that when in season, helps him pay the household expenses and the necessities of his three children. His children are students and need various supplies to keep studying. He wishes as a father that he can give his children what they need so they can progress through school and later work at jobs other than those in the agricultural sector. In this way he thinks that many people consider him a hard-working and selfless father. Nonetheless, now he needs help in order to continue working. He needs to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, which are very important for growing products according to market demands.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic and chemical fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Soda

texts.en: Mrs. Soda S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Bora Hoeung, 38, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1992, they have three daughters who are currently studying at a local school. Mrs. Soda has been a silk weaver for twenty years. She learned the skill from her neighbors when she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished product to the trader in the village, who then sells them to Phnom Penh. Both Mrs. S. and her husband are also primary school teachers. Mrs. Soda is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Manuel Jerónimo

texts.es:
La ciudad de Masaya se caracteriza por tener gente muy trabajadora y dinámica tal es el caso del señor Manuel B. cuyo negocio es la elaboración de zapatos que con gran experiencia los elabora para luego comercializarlos y andar ofreciéndolos en diferentes lugares del municipio.

La razón por la cual el señor B. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es debido a que requiere de la compra de los materiales de trabajo para elaborar los calzados y sandalias para su respectiva venta. Es importante destacar que a lo inmediato de recibir el crédito comprará estos materiales para la elaboración de dichos calzados en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
The city of Masaya stands out for having very hard-working, dynamic people and such is the case with Mr. Manuel B. whose business is making and selling shoes. He has many years of experience both making and selling them in different areas of the city. B. is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase materials to continue making shoes and sandals to be able to sell. It is important to highlight that immediately after receiving the loan, he will buy these raw materials in order to make the shoes and sell them in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Anwari Begum Group

texts.en:
I am Anwari begum and I reside in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines. Many people come to visit the city of shrines. I feel I got a blessing from God to live in this city. I am a 58-year-old widow. My husband left me alone with three children. I have spent 15 years as a widow. I worked hard to give my children a good future. I sew clothes day and night and earn income. I invest some of my income in a committee. Through that amount I opened a grocery shop for my son. Now his business is going well. My eldest daughter reads in the 10th standard (grade) and my younger daughter reads in the 9th standard. My children feel proud of me, and I thank God that he helped me with all the problems. I am applying for a loan to diversify my son’s grocery shop by buying more types of groceries. 

I am a group leader of a few more members in the locality. Anwar baji and Shakooran baji each want a loan to buy chairs for their barbershops. Manzooran baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for my grocery shop

loans.name: Zumratoi

texts.ru: Душабаева Зумратой 1975 года рождения  замужем имеет 2 детей. Она сидит дома муж уехал на заработки. Каждый месяц присылает деньги. Но  ее подруги занимаются  бизнесом, ей посоветовали заняться откормом скота. У нее дома есть овцы,  она ухаживает за ними. Подруги поддержали ей в бизнесе, они в таком же положении, как и Зумратой,  им помогают братья отвозить скот на продажу на рынок, каждую субботу.  Она получает кредит для откорма скота , брат ее мужа решил помочь  , каждый день она ухаживает за скотом, а через 3-4 месяца  они отвозят скот на рынок и продают по выгодной им цене. Если скот продают по дороже , то приобретают еще один скот по дешевле и корм для скота.
texts.en:
Zumratoi D. was born in 1975 and is married with two children. She has stayed behind while her husband is away working. Each month he sends home money. Her friends run a business and advised her to take up raising cattle, so she raises sheep at home. Her friends supported her business aspirations because they live in circumstances similar to hers, and their brother helps them by taking the livestock to market on Saturdays. Zumratoi buys livestock feed on credit. Her brother-in-law has decided to help out, while she takes care of the day-to-day care of the livestock. Every three to four months they take the cattle to market and sell them at a profit. If the price of livestock is up, they purchase an additional head and livestock feed.


Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: La sra. Vilma tiene una pulpería y vende comida desde hace ocho años, que inicio estas ventas para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos y poder ayudar a sus hijos que no les falte nada, son dos uno de 5 y 15 años de edad, estudian, doña Vilma tiene 32 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Jocote dulce, su esposo trabaja de asesor administrativo,  sus planes para su familia es apoyar a sus hijos que estudien para que sean jóvenes de bien ante la sociedad, sus metas es poder tener una venta amplia, y vender productos variados. Con los prestamos que esta haciendo en Afodenic ha podido incrementar su inventario esta es su segunda solicitud que va invertir en   comprar granos básicos, consumo diario y productos de limpieza. Lo cual espera sea de muchos beneficios para su negocio. A futuro espera remodelar el local de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma has a local store and sells food. She began these sales eight years ago to help her husband with the expenses and to be able to help her children never lack anything. The two children, who are five and fifteen years of age, study. Vilma is 32 years old and resides in a neighborhood of the capital, Managua, which is called Jocote Dulce. Her husband works as an administrative advisor. Their plans for the family are to support their kids who are studying so that they can be good young people in their community. Their goals are to have lots of sales and sell various products. With the loans that she is getting from Afodenic, she has been able to increase her inventory. This is her second loan, with which she is going to buy basic grains, daily goods, and cleaning products, things which she thinks will benefit her business a lot. In the future, she hopes to remodel her local store.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and daily goods.

loans.name: Sipha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sipha P., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chhang Sovann, 35, were married in 2000 and have two children: a son and a daughter--one is in school and one is too young for school. Besides her children, her elderly mother and a sister live with them. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 29 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sipha and her husband sell food, coffee, and dessert in front of their house. The couple wants to start another business, a motorcycle cleaning service. To accomplish this goal, Sipha is applying for her first loan of $1000 to buy a pressure washer and an air compressor. She will use the rest of the loan to build her motorcycle cleaning shop.

loans.use: To purchase a pressure washer, an air compressor, and to build a motorbike cleaning shop

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Исматов Насрулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 43 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Является старшим сыном в семье и живет с родителями. Семья большая , поэтому ему приходиьтся много работать для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Работает частным таксистом. Имеет маршрутку , которую и использует в качестве такси. В данный момент произошла поломка , которая не дает ему работать. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить запчасти и произвезти ремонт. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Кроме такси он еще занимается садоводством , где выращивает виноград.Это дает ему дополнительный доход  в сезон урожая.
texts.en:
Nasrullo I. lives in the Gissar area. He is 43 years old, is married and has three children. Nasrullo is the oldest son in the family and lives with his parents. His family is large and he needs to work a lot in order to provide for his family. He is a private taxi driver. Nasrullo has a van that he uses as a taxi. His car is currently broken, which keeps him from working. This is why he decided to take out a loan in order to purchase auto parts and make repairs. He will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months. In addition to driving a taxi, Nasrullo also has an orchard where he grows grapes. This gives him additional income during harvest season.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car Repairs

loans.name: Huseinkhuja

texts.en:
A. Huseinkhuja is a 33-year-old married man and has one child. His mother and father also live with him, and he is responsible for their living expenses. Huseinkhuja has a butcher's shop and has been in this business for ten years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with food. Now Huseinkhuja is requesting a loan of $700 USD. Due to the determination of this microentrepreneur, the profitability of his business, and his experience, Huseinkhuja is qualified to receive this loan. He is counting on your help – your support will really help him. 

More about Tajikistan 
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

More about IMON International 
 Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more meat to expand his business

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mrs. Roth N. is a villager in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Um Ol, is a palm juice collector. Aside from this plantation, he is a cow middleman in the local village.

Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it but he does not have enough money. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Roth N. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy three cows for her husband’s business to earn more income. She is 36 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown in the picture.

loans.use: to add her saving to buy three cows

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
D. Virginie est née le 08/07/1968 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Virginie est mariée à GNANSOUNOU Emmanuel gestionnaire de cabine GSM. Virginie est mère de quatre (4) enfants tous scolarisés. Virginie et sa famille vit à Cotonou au quartier Sènadé. Depuis douze (12) ans Virginie vend de divers(Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) dans sa boutique érigée devant son domicile. Virginie s’approvisionne en ses divers articles à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande de sa clientèle et faire accroître ses activités, Virginie sollicite un crédit de auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Virginie was born on July 8, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to GNANSOUNOU Emmanuel, a manager of a GSM phone booth. She is the mother of four children. She and her family live in Cotonou in the Sènadé district. For twelve years, Virginie has been selling various items: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish soap, and bath soap, etc. in her shop set up in front of her home. She stocks up with these goods in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin. To respond better to customer demand and to have her business grow, she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of milk, 5 boxes of cookies, and 2 boxes of candy

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.en:
Rafael, 31 years old, is married and has two children, one recently born and the other in third grade. He has been working in carpentry for over 10 years, making rustic furniture. He has a large clientele base that is based out of San Lorenzo and Asunción. He started his business by himself, and it has now grown to include six employees in addition to himself.

Rafael has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for over five years, and he thanks them for the support they give his business. With the current loan, he intends to buy wood for his furniture-making work.

loans.use: For the purchase of wood

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
If you talked with Benita P. about her dreams, she will tell you about graduation day of her four children in college. She will be turning 43 this year and currently working on a 2-hectare farm to provide their needs. Farming according to her is a difficult work. She said that you will work whole day in the farm especially during land preparation under the heat of the sun, immersed in muddy soil.

The dream she has for her children serves as a strength that fuel her desire to work harder in the field. Now, she is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures to buy herbicides, complete fertilizers, crude oil and payment for the laborer as well. 

Her participation in CEVI develops more her business skills. She receives not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, complete fertilizers, crude oil and payment for the laborer

loans.name: Marta Leticia

texts.es:
la srita. Marta M. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de nacatamales desde hace 5 años, desde niña le han gustado las ventas y asi fue como ella logro poner su negocio.
sus ventas las realiza frente al instituto hondureño de seguridad social IHSS, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos y tambien muchas personas transitan por este lugar. Marta ncesita el credito para comprar producto al por mayor como ser carne de cerdo, pollo, maiz, papas, codimentos, vasos, bolsas y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
ella no tiene hijos y es muy sociable y querida por sus clientes. ella tiene todos los deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
Marta M. has been making and selling nacatamales for the past 5 years. Since she was a child, she has liked sales and so it was like her to achieve opening her business. She makes her sales in front of the Instituto Hondureño de Seguridad Social – IHSS (Honduras Institute of Social Security). She has many regular customers and many people pass by this place. Marta needs the loan to purchase wholesale products such as pork, chicken, corn, potatoes, condiments, cups, and bags so that she can obtain larger earnings. She does not have any children and she is very sociable and is loved by her customers. She has every desire to improve herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de frijoles, arroz, aceite, azucar, refrescos, leche, queso, mantequilla, embutidos, jugos, pastas

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Being a family breadwinner, Jerry is doing his best to provide his family with sufficient necessities for their daily living and to sustain the education of his two children. He is thankful for having a wife like Melony, (his wife), for she is so caring and a good mother to his children. Jerry and wife help each other maintain both their cell phone load retailing and hog raising businesses in the village of Catabban Bugros, Isabela where his family is peacefully living. The couple also maintains a corn field where they get their major source of income. 

Jerry is also aiming to have a progressive business where he can generate a bigger income to save for the future college education of their two children who are both in high school. Thus, he wants to avail a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP16,000 additional capital.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is sixty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to six children: three sons and two daughters, some of whom are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for her family. Gladys lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central Region of Ghana.

Gladys is a trader, trading in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from the nearby communities and sells at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. Gladys has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy cereals and other foodstuffs in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
"Ana  F. W. (0) is a 64-year-old woman living in the town of Aleisa A.  She is married and has 10 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ana  owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Ana  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

Ana  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ana  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4650 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Ana  is now requesting a new loan of 3000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ana  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian K. sells groceries such as milk Milo and soft drinks at Elmina near Liverpool.  Vivian has received junior high school education.  She is married and has six dependants’ children. Her husband works with u.c.c. press. Vivian has been selling groceries such and soft drinks since the year 1989. She supports husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more groceries and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math R. is 28 years old and a resident of the best territory in Phnom Penh, the capital. She currently works sewing clothes for a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $90 per month. She is married with one young child, while her husband’s name is Mr. Emron, age 28, who is a sewing machine repairer for the industry.

Math R. and her husband always find it hard commuting to work or anywhere else, because they don’t have their own vehicle for traveling needs. Therefore, Math R. has asked for a loan from Kiva in order to buy a motorcycle which she and her husband will use to ride to their workplace.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
U. operates a belt crafting business in his city. The belts he makes are worn with traditional Mongolian coats called deels. These deel belts are very elaborate, using leather, silver, turquoise and other expensive elements. U. learned how to make these belts from his grandfather when he was a teenager.

U. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 10, in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the city. Both of his children attend a local secondary school and his wife works in a shoe factory and earns a monthly salary of 200,000 tugrugs (~$140 US).

U. began his business in 1999 and currently makes between 8 and 10 belts per month which earns him between 90,000 and 120,000 tugrugs (~$63-$84 US) in profit. U. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~$350 US) loan in order to purchase a sewing machine for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo T. is a 56-year-old married woman and a good homemaker. She currently stays at home to care for the children and do housework. She depends on income from her husband who is a community consultant adviser. Her husband (pictured) also catches fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake for additional profit. This couple has three school-age and four employed children. Keo T. will be using part of her loan to buy more fishing tools for her husband.  She will use the rest of the loan to repair her existing vehicle that breaks down frequently.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children: a son and a daughter. She runs a salon in Nairobi called Care Salon. She's been in business for six years and employs one person. She also sells second-hand clothes for extra income. She describes herself as vision-minded and hard-working and says that in Faulu she has learned new business management skills.

Catherine requested this loan for Kes. 60,000 from Faulu to add stock to her salon. In the future, she would like to open a second-hand clothing shop in another location.

loans.use: To add stock to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en: Bayanjargal is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 20-year-old daughter in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends university and his wife helps Bayanjargal with the family business. He operates a consumer goods retail business and a transportation service. He began his business in 2000 with working capital of 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD) and since then he has established himself within the business community and his working capital now exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD). Bayanjargal says, “I want to expand and improve my business in the future.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan in order to purchase consumer products and fuel for his business.

loans.use: to purchase consumer products to sell and fuel his transportation business

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella sells soft drinks at retail prices to make a living. She lives and works in Benin City, Edo, Nigeria. She is 32 years old and married, and she has four children. Her eldest child is 8 years old. She is a friendly woman and she is also hard-working. She is a LAPO client. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Angella is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Djamoliddin

texts.en:
Djamoliddin is married, 26 years-old and has two children. He began his business four years ago with a small store, which adapted according to the market demand. Initially, Djamoliddin offered a small number of bricks and other construction materials to his buyers but in time it expanded due to his location and the needs of his clients. Djamoliddin is asking for a loan of 4,700 Somoni to purchase merchandise for his business in order to offer a more diverse range of products to his clients. In this type of business, novelties always appear. He wants to be able to keep an up-to-date inventory and meet the preferences of his clients. Djamoliddin thanks you for your support to allow him to continue to better both his business and the quality of life for his family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 44 years old. Imelda is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda C..

Imelda is married and has 2 school-aged children. Imelda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is married and has two children. She has received a high education.  Mary sells fresh eggs and a type of food spice called magi cube at Abura. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is an artist.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other expenses of the family.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more eggs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to build a shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma M. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Elma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a Tricycle transportation or "Trisicad" which is commonly used for transportation in the down town area at Ozamiz City. She has been engaged in her transportation business for over 12 years and she has an existing 20 units of Trisicad which being rented at 60 pesos a day and she earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional two units of tricycle or trisicad. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional unit of  tricycle or Trisicad as known in Ozamiz City

location.town: Ozamis-San Antonio, Ozamis City, Mis. Occidental

loans.name: Chran's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chran L. is 37 years old. She is the village bank president, selected by the all nine members. They are all located in Pou Bay village in Takeo province.  Mrs. Chran L. and her husband, Mr. Bros Leng, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. Aside from farming, Mr. Bros Leng is a fisherman who can earn a small income to support his family. Since both of businesses are still making less income than they need to support the family, Mrs. Chran L. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve the family's standard of living. This couple has two children; one child is a construction worker and one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Monica Maria

texts.es: La Sra. C. G. Monica Maria, vive en el Caserío de la Joya perteneciente al distrito de Santiago,  junto a sus dos  hijos. Trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo del Sr. Miguel Ascuna desde hace 3 años. Su casa es de adobe revestido. Solicita financiamiento para terminar la construcción de su vivienda ya que esta fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es poder terminar su casa para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra. Monica agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a traves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mónica María C. G. lives in the La Joya settlement, Santiago district, with her two children. She has worked as a field hand on Mr. Miguel Ascuna’s farm estate for the last three years. Her house is made of coated adobe and she needs funding to finish building it because it was damaged by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to finish building her house in order to provide her family with improved quality of life. Mónica is grateful for whatever help we might be able to offer through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette E. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Bernadette owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La señora Claudia es una mujer de metas en su vida, desde su juventud se ha esforzado para sobresalir adelante con sus estudios, con ayuda de su esposo y sus padres lo logro aunque con muchas dificultades económicas, trabaja como docente en un instituto. Tiene un hijo y junto con su esposo ahorrar para poder lograr las mejora de su vivienda, el trabaja como conductor. La casa la han ido construyendo poco a poco ya que todo esta muy caro, y hay que cubrir educación, alimentación y salud para su hijo. Con este financiamiento comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer una ele en su casa para terminarla de cerrarla de concreto ya que la tiene con madera ya vieja lo que es preocupante para la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a woman with life objectives. Since her youth she has made the effort to get ahead with her studies and, with help from her husband and parents, she managed to do so although with many economic difficulties. She works as a teacher in an institute. She has a son; she and her husband save in order to make improvements to their home. He works as a driver. They have gradually built their house because everything is very expensive and they have to pay for their son’s schooling, food and health needs. This financing will be used to buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build an ell onto their house thus completing it and closing it off with concrete because it currently is made of old wood and this is a concern for the family’s security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build a concrete wall for family security.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis tiene 39 años. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taller de mecánica. Hace más de 10 años que tiene esta gran habilidad con este negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes recurren a José Luis porque tiene mucha  habilidad en interactuar con sus clientes además es el primer crédito que realiza en fundación, por lo que se siente muy feliz con esta oportunidad que se le está brindando. No ha sido fácil continuar con esta actividad pues los desafíos que ha enfrentado han sido el tiempo porque no puede entregar sus pedidos por las diferentes piezas que algunas veces no tiene. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos, pinturas, acetileno entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
José Luis is 39 years old and runs a mechanics shop. He’s been doing this for more than 10 years and has lots of experience. Most of his customers return to him because of the way he is able to interact. This will be his first loan through the foundation and he is very happy to have this opportunity. He faces the challenge of not being able to deliver some of his services because he lacks the proper materials. He will use the money from this loan to buy spare parts, paints, and acetylene, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat H. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Leang Lonh, live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have three sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside of the family home. Two are garment factory workers, one attends school and another one stays at home. 

Yat and her husband are farmers. They grow cucumbers, squash and other crops on their farmland in the village. Besides farming, they are also fishermen. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a boat and fishing material for her fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing material for her fishing business.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro tiene 65 años, tiene 5 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costura, por lo que tiene muy buenos clientes y con una gran variedad, pues esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su actividad. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de hilos, tijeras, agujas, telas alfileres entre otros actualmente tiene bastante encargos que tiene que cumplirlos es por eso que solicita este financiamiento. Por lo que sueña con seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
María del Socorro, 65, has five children who work independently. She is a seamstress and has a good variety of regular customers. This isn’t her first loan with the Fundación; they have been of great help to her in her work activity. This capital will be used to buy thread, scissors, needles, fabric, pins, etc. She currently has quite a few orders pending that she needs to fill thus the need for the loan. She dreams with continued growth in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, scissors, fabric, pins, etc.

loans.name: Karimatou

texts.en:
Madame Karimatou A. A. is 40 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She has a general store where she sells lots of different products, such as soap, petrol, foodstuffs and cereals. She has been in business since 2003.

Madame A. would like to purchase more merchandise for her store, and to this end she has taken a loan of 400,000 XOF to purchase more products from the Grand Market in Lome. Madame A. is married and they have two children.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the general store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A., from the village of Allinguigan 3rd, is 43 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, for over eight years Myrna has been preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals, earning approximately 4200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Myrna's third loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a wife of M. E. and lives in the Pakistani city of Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She owns a small two-roomed house there where she has lived with her family for over eight years. Shahnaz is a mother of four children – one daughter and three sons. Her eldest son is in second grade and her daughter is in kindergarten. The other two children are not yet of school age.
Shahnaz operates an embroidery business from her house. She collects orders from different boutiques and clothes shops and earns an income by fulfilling them. She charges approximately 1500 PKR for each embroidered dress and she completes five dresses per month, which enables her to generate 7500 PKR per month. Her income has become a great financial source for her family.
Shahnaz's husband is a driver. He drives a local 32-seater bus for up to eight hours a day. He usually starts driving at 6am and returns home at 1pm. His work requires much effort and that is why Shahnaz pays complete attention to her husband's diet and sleep. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will repair his bus because its engine is creating problems and its seat covers have become rough, which creates a bad impression to the passengers.
Shahnaz is on her third loan and has proved to be a responsible borrower from Asasah. For previous loans, she paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To repair her husband's bus and change the seat covers

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim M. Y. (the lady in the photo with her hand raised) is 43 years old and a housewife who stays home and sees to her household responsibilities. She is the mother of six children, all of whom are attending school. She is married to M. Y., a rickshaw driver. The family lives in a small town in Pakistan called Khanewal which is located in Multan, a city famous for its shrines.

Shamim’s husband drives someone else’s rickshaw to whom he pays rent every month. As he is the only breadwinner in his family, his income is unable to meet the financial expenses of his family because the rickshaw rental cuts deeply into his earnings.

Therefore, Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy a rickshaw. By purchasing his own rickshaw he will be able to work fulltime without any worries and will be able to increase his income because rental costs will never cut into his rent. Shamim is very confident that her husband will be able to improve his business by utilizing the loan amount.

Shamim is a regular Asasah client and is her third loan cycle. She has a good credit record and has proved herself responsible in making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for business use

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from the village of Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Conchita   operates a retail sari-sari (variety) store. Conchita is about two years into this business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to be used for her Sari-Sari Store. This will be the third loan taken out by conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail (sari-sari) store

loans.name: Fouzia Iqbal Khan's Group

texts.en:
A caring lady, Fouzia I. K. is a housewife as well as a working woman. She is married to I. K. who has a grocery shop in the market where he sells items for daily use such as cooking oil, rice, soaps and spices. They live in the mid-sized city of Punjab called Vehari that is famous for its agricultural industry in Pakistan.

Fouzia sells milk from her home. Presently, she has a dairy cow from which she gets a good quantity of milk and makes good money every month as well.

Fouzia has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy groceries in greater quantity for his shop. She hopes that through this investment her husband will be able to serve his clients better and make more of an income. She is confident that with the improvement of her husband’s business, her family will soon enjoy a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's shop

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es comerciante informal de ropa y electrodomésticos, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado porque la mayor parte de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Empezó con el dinero que le otorgo la empresa donde trabajaba, compro mercadería como electrodomésticos y ropa para vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Trabaja solo desde muy temprano recorriendo las calles para vender la ropa y los electrodomésticos. Una de las dificultades es que no tiene un vehiculo disponible y tiene que recorrer lugares peligrosos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como ropa, electrodomésticos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere  tener una papelería para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is an informal merchant of clothes and electronic appliances.  He lives with his wife and two kids in Guasmo of Guayaquil ( a place characterized by its predominant population of informal merchants).

He began with funds given to him by the company where he works at; he purchased merchandise like electronic appliances and clothes to sell to his friends and acquaintances.  He works alone and starts very early roaming the streets to sell clothing and electronic appliances.  His problem is that he doesn't have a vehicle and he has to cover dangerous territory.

With this loan, he would like to purchase more merchandise like clothing and electrical appliances for the business.  In the future he would like to start a stationery for his kids.

loans.use: Clothing and electronic appliances

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business selling kikois (colored cloth used for clothing), handbags, ornaments and purses for over two years. Mwanamwinyi sells door to door predominately to women and to her neighboring community. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs while selling door to door. She hopes to open a boutique and become self reliant in the future. 

Mwanamwinyi  decided to join Yehu to get loans in order to boost her business. With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings she hopes to purchase kikois, ornaments, handbags and purses for resale.

loans.use: To purchase kikois (colored cloth used for clothing), ornaments, handbags and purses for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods & breads in the local community. She is also engaged in providing billiard games where the customer pays for every game finished. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell.

location.town: Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa propia que se encuentra en construcción, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene un taller de carpintería en el cual trabaja desde hace 20 años juntamente con su esposa. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito lo utilizará para la refacción de su baño y cocina ya que se está instalando en su zona gas a domicilio y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para tener las tuberías listas e instaladas. Es su segundo crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has four children.  He lives in his own home which is still being built.  It is located in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz.

Mario has a carpentry workshop where he has been working for 20 years together with his wife.  This is how he makes income for his household.

He will use his loan to refurbish his bathroom and kitchen since they are starting to connect the gas supply to homes in his district and he wants to take advantage of the opportunity and have the pipes ready and installed.  This is his second loan and the socio-economic analysis which we have performed qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To refurbish his bathroom and kitchen.  To install gas pipes since they are beginning to connect the gas supply to homes in his district

loans.name: Quezie

texts.en:
Quezie is 32 years old, married and has five children between one and 11 years old. 

Quezie has a small general store that sells a variety of items used by all Rwandans in their homes.  She has been in this business for about three years and currently employs two people.

Quezie will use this loan to buy popular items like cooking oil, soap and sugar.  

She plans to continue investing any profits back into her business to make sure it grows and does well.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, soap, sugar and other items to sell

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene 34 años, tiene un hijo a su cargo. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de pollo de engorde y fotografías, dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, ella inicio como una forma de generar ingresos a su hogar y con el apoyo de su esposo. Poco a poco fue invirtiendo en ciertos productos hasta tener el capital que posee ahora. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos y también en compra de alimento para los mismos pues en esta temporada tiene cierta demanda.
texts.en:
Karla is 34 years old and has one child in her care.  Her business is selling broiler chickens and photographs.  She started this business 5 years ago as a way of making income for her household, with the support of her husband.  She gradually invested in certain products until she had the capital that she has now. 

Karla is currently requesting a loan to buy chickens and also chicken feed since there is a certain amount of demand during this season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta P. cooks food for sale at Takoradi. She is married to a driver and has five dependants. She uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of her dependants. Her loan will be used to expand her cooking business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to establish a restaurant.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to expand her cooking business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se ha formado gracias a la señora María del Rosario G. del Barrio Las Garzas de Villa Elisa, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas.
Se interesó mucho por la Fundación Paraguaya y el crédito. Las reuniones se realizan en la casa de la señora presidenta María Elisa P. y conjuntamente todas las integrantes del grupo trabajan y hacen actividades para sacar adelante tanto a su grupo como a sus familias.
Estas mujeres son muy responsables y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group came together thanks to Maria del Rosaio Gonzalez, originally from the community of Las Garzas in Villa Eliza. She has a business selling fruits. She became very interested in Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) and the loan program. The meets are held in the house belonging to Maria Eliza Pavon, the leader of the group, and they all work together to succeed in their business, for the sake of the group as much as for their 
families. These women are very responsible and hardworking individuals.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia G. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Sylvia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling beauty and cosmetic products, such as perfumes and colognes, in the local community. She also buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing such as blouses and t-shirts. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Sylvia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as t-shirts and blouses, to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Sylvia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kossi  est marié et  père de  6 enfants.  Il est âgé de 41 ans et  habite  quartier  Hédzranawoé. Il exerce  comme  métier  la menuiserie  pour  pouvoir s’occuper  de  ses enfants.  Il a déjà  remboursé  un  crédit.  Il  compte  16 ans  dans  cette  activité et  achète les bois au  marché  d’adidobomé.  Il demande  un prêt  pour acheter  50 nouveaux bois.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi is married and the father of six. He is 41 year old and lives in the Hédzranawoé. He works as a carpenter in order to support his children. He has already repaid an earlier loan. He has 16 years of experience in this field and buys his wood at the Adidobome market. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase 50 pieces of new wood.

loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Juana de Jesus de 50 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo economica de sus hijos mayores, doña Juana tiene 22 años de trabajar como conserje del hospital Jacinto Hernandez, su compañero  trabaja como Guarda de seguridad, el cual  mensualmente la ayuda  con los gastos familiares, Juana se carateriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora, activa y muy responsable, proviene de familia culta y humilde, ha sido una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superacion, lo que le ha permitido llegar a obtener sus propios bienes con sacrificios propios y asumiendos sus responsabilidades de pago con creditos obtenidos por Afodenic.  Solicita su 8vo   crèdito para construir su cocina de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y darle mas valor a su propiedad, ademas , su sueño es que su familia gocen de mejores condiciones y salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana de Jesus is 50 years old. She receives some economic assistance from her adult children. Mrs. Juana has worked at the Jacinto Hernandez de Nueva Guineacon Hospital for 22 years as a janitor and her partner is a custodian. He helps every month with the family expenses. Juana is a very honest, hard working, active and responsible person who comes from a correct and humble family.  She has always wished to get ahead and do better and through her work and loans from Afodenic has been able to obtain their own property.

She is requesting her eighth loan to build a kitchen to improve her living conditions and increase the value of her property. Her dreams are to have good health to be able to get ahead and for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Alis Maria

texts.es:
Alis María D. M., tiene la edad de 24 años de edad, está en unión libre  y vive con sus 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad y su esposo. Ella pretende comprar con el dinero los insumos y los fertilizantes para su cafetal. Ella cuenta con la experiencia y la plantación ya establecida por lo cual ella  quiere es mejorarla y así obtener mejores cosechas este año. Ella pretende con estos llegar a cumplir varias metas que tiene y así también tener una estabilidad familiar para un mejor bienestar. También ella piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y es por eso que quiere tener un mayor  ingreso para ofrecerles facilidades y el estudio en un futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alis María D. M. is 24 year old and has a common-law husband and two children who are her top priority.  She wants to buy supplies and fertilizer for her coffee plantation.  She has the experience and the established plantation so it is a matter of improving it to harvest a better crop this year.

She has several goals in mind and also wants to increase household stability for a better lifestyle.  Her children's future is also foremost in her mind and for this reason she wants to increase her income, making it easier for them to get an education.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has never had any loans through state banks; but FUDECOSUR is giving her better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy coffee crop supplies

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Túcume, a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres quienes también se dedican a la misma actividad.  Además se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de chicha, bebida tradicional del departamento de Lambayeque.
 
María desea comprar  aves menores para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves y cerdos, esto permitirá ampliar su negocio y de esta manera percibir mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, married, and has one school-age child.  She owns her own home which is located in Túcume district, 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

María raises and sells animals.  She has been in this business for 15 years and runs it from her home.  She learned the business from her parents who carried out the same work.  In addition to this, María makes and sells chicha (a corn-based drink) which is traditional in Lambayeque department.

María would like to buy some young birds to fatten and also some balanced feed for her birds and pigs.  This will enable her to expand her business and thereby make more income.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy young birds to fatten and also balanced feed

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en: Selaphine is 31 years old. She has five children who range in age from six months to 11 years old. Her husband is a tailor. She sells beans on a wholesale scale. She has been selling beans for six years. This business has enabled her to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees. Selaphine is requesting a loan to purchase more beans and make more profits. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To purchase more beans.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María Laura tiene 38 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura tiene un solar, siembra cebada, papas, maíz, arveja y trigo el terreno es de sus padres tiene seis cabezas de ganado, cerdos, ovejas y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta escuchar música y visitara los padres.
texts.en:
María Laura is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has seven children.

The 'Grupo de Mujeres Carbon Chinipamba' community bank is located in Carbón Chinipamba neighborhood, in Cuatro Esquinas sector, in Guaranda canton, twenty minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  Most of the members of the bank work in farming, livestock raising and sales.  They produce rice, barley, beans, quinoa, potatoes and animals such as dairy cows and farmyard animals.

María farms crops.  She has a piece of land where she sows all barley, potatoes, corn, peas and wheat.  The land belongs to her parents.  She has six head of cattle, pigs, sheep and chickens.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the city's wholesale market.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to provide her children with an education.

María enjoys listening to music and visiting her parents.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies - bricks, cement and iron

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married with 6 children, 4 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics stock to sell

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Dionisia  es conviviente, tiene 5  hijos,  actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Quiere al niño” grupo  conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Dionisia  trabaja desD. hace 10 años en un locutorio donD. ella brinda el servicio D. llamadas telefónicas, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que  a su esposo lo despidieron D. su trabajo, pero sus deseos D. superación D. Victoria  eran más  grandes que sus problemas y a su vez  trabaja  como asistente social para una iglesia, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos  económicos, que le ha permitido construir su casa, y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para remodelar su negocio. Sabemos que Dionisia   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.

LA SEÑORA QUE ESTA EN LA FOTO RECORTADA SE LLAMA YULY BEATRIZ.
texts.en:
Señora Dionisia has a common-law husband and five children. She currently belongs to the "Quiere al niño" communal bank maD. up of nine members that are engaged in various commercial endeavors. 

Dionisia has worked for ten years at a phone service center where she provides access to telephone service. She started the job when her husband was fired from his job. However, her dreams of attaining success were much greater than her problems and in time she began working as a social worker at a church. 

Thanks to her efforts and dedication she has been able improve her income which has allowed her to build a house, providing her family with a better quality of life. In order to continue growing she is requesting a new loan to remodel her business. We know that Dionisia will accomplish her goals with lots of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

The woman in the tiny photo is named Yuly Beatriz.

loans.use: to remodel her business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 33 años de edad, convive con Eva de 23 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo de 04 años llamado Erik. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en  el distrito de Sivia. Edgar desde  que era adolescente incursionó en los negocios, como en la venta de video CDs, pues sus padres eran comerciantes y le inculcaron a ganarse la vida honradamente. En un inicio le fue difícil empezar con la actividad del comercio pero poco a poco se adapto vio lo indispensable que era ganarse su propio salario. Actualmente tiene el apoyo de su querida esposa, y juntos tratan de salir adelante, “Lo único que hay que tener es iniciativa, ser perseverante y creativo”, menciona. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para poder continuar con el negocio de CD´s, por otro lado se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, comprara más CD y otros artículos de sonido.
texts.en:
Edgar is 33 years old and has a live-in partner, Eva who is 23 years old. They have one 4-year-old son named Erik. Together they live in their own house located in the Sivia district. Edgar has been in the business of selling video CDs since he was an adolescent. His parents were merchants and they taught him to make a living honestly.

In the beginning it was difficult for him to start in the business but little by little he adapted and saw the importance of making one's own money. Currently he has the support of his beloved wife and together they try to get ahead. He says, “The only thing you have to have is the initiative, persevere and be creative.”

This will be his first loan with MFP which is why he awaits the support of each of you to be able to continue with his CD business. He is committing to being punctual with his repayments. With the 1,500 nuevos soles he is requesting he will buy more CDs and other audio items.

loans.use: to buy more CDs.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is 38 years old, married, and has four children aged 6 to 22 years old. For a year she has owned a small shop where she sells groceries. Her shop is located in a residential area where she sells things to people in her community. Evelyne plans to use the proceeds of this loan to restock her store by buying more groceries. 

This is Evelyne’s first loan with Kiva field partner SMEP.  She plans to use any profit she makes from her business to open more shops in other locations. She hopes to be able to run a wholesale business in the future. Evelyne describes herself as strategically minded.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell at a small store

loans.name: Elena Mercedes

texts.es: Elena Mercedes se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio con fondos propios a pesar que no tenía mucho capital para aumentar su inventario pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha podido sacar adelante su medio de vida. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido importante para mantener a su hijo que está bajo su cargo.
