El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y toallas. Sueña con aumentar su negocio y mejorar cada día más el servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en: Elena Mercedes has a business selling general merchandise.  She started with her own funds, and although she didn't have much capital to invest in inventory, over time she has managed to earn a livelihood and get ahead.  She has been doing this work for more than 4 years, as it has been important for her to provide for the child who is in her care.  The loan that she requests will be used to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets and towels.  She dreams of expanding her business and providing better service each day to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, sheets and towels

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, three of whom are in school. Mariam's business is selling charcoal in the market. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days every week. Mariam has requested for a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.

The main business challenges for Mariam include seasonality and defaulters. Her aspiration for the business is to see it grow from a retail enterprise to a wholesale business. Mariam lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcaol

loans.name: Medjelawe

texts.fr:
Medjelawe est une femme  âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un marin. Elle a 01 enfant scolarisé. Il a 05ans.
Medjelawe travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale (sucre, riz, huile végétale) depuis 2010. Elle vend à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché. Sa difficulté principale est liée à la mévente après les périodes de fête.
Medjelawe a requis son  premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires vendre de l’eau glacée, du jus de citron,  du jus de bissap. 
Dans les prochaines années, Medjelawe voudrait ouvrir d’autres boutiques permettant d’embauche d’employés. Elle veut voir sa famille s’épanouir avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en:
Medjelawe is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a sailor. She has one son who is 5 years old and in school.
Medjelawe has worked as a seller of general food products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2010. She sells to many different people in her store. She purchases her merchandise from the Grand Marche. Her main challenge is the slump in sales after the holidays.
Medjelawe has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase general food products. With her extra profits, she would like to begin selling ice water, lemonade and hibiscus juice.  
In the next few years, her goal is to open other stores so that she can hire employees.  With her increased profits, she would like to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase general food products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil)

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 39-year-old woman, professionally a seamstress. She has also started a business selling clothes to earn better profits. She purchases clothes from the wholesale markets and sells on good profits. She started this business on her customers’ demand.  Her variety of clothes enables her to receive good orders from her customers every month. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothes-selling business. She will buy clothes of different varieties of better quality with the loan amount. This will give her more chance to make better sales and increase her profits. 

Zahida is confident that her business will grow further after the loan investment.   

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Darwin Jose

texts.es: Darwin José tiene su pulpería, desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio. La lucha constante que realiza por brindarles a sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo lo necesario ha proporcionado mejor estabilidad a su familia. Empieza a atender a sus clientes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares que siempre le solicitan variedad en sus productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, detergentes, papel higiénico entre otros.
texts.en:
Darwin José has had a grocery store for over six years.  His constant struggle to provide his two minor children in his care with everything they need has led to improved family stability.  

He starts to tend to his customers at 7am and continues until 10pm.  His customers are his friends, neighbors and family members who always seek out the variety of his products.  The reason for the loan is to buy basic grains, soups, canned goods, detergent and toilet paper, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.
 
She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Lida has been in this business for 27 years. She earns additional income from oyster culture and green shell culture.

Lida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a farmer who raises his family in a village. At his age of 46, he has three school-aged children who are now in secondary and tertiary level. Sometimes, he and his wife have difficulty providing some of their family's needs due to the high cost of school fees and transportation. But through the help of their parents, they are able to provide for their needs.  

Alfredo aims to improve his rice farming business and increase the yields and income to support the education of his children and satisfy their basic needs.  He is requesting for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farming business.  He and his wife mentioned that this loan will help them make an improvement in their business to achieve their goals. They are hoping that someday they will become financially stable and give their children a bright future.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul, a 39-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and school-aged child, is the main income-earner for her family. The owner of a clothing shop since 2009, she works hard to pay her son’s educational fees and other family expenses.

Batoul is planning to enlarge her shop to increase her sales and income, and so is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more clothing for her shop. She notes that this will help her improve the family's standard of living, and in the future she plans to open several branches of her shop in different areas of the city.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ngendelele Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ngendelele SHG Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Ngendelele SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Alice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ngendelele SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is married and is a loving father of four children. He is smart and purposeful man. He has been growing agricultural crops for more than eight years. He has two hectares of land where he grows corn. He also raises livestock; at this time he has two heads of pig. Martin plans to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds for sowing. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for this purpose. He is thankful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for sowing for his farm

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 
Rey is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.
Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old and married to Esther. They are blessed with two children, ages 8 and 4 years respectively. He has been running a stationery shop for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 28,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy a stock of plain papers. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he plans to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of plain papers to add to his shop.

loans.name: Victorio

texts.es:
El señor Victorio es un señor trabajador  quien es taxista desde hace dos años es una persona trabajadora  y amable.
Esta felizmente casada con la señora Beatriz con quien tiene  dos hijos  por quien trabaja día a día para darles una mejor vida y puedan seguir estudiando para defenderse en el futuro.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de refacciones para su taxi ya que en ocasiones se daña su taxi y tarda mucho tiempo en componerlo y pierde pasajes.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarlo a seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Victorio is a hardworking man who has been a taxi driver for 2 years.  He is a friendly and hardworking person.

He is happily married to Beatriz, and together they have 2 children.  They work for their children each day to provide them with a better life, and to allow them to continue to get an education so that they can take care of themselves in the future.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his taxi, because at times it breaks down and he loses a lot of time fixing it, and so loses fares.

Victorio thanks the Fundacion for helping him to continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 56-year-old widow with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

She has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Marilyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama cooks banku (a dish made from corn dough) for sale; she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Amoanda near Cape Coast.  She is married to a farmer and has 3 children.  Ama has been into this business for 3 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in the gerneral upkeep of their children.  She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she will use to prepare her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she will use to prepare her banku for sale

loans.name: Kossiba Josiane H.

texts.fr: Kossiba Josiane H. âgée de 46 ans est veuve, mère de quatre enfants. Tous ces enfants sont scolarisés et à s charge. Kossiba Josiane H. vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Kossiba Josiane H. Kossiba Josiane H. a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour y arriver, Kossiba Josiane H. vend de nourriture dans sa région depuis quatorze ans. De façon secondaire  Kossiba Josiane H. vend aussi des boissons. Kossiba Josiane H. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Kossiba Josiane H. sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons, du riz et des condiments.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Agnes, 27 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kaptumo, a remote village in Nandihills area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via KIVA, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her two school-going children.
She hopes to sell more poultry during the festive season be part of that dream by granting her a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando makes good earning on her farming activities in Mahayag. This is how he supports his family and able to send his children to school. He wants to increase his farm yield especially that he has high cost of living when his children entered college. Rolando approached Paglaum to loan an amount to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. He has high hopes that he will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Miss Herlinda is a divorced woman since some time ago, and lives alone in the city of Monclova, in the state of Coahuila. She has five married chidlren, that help her finanically whenever they can, but nothing is ever steady. For this reason she looked for a business to secure an income to live dayd to day and not have to depend on anyone. She started 5 years ago to sell and make wood furniture. She now needs a loan of $250 that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months approximately.

The loan is destined to buy wood for the furniture, and this way cover her costs and secure a stable income. She needs you, do not leave her alone. She will be sincerely grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Herlinda es una mujer divorciada desde hace algún tiempo, vive sola en la localidad de Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Tiene cinco hijos los cuales están casados, quienes cuando pueden le apoyan económicamente, pero nunca es nada seguro. Es por esto que ella buscó una actividad de le asegurara ingresos para vivir día y día y no depender de nadie. Comenzó hace 5 años a vender y producir muebles de madera. Ella necesita ahora de un crédito de $250 DLLS, mismo que planea cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses aproximadamente.

El destino del crédito es comprar madera para los muebles, y así poder cubrir los gastos que tiene y asegurar un ingreso estable. Ella te necesita, no la dejes sola, ella te lo va agradecer sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en:
Vusala was born in 1977 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has 3 children.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $600 and bought 2 meaty calves. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 3 meaty calves. She has run this business for 8 years ago.

loans.use: To buy 3 meaty calves

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch M. is 38 years old and lives with her 4 children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away, which put the family in a difficult economic situation.  M. runs a small shop in her village where she sells groceries and cooked food (beef soup and rice).  She is able to make about $6 per day from this business activity.  M. hopes to use this loan to increase her grocery inventory so that she can expand her business.  Additionally, she would like to repair her store.  In the future, she hopes that her four children will be able to continue their education and graduate from high school.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell at her store and also to repair her store

loans.name: Lole

texts.en: Lole is a businesswoman of 36 years of age with four children. She started her business life  making handicrafts such as earrings, bags, and hats all in Samoan styles. She got very good money from her crafts, but she thought its still not enough for her commitments. That’s why she hopes to get a loan of $750 from SPBD  to  add additional supplies to her stock.  She’s thinking of getting a 2nd loan from SPBD to make it big and be a very good businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: Restock her shop

loans.name: Yanih

texts.en: Yanih is 40 years old and married. She raises fish as a business and along with her husband, she is also a tailor. She usually earns a small income and it's just enough for their daily needs. During the summer-time, her potential profits increase. Yanih requests a $100 loan to expand her business, which will provide income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ethel

texts.es:
Ethel is part of the communal bank called Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas. She lives in the district of Calleria, in Ucayali. She is 61 years old, widowed, and has 10 grown children, the oldest of whom are now independent and have their own families. Two of her children live with her, they are her company and her greatest treasure. Thanks to the first loan she was able to start a business buying and selling bronze and aluminum pipes. Ethel has her stand in the central market of Tacorita, where we find her every day, serving her customers with her charismatic smile and good customer service. She gets up very early each day, telling us that God helps those who get up early!

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase more tubes in bronze, iron and aluminum. Ethel tells us that thanks to the loans, her business has grown. She now has a small, well stocked shop and she feels very happy because all of her children are healthy and happy.

La señora Ethel pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Sánchez Cerro 390, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 10 hijos D. las cuales los mayores ya son independientes y han formado su propia familia, pero con ella aun quedan dos que son su compañía y su tesoro mas preciado. Gracias al primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. tubos, bronce y aluminio. En la actualidad ella tiene su puesto en Tacorita puesto 29 (Mercado D. la zona), donD. la podemos encontrar todos los días para que nos atienda con su carismática sonrisa y buen trato, ella se levanta muy temprano por que nos dijo que .. "al que madruga Dios le ayuda". Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,000, (US$ 662.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 docena D. tubos, ½ docena D. bronce, 5 docenas D. fierros y 10 docenas D. aluminio. Ethel, nos dijo que gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio creció, ya que pudo implementar y tener hasta la actualidad un almacén muy surtido y se siente una mujer muy feliz porque tiene a todos sus hijos sanos y felices.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TUBES OF ALUMINUM, IRON AND BRONZE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Cheese selling is now how Rosa, a determined 23 year old eager to progress, earns her living. She started working in this business two years ago. She began by helping her older brothers, but when she saw her own skill and quickness closing sales, she decided to make cheese sales her primary source of income. Rosa buys her merchandise during the weekends in various small villages surrounding Juliaca, the city where she lives. Later she she sells them wholesale in the market of the city of Arequipa where she has a large clientele. The sales of fresh and tasty cheeses has allowed her to satisfactorily pay for her accounting studies. Her desire is to have more capital in order to invest it in her business. For this reason, she turns to your good heart and requests a loan she commits to repaying in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de venta de quesos se ha convertido en el sustento principal de Rosa, joven empeñosa de 23 años de edad con muchísimas ganas de progresar, se viene dedicando a este oficio hace dos años y se inició apoyando a sus hermanos mayores, pero al observar su destreza y rapidez para concretar cada una de las ventas decidió hacer de este oficio su principal ingreso económico.Rosa, adquiere su mercadería los fines de semana en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, para luego enviarlas al por mayor al mercado de la ciudad de Arequipa donde tiene gran clientela.Esta actividad de compra y venta de agradables y frescos quesos le está permitiendo cubrir satisfactoriamente sus estudios de contabilidad y su deseo es contar con mayor capital para invertirlos en esta actividad, para eso recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo, dinero que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Increase of capital to invest in offering a greater number of cheeses

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun N., 42, is a widow and works as a chef in a restaurant in Phnom Penh city. Normally she earns from her work about $2.50 a day. She has 7 children, two of whom are living away from her home.

Mrs. Bun wants to create another business for her son by purchasing a motor-taxi for him. To buy this motor-taxi she needs around $700. So now she is requesting a loan from Kiva of $700 to run a business for her son. ( Mrs. BUN posed for this picture with her mum.)

loans.use: purchase a motor-bike for her son to run a business as a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie C. is 52-years old and a school headmaster. Even though he has logged many years of teaching, he earns less than $100 a month and it could take him a long time to save enough to invest in a business.  Sorie is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase a plot of land to build a family house from mud bricks, and part of the loan will be given to his wife to start a business selling rice and palm oil.  Sorie will pay the installments from his monthly salary.  His aim is to build a family house instead of renting, which is very expensive for the family.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land and help his wife with her business

loans.name: B.

texts.id: S., selain sebagai seorang pengumpul barang-barang bekas, ia juga berprofesi sebagai penjahit mote, bisa berupa sandal, baju atau apa saja yang bisa diberi hiasan mote. Ia biasanya mengambil mote dari Garment disekitarnya lalu kemudian dijahit dan diedarkan ke pembeli-pembeli disekelilingnya. Keuntungan yang didapat bisa dari ongkos jahit dan juga dari ongkos mengedarkan. Khusus untuk sandal, biasanya S. dibayar Rp.2.500 per pasang, sedangkan ongkos mengedarkan biasanya Rp.500 per pasang. Sehari-harinya sepeda motor dan gerobak adalah sarana yang digunakan oleh S.. S. sangat mengharapkan bantuan untuk menambah modal usaha membeli barang-barang bekas dan untuk menambah modal menjahit sandal mote.

loans.use: Untuk Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Juana Yamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. T. has worked with Kiva partner Fundación Leon for the past nine years and has received 19 loans. She runs a general store located in her city's central market. She currently shares the site with her mother, but her dream is to be able to have her own store. She is married with two children, one in preschool. Her husband is a merchant and together they form a united pair that has been able to make headway thanks to hard work and persistence.
Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
La señora T. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos nueve años donde ha recibido diecinueve creditos, ella tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, actualmente comparte un local con su mamá, pero su sueño es llegar a tener su propia tienda, es casada con dos niños, uno en educación pre-escolar y otro tierno su esposo trabaja como comerciante y son una pareja muy unido que han logrado salir adelante con el esfuerzo y empeño de ambos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics and jewelry / capital de trabajo compra de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos y joyas.

loans.name: Dios Es Esperanza (God Is Hope) Group 1

texts.en:
Maria has two children aged 30 and 29 and three grandchildren aged 4, 5 and 5.  Maria owns a ventorrillo (or little store) where he sells yams, plantains, potatoes and other agricultural products. He obtains the vegetables by traveling to the country.  Maria has already successfully completed four loans with Esperanza International, and with a fifth loan, he hopes to be able to expand his business, afford more necessities and provide his grandchildren with a good education.  

Note: This is a group loan.

loans.use: To develop his business and provide for his grandchildren.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena inició el negocio para salir adelante por por necesidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo no tenia un trabajo fijo, entonces ella se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante por si misma y emprendio su negocio hace 3 años, primero solo vendia ropa para bebe, sobre pedidos y realizaba pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o bien vendia casa por casa, ella siempre estaba buscando la manera de generar ventas y gracias a esto ha salido adelente.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancia y asi podra realizar demostraciones, ademas el tiempo de espera para un pedido sera menor para sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon S. owns a grocery store in Ankrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Mol Man, is a farmer; he is on the left in the photo. Mrs. Suon S. is 48 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are attending school. The remaining three are too young to work or study. Previously, she had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Sania's Mama Imarisha Group

texts.en: Sania is 29 years old and married with two children, aged 5 and 7 years old. She runs her own shop and she has been a khanga seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales. Sania is now looking for a loan to increase her inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with tailoring, charcoal and firewood sales khanga sales and other businesses.

loans.use: Sania would like to increase her inventory for her business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene es una alegre madre de familia, se dedica a la crianza de animales, aun tiene pocos porque es una actividad en la recién se inicia, espera poder aumentar pronto esta cantidad, además de esto, ayuda a su esposo en los campos de cultivo, es su ayuda idónea en todo tiempo.  Tiene un tierno corderito que cría en su casa, como mascota, es engreído en el hogar, y a quien su hijita menor ama y cuida.  Con el fin de ayudar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar es que decide dedicarse a la compra y venta de animales, este negocio que es muy rentable, la venta de la carne en los mercados incrementará sus ganancias económicas, para la compra de nuevos animales, es que solicita el presente préstamo.
texts.en:
Marlene is the happy Mother of a family, and she works raising animals. She only has a few as she has only recently started this activity and she hopes to increase the amount she has. As well as this, she helps her husband in agriculture, and he is her great help all the time. She has a lovely lamb that she raised in her house as a pet and it is it is a key part of their home and her daughter loves and looks after it. To be able to help her partner with the family's expenses she buys and sells animals. This is a very profitable business and selling the meat in the markets will increase her economic earnings so she can buy more animals and this is why she is asking for this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of animals she has as she starts out as a farmer/Incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee, en su inicio como ganadera.

loans.name: Theun

texts.en:
Mr. Theun C. is a villager in Eysan Meanchey Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who grows cassava on a 1-hectar field. He now has a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy cassavas to plant. Thus, Mr. Theun C. decided to request a loan for this purpose.

His wife, Mrs. Sok Eng, assists him on the plantation. Mr. Theun C. is 36 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining one is too young to work or study at four years old. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cassava to plant.

loans.name: Aminata Nifiba

texts.fr: Aminata Nifiba L., veuve et mère de 04 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer ses activités de ventes de tissu, tissu teinté et de chaussures. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata Nifiba L., a widow and mother of four children to look after, has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business selling cloth, dyed fabrics, and shoes. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve her famiL.'s living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth and shoes

loans.name: Taj Begum Group

texts.en:
"My name is Taj begum and I’m a 43-year-old widow. I reside in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. I have been a part of this shrine city for the past 15 years. My husband died and left me with six children: five sons and one daughter. My eldest son has a henna-selling business. Two others are mechanics and run a motor workshop. My younger children are getting education in a local school in the community. After my husband’s death, I started selling milk in milk shops. I get up early in the morning and milk the buffalo. My daughter helps me do the milking and fill milk jars. I am applying for a loan for my eldest son who wants to sell jewelry along with henna.  

"I am the group leader for a few more members from my locality. Jamila baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle of the  "Shahzore" make. Kaniz begum baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Riaz begum baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naima baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell." 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to re-sell

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr: cheikh est agé de 39 ans ,il est marié et pére de 3 enfants.Pour gagner sa vie il a depuis trois (03)ans  ouvert un atelier de réparation  de vente de pneus et de chambre à air pour les vehicules.A fin de renforcer son activité  par la l 'achat de quantités importante de pneus et chambre à air ,il sollicite un prêt .
texts.en:
Cheikh is 39 years old, married, and the father of three. To earn his living, he opened a vehicle repair shop three years ago. In order to bolster his business, he is requesting a loan to buy a significant number of tires and inner tubes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayandeji

texts.en: Ayandeji O. is 35 years old and married with two children. He sells building materials. The demands for his building materials are high and he hopes to meet the demands for his goods. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun M., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Thim Chab, 28, were married in 2003 and have two young sons. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Moeun has been selling ice cream for 4 months. He buys it from a company in Phnom Penh and sells it in his village. Before starting this business he drove a taxi. His wife is a silk weaver but she has stopped for a while to take care of their young boys. Moeun is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle to carry ice cream.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his ice cream business.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina E. sells fresh fish in order to help support and sustain her family in Boatase, Elmina.  She is single with 2 children and has received her junior high school education.  Helina has been in this business since 2005.  The loan will be used in order to further expand the business.  The profits gained from this expansion will be used to build a home for Ms. Helina and her family.

loans.use: The loan will be used in order to further expand business.

loans.name: Zakhiriddin

texts.en:
Born in the town of Istaravshan in 1982, Zakhiriddin B. now lives with his wife and their three children. They are also responsible for the care of his elderly mother. Zakhiriddin is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Zakhiriddin would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of US $800 to buy fertilizer to expand his crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and educate all his children with higher education. Zakhiriddin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat sells smoked and ice fish. She started this business eight years ago in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 naira ($500 US) so that she can purchase more fish to sell. Kudirat is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tuhtaboy

texts.ru: Неъматов Тухтабой пожилой человек , который занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Его точка торговли расположена на рынке «Фаровон» г.Гафурова. Он кредитуется с 2007 года для расширения своего бизнеса. Товар ему привозят его дети, не хотят загружать отца тяжёлой работой. Тухтабой хотя и в возрасте, но очень энергичный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Его устраивают все условия Фонда, поэтому Тухтабой, решил получить повторно кредит для завоза товара.
texts.en:
Tuhtaboy N. is an elderly man who sells household goods. His vendor location is on Farovon market in the town of Gafurov. He has been taking out loans since 2007 to expand his business. His children bring in the merchandise and do not want to their father do all the hard work. Even Tuhtaboy is in his old age, but he is very energetic and hardworking man. He is very happy with all the terms of the fund and has decided to repeat the loan term to buy merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of spare parts

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La señora Saturnina es una cliente antigua de la instiucion,  es una cliente responsable y puntual, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, su venta la realiza en la feria 16 de julio, de la ciudad de El Alto , es una da las ferias mas concurridas de la ciudad de La Paz, su puesto esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico de la feria , la señora compra ropa a medio uso por fardos o por amarro.  Tiene un hijo de 10 años que esta estudiando, su esposo se dedica a la venta de zapatos cerca del puesto de su esposa.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a longtime customer of the bank, and is responsible and punctual. She sells used clothes in the 16th of July market in the city of El Alto. This is one of the most highly attended markets in the city of La Paz and her stand is very strategically located. She purchases used clothes in bundles. She has a 10 year old son who is in school. Her husband sells shoes at a stand near hers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa del Carmen N. D. D. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Teresa  vive con su hija Laura D. 13 años D. edad que actualmente está cursando séptimo grado en la escuela. Teresa recibe ayuda económica D. su esposo D. 35$ mensuales, cantidad que no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos básicos familiares; es por ello que Teresa  monto una tienda en su casa la cual le ha generado muchos beneficios económicos, ya que posee buenas ventas por que la casa D. Teresa se encuentra ubicada en calle principal donD. hay mucha accesibilidad D. la tienda que lleva como nombre “Tienda Jerusalén”. Teresa solicita este crédito para invertir en productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen N. D. D. lives in the La Libertad department. Teresa lives with her 13 year old daughter, Laura. Laura is currently in the seventh graD. in school. Teresa receives $35 of support from her husband every month. That amount is not enough to cover the basic family expenses. That is why Teresa started a store in her house. The store has been generating a lot of economic benefits. Her sales are good because Teresa’s house is located on a main street with lots of accessibility to the store. “Tienda Jerusalén” is the store’s name. Teresa is asking for a loan to buy products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Nidia Sabina

texts.es: La Señora Nidia Sabina López es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es madre soltera, tiene 57 años y 1 hijo que depende de ella. Es por eso que Nidia se esfuerza muy duro con esta actividad económica. El ser una madre responsable, la motivo para iniciar con este negocio, y poco a poco fue suministrándole los productos que se utilizan para uso diario y cotidiano. En la actualidad sus clientes recurren a su pulpería por su buena atención y por encontrar lo necesario. Con este financiamiento comprara golosinas, jugos, refrescos naturales, pan y gaseosa. Su mayor deseo es que su pequeña pulpería se convierta en una mini distribuidora que sea mucho más favorable para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nidia Sabina López has been a client of the Fundación León since 2000. She is a 57 year old single mother with one dependent son. He is the reason Nidea puts forth so much effort into her work. Being a responsible mother is what motivated her to start this business. Little by little she was supplying her business with daily use products. Her customers currently go to her mini market for her good service and to find what they need. With this loan she will buy sweets, juice, natural drinks, bread, and soft drinks. Her biggest desire is to change her small store into being a mini distributor, which would be much more favorable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle exerce son commerce au marché local d’adidogomé depuis 2005. La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée, pour les satisfaire elle doit se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 4 cartons de spaghettis, 6 bidons d’huile « nioto », 4 bidons moyens d’huile rouge, 1 carton de détergents « momo magic » et divers produits de premières nécessités.
Elle est mariée et a 01 enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from commerce in grocery items. She has been operating at the local market of Adidogomé since 2005. The customer demand is high right now. To satisfy it, she must stock up again, which is why she's requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy four boxes of spaghetti, six drums of "nioto" oil, four middle-sized drums of red palm oil, one box of Momo Magic detergent, and various necessities. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying grocery items to sell

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
Mirna de Jesús N. P., Santiago José P. y Juana Isabel V. son los tres integrantes del grupo Cielo, quienes pertenecen a la comarca Las Pilas, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya.

La coordinadora del grupo es Mirna de 38 años de edad, quien desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa de todo tipo; Vestidos, camisas, pantalones, ropa para niño, entre otros. Inició su negocio trabajándole a una señora que importaba la ropa a honduras, pero le pagaba muy poco puesto que ella le proporcionaba los materiales.

Cuando conoció ADIM, pudo invertir en materiales y de esa manera ganar más al vender sus piezas. Los obstáculos más grandes que ha enfrentado son las dificultades que actualmente afectan Honduras, por lo cual ha tenido que abrir nuevo mercado. No obstante, no teme seguir adelante y está iniciando en el comercio nacional para vender sus mercancías.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la compra de materiales para continuar su negocio y ofertar variedad de productos.

Juana trabaja vendiendo verduras de manera ambulantes y Santiago vende ropa por encargo y de manera ambulante; ambos en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
Mirna de Jesús N. P., Santiago José P., and Juana Isabel V. are the three members of the Cielo (“Sky”) group. They come from the Las Pilas region and are originally from the city of Masaya. Mirna is the group’s coordinator. She is 38 years old, and for the last 5 years has made a living making all kinds of clothing: dresses, shirts, trousers, children’s clothing, etc. She started off in this business working for a woman who exported the clothing she made to Honduras, but the woman paid Mirna very little because she supplied Mirna with the materials. Once Mirna began working with Kiva partner ADIM she was able to invest in materials and thus earn more when she sold her products. The biggest obstacles she has faced are the difficulties that are currently affecting Honduras, and that is why she has had to start selling for a new market. Nevertheless, Mirna is not afraid to get ahead, and so she is beginning to sell her merchandise locally. Mirna wants to use her loan to purchase materials so she can continue with her business and offer a variety of products. Juana works selling vegetables as a street vendor, while Santiago sells clothing to order--also as a street vendor. Both of them work in the city of Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing raw material to continue with her business and diversify her products

loans.name: David 3 Group

texts.en:
Charlot is the coordinator of the group David which is based in a Batey in the area surrounding L. Romana. A batey is a rural community located amongst the vast sugarcane fields outsiD. of L. Ramona, and the inhabitants, largely of Haitian origin work in cutting sugarcane in the blistering Caribbean sun. Here she makes her home among her fellow Hatian immigrants who work in the Batey.

Charlot came to Esperanza 6 months ago, Charlot has completed here first loan cycle without incident and is now requesting her second loan. With this new loan she intends to purchase a dozen pairs of men's pants, 6 pairs of womens pants, two dozen blouses and a half a dozen perfumes which she will sell in her community. Her dream is to use the profits from this business to finish building her home and to travel to Haiti regularly to see family and to purchase merchandise for cheaper in Haiti.

loans.use: Pants, blouses and perfumes

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 40 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Jean has been working as a hairdresser for nine years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for his salon. Jean has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. 

His previous loans helped him improve his salon. Jean's work is special because he does a good job and is aware of the new hair style fashions. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Jean first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by doing other aesthetic services.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Chank

texts.en: Chank S. was born in 1958 and is the good mother blessed with five children: three are married and live independently, while other two are sill living in home and are dependent on her income. She sells firewood and charcoal to local people, as many of them need it to cook their foods. She began her business in 1980 and she earns around 15,000 riel a day to feed her family. While her business is doing well, he always takes time to buy more produces during the part of stock supply has been exhausted. Chank S. has asked for a loan in order to better sustain her stable business. She and her daughter are pictured over.

loans.use: To better sustain her stable business

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel H. H.  de 28 años de edad vive con su esposa  e hija de 5 años de edad, originario del departamento de Cabañas donde aun reside con su familia. Víctor es un hombre muy inteligente ha montado su propio negocio con las capacidades y conocimientos que él conoce y domina sobre costura, el se dedica a la elaboración de ropa a la medida. En esta oportunidad el está solicitando de un crédito para comprar dos maquinas de coser ya que su demanda ha aumentado y  sus metas son instalar un mini taller de costura y así  poder hacer crecer su negocio al igual que sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel H. H., who is 28 years old, lives with his wife and 5-year-old daughter. He is originally from the Cabañas district, where his family still resides. Víctor, a very smart man, has created his own business from his own skills and knowledge of the field of tailoring. He makes his living from the production of custom clothing. On this occasion, he is seeking a loan to buy two sewing machines because the demand for his services has increased. His goal is to establish a mini-tailoring workshop and thus be able to expand his business and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two sewing machines

loans.name: Narcisia

texts.en:
Narcisia sells vegetables, fish and meat in their village. She hopes to improve her business so as to better provide for the needs of her children, especially in terms of their education, and is therefore requesting a loan of PHP5,000.00. Narcisia will use the loan to buy more inventory in order to increase her income.

Residing in the village of Mozzozzin Norte, Sta.Maria Isabela, Narcisia, 24 years old and married to Joseph, a pottery maker in their village, is the mother of two children: Marygrace - four years old, already in pre-school and Joseph Jr. - three years old.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase her inventory

loans.name: Narzieva

texts.en:
Narzieva D. operates a small business selling men’s clothes. She has an attractively arranged store at Penjikent market in Tajikistan, where she carries all sorts of necessary clothes. Narzieva has been in business for about 6 years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her family. Her business is growing, and she has requested a loan of 4500 Somoni to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business. With your help this will be possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Z. Oyungerel is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her sons, ages 20 and 19, are both university students. Oyngerel operates a grocery and dairy trading business with the help of her husband. She operates her business from a rented stall and sells a variety of food and local dairy products. Oyungerel started her business in 2000 with a loan of 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD) from Xacbank, Kiva's Mongolian MFI. Her business has grown quickly over the years and she has gained much business experience. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a car for her family and rent an additional stall at a local trading center. Oyungerel is focused on continuing her success in the future and says, "I am working hard to support my family and raise my children to be responsible people." She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase vegetables to sell in her business. 


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tungalagtuul

texts.en: Tungalagtuul is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two children, 13 and 7, both attend local schools while Tungalagtuul and her husband operate a clothes-making business in their town. She began her business in 2005 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~$700 US) and after four years in operation, she has gained a lot of experience and many customers. Her working capital now exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~$1400 US). She says, “I want to keep expanding and improving my business in the future.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~$1050 US) loan in order to purchase fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
Grupo Rojo está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras ellas son Emma S. M. quien vende licor en su casa de habitación un negocio muy prospero, Silvia O. M. trabaja con las dos compañías telefónicas de Nicaragua Claro y Movistar con la ventas de recargas y Jairo Antonio S. tiene un pequeño bar.

Ellos desean seguir prosperando y mejorando por sus familias para que ellos puedan estudiar y tener una vida más prospera.
texts.en:
Grupo Rojo si made up of three, hard-working, enterprising and tenacious people. Emma S. M., sells liquor from her home; a very profitable enterprise. Silvia O. M. sells rechargable phone cards for two telephone companies: Nicaragua Claro and Movistar. And Jairo Antonio S. has a small bar. They would like to be able to continue to support their families so that they can study and have a more properous life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy liquor.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 27 years old and single. He lives in Ruhengeli in the northern province of Rwanda, Burera district, and is still living with his parents. Antoine socializes with his parents after coming back from his daily work.

Antoine owns a small shop that sells different kinds of products such as water, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits (cookies) and so forth. His business is well organized, famous and important for his neighbors, the reasons why he is stimulated to grow his business through purchasing more products to sell. Antoine has been an entrepreneur for nine years and the hours of his business are 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., every day except Sunday.

Antoine is requesting his loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase other new products such as trousers, shirts, bags and so on. With these new products, he hopes to earn more customers because of many requests for these items.

By earning more profits, Antoine will be able to build his own house so that he is able to get married.

loans.use: To purchase other new products such as trousers, shirts, bags and so on

loans.name: Neamat

texts.en: Neamat is a 48-year-old single woman living with her parents and 3 siblings. She has been working as a tailor since 1999. During this time she has become well known in her town and its surroundings. She helps to earn income for her family. Today, Neamat is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine to be able to make a variety of products for her clients.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is a newly recognized member of ASHI. She is 28 years of age and a mother to her three children whose age ranges from two to eight years old. Josephine and her husband agreed to request a loan, which will enable her small “sari-sari” (variety) store and hog fattening business to grow. This aspiration is very important for Josephine because her dream of improving her family lifestyle and sustaining the education of her children until they graduate from colleges relies on it.  

Josephine’s small “sari-sari” store includes vegetables and fruits. This offers convenience for her customers who live around their village because it is from the municipality market. The same is true with her hog fattening business. After four months of fattening her hogs, they will be slaughtered and sold in her small store.  Despite the limited products her store can offer to her customers, Jocelyn feels happy to provide them with their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a variety goods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married, and has one adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling new clothes in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Erlinda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mr. Nov P. is 57 years old and he is a villager who lives in A Cheang village in Takeo province. He is a widow with two children. One of the children stays at home and supports his father's business and the other one is a student. 
                
Mr. Nov P. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although he tries to work hard with his farming, he still does not earn enough income to support his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and pigs for breeding. He hopes to increase his income to improve his family's standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow and pigs

loans.name: Koffi A

texts.fr: ajoute
texts.en:
ajoute

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing coffee and cacao

loans.name: Orfa Angélica

texts.es: Orfa Angélica S. D. A. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el  municipio D. Izalco, ubicado en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico y junto a sus tres hijos D. 18, 17, y 10 años D. edad. Orfa se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. oro, así mismo comercializa perfumería y productos D. revistas. Su venta esta ubicada en su propia casa, y así mismo con el fin D. poder obtener algunas ganancias extras, ofrece sus productos entre sus vecinos y amigos. El mayor deseo D. Orfa es el D. mejorar sus ganancias y D. esta manera mejorar la estabilidad D. su hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir más en el negocio, comprando diversidad D. perfumes, los cuales son los que poseen mayor demanda. Para Orfa esto representa una gran oportunidad D. salir adelante y mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Orfa Angélica S. D. A., age 35, lives in the Izalco municipality, which is located in the Sonsonate department. She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and their three children. The children are 18, 17, and 10 years old. Orfa sells gold jewelry. She also sells perfume and products from catalogs. She sells from her home. In order to be able to get extra earnings, she also sells her products to her neighbors and friends. Orfa’s greatest wish is to improve her earnings. That way she will improve the household stability. That is why she is requesting a loan, which she will be able to use to invest more in her business. She will buy various perfumes, which are in the greater demand. To Orfa this represents a great opportunity to get ahead and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume

loans.name: Venus' Group

texts.en:
Venus is the wife of W. and lives in a city named Lahore (famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods) in Pakistan. A very talented and supportive lady, Venus helps her husband in his grocery shop. She stays with him and deals with the customers. In this way, they manage the large number of customers at once and leave a good impression on them. 

Venus is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in the grocery shop so her husband can purchase the groceries in bulk and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 52 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Artemio de 54 años y sus 3 menores hijos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Domitila se dedica, es el cultivo de café y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en Pichanaki, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y para ella lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, pese que éstos químicos afectan su salud. Con el tiempo espera comprar nuevas tierras y de esa manera aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siente que éste aporte lo ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Domitila, 52 years of age, is a cheerful and hard-working mother to her family. She lives in her own home along with her husband Artemio, 54, and their three minor children for whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. Domitila works in the cultivation of coffee and bananas. Every day, very early in the morning, she works in her field, knowing that the money she obtains for her products will depend heavily on the quality of her harvest. She sells her products in Pichanaki, where better prices are offered. What she enjoys most about her work is the harvest, since it is then that she feels that the months of labor have come to fruition. She has worked in this business for three years and the most challenging part of her work is fumigating her land as the chemicals are damaging to her health. In time she hopes to buy new land and in this way increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP. She feels that this contribution will help her greatly in the progress of her work. In her Communal Bank she is deeply loved by the rest of the members, since she is highly supportive of them. With the 2,000 soles she is requesting, she will buy more natural and chemical fertilizers to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase natural and chemical fertilizers to improve the quality of the land

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally S. (pictured with her husband), age 41 years old, and her husband, Mr. Thea Sot, age 40, married in 1988 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Phally has been selling bananas since she was single. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for fifteen years. She is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to carry bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry bananas to sell

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Jacinto, tiene 45 años y es natural del Cusco.

Jacinto nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a la distribución de productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa a las tiendas de la ciudad de Izcuchaca y a las comunidades de Anta y los días sábados me dedico a la venta de zapatos en el mercado Altiplano de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank "LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA" is presently working its 5th cycle and is set up by hard-working and entrepreneurial individuals who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort give a better future to their children. The meetings of the community bank are every thirty days in the main office of Asociación Arariwa.

Jacinto is 45 years old and from Cusco.

Jacinto tells us: " We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I distribute products for personal hygiene and home accessories in the stores of the town of Izcuchaca and the communities of Anta and on Saturdays I sell footwear at the Altiplano market of the town of Cusco. For several years I have worked with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well. At the moment I need the loan to buy more merchandise."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo ha salido a delante tiene 46 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos estudiantes.
Su esposo trabaja en seguridad, el cual gana poco.
Es por eso ella toma la iniciativa de poder apoyar a su familia y con poco dinero de ahorro, comienza a comprar cerdo, el cual destaza y vende carne, como su manteca, lo que comienza a captar cliente.
Las dificultades es que tenía que esperar recoger todo el dinero para comprar más cerdo.
Lo que comienza a buscar fondos para lograr invertir en su pequeño negocio. La mejor opción era el financiamiento que logra, comenzar.
Con este préstamo comprara tres cerdos mas, ya qué ahora destaza dos o tres veces a la semana. Y mueve más su capital, a si como sus ganancias para lograr cubrir las necesidades personales, como gastos básicos de agua y luz.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a hard-working woman, who has moved ahead with a lot of effort . She is 46 years of age, married, with three children who are students. Her husband works in security, from which he earns little. For this reason, she has taken the initiative to help support her family and, with a little of her savings, she began to buy hogs, which she butchers and then sells the meat, such as bacon. The business has begun to draw customers. The difficulty is that she has to wait to collect all the money to buy another hog. She has begun to seek funds to invest in her small business. The best option was the financing that she has obtained. With this loan she bought three more hogs. She is already butchering two or three hogs a week. And her capital is quickly used up, just as her profits are used up to cover personal needs, like basic expenses for water and light.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three hogs to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Pablo Heriberto

texts.es: Pablo Heriberto R. de 39 años de edad,  reside en el hermoso pueblo de Alegría, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su compañera de vida, la cual le ayuda a Pablo con el negocio. Él posee una venta de comida típica como: pupusas, empanadas, pastelitos, yuca frita y muchos más, los cuales son elaborados por su esposa, estos alimentos son comercializados en su casa de habitación en donde cada tarde colocan una mesa con todo los antojitos y de esta forma los venden con personas que viven alrededor o que transitan por el lugar. Pablo se encarga de vender y cobrar los productos, y de esta forma ambos trabajan en conjunto para poder sacarle el mayor provecho a su negocio, el cual desde hace 2 años les permite contar con todo lo necesario y esencial para vivir. Pablo solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos, productos como: maíz, verduras, frijoles, arroz, vinagre y otros más, los cuales le permitirán tanto a Pablo como a su esposo poder elaborar mayor cantidad de platillos y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Pablo Heriberto R. is 39 years old. He resides in the beautiful village of Alegría, in the department of Usulután, with his life partner, who helps Pablo with the business. He has a sales stand where he sells traditional foods such as pupusas [filled tortillas], empanadas, pastelitos [stuffed pastries], fried yuca, and much more. The food is prepared by his wife and sold from their house. Each evening, they set out a table with all of the snacks, so that people living nearby or passing through can buy the food. Pablo is in charge of selling the products and handling the money, and in this way they work together to get the most out of their business. For the past 2 years, this work has allowed them to support themselves with all that is necessary and essential in their daily lives. Pablo is requesting a loan with the strong desire to purchase a larger quantity of ingredients and supplies (such as corn, vegetables, beans, rice, vinegar, among others) in order to prepare a greater amount of food and thus increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients and supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Maricela M. J. cuenta con un salón de belleza, tiene mas de 5 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, lo que le permite tener muy buena clientela,  su negocio opera bajo el nombre de SALA DE BELLEZA MARICELA, el cual esta ubicado en el Barrio San isidro, lugar estratégico para este tipo de negocio ya que esta ubicado en el centro de la cuidad de El Paraíso y es de fácil acceso.     
La Sra. M. es conocida en el lugar por su solvencia moral y de buena conducta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de material y accesorios de belleza como ser Shampoo, cremas, tintes, gotas de tratamiento etc. 
Con los ingresos que le a generado su negocio a logrado sacar adelante su familia. 
Maria por su profesionalismo y calidad en el servicio que presta sus clientes le prefieren lo que le permite tener clientes todo el año, generándole ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo, lo que les facilita sobre llevar las cargas mutuamente y así salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
Maria Maricela M. J. has a beauty salon. She has 5 years of experience in this line of work, and as a result she has a very good customer base. Her business operates under the name "Sala de Belleza Maricela," and is located in the San Isidro neighborhood, a strategic location for this type of business since it is located in the center of the city of El Paraiso and so offers easy access. Senora M. is known in the area for her moral character and her good conduct. She will use the loan to buy accessories and beauty supplies such as shampoo, creams, hair dyes, hair treatment drops, etc. With the income she generates from her business she has managed to provide for her family. As a result of Maria's professionalism and the quality of service that she provides to her customers, her customers prefer her business and her business is always busy. As a result, she generates income to help her husband, making it easier on them as they can bear the burdens together and get ahead together.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioners, hair dyes, peroxides, hair treatments, hair gel, hair creams, hair treatment vials

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea J. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Andrea is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Andrea operates a mini restaurant and a mini store, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Andrea has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Andrea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andrea is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the first loan taken out by Andrea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
