loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en: Tsolmon N. is a 31-year-old single woman who lives with her mother in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her mother live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her mother is retired. Tsolmon sells a variety of woman's clothes out of a stall at the local market. She started her business in 2007 by selling only woman's lingerie and underwear. She has found success in her trade and expanded her product variety and lines. She is a clever businesswoman. She is applying for this 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of leather boots at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of leather boots

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita L., age 48, is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. Bernardita and her husband have five school-aged children. To make a living, Bernardita owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Bernardita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

This year, Bernardita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bernardita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks to sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Alberto de 36 años de edad y residente de San Jacinto, municipio ubicado en del departamento de Bolívar,  tiene un negocio no muy tradicional: está dedicado a la apicultura,  y también compra cerdo y carnero en pie que vende en canal; así sacrifican al animal,  retirando su piel, vísceras patas y cabeza para luego  pesarla y venderla por libras;  Miguel inicialmente se dedicaba a la agricultura y a la ganadería en los Montes de María, donde históricamente aprendió este oficio, pero la situación que se vivió hace mas de 10 años, lo obligó a salir de sus tierras, a las que hace tres años regresó, pero para dedicarse a la apicultura con unos amigos y también a la venta de carnes ya que cuenta con una clientela en el municipio de San Jacinto.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con una parte de él,  comprará cerdo y carnero, alimentos que usan mucho las amas de casa para la preparación de su comidas especiales en esta navidad y año nuevo y que aumentará  sus demanda en esta época; con la otra parte del crédito comprará materiales para las colmenas productoras de miel, como marcos, láminas de cera, cajas y techos para sus cultivos de abejas.
Su sueño junto a su cónyuge, es educar a sus hijas,  que en la actualidad tienen 6 y 12 años,  para que en un futuro sean unas profesionales exitosas y continuar ensanchando su negocio hasta lograr buenas utilidades que le permitan  tener su casa propia y  bienestar  familiar.
texts.en:
Miguel Alberto is 36 years old and a resident of San Jacinto, a municipality located in the department of Bolívar.  He has a very traditional business:  he is dedicated to beekeeping, and also to buying pigs and cows to then sell in parts.  The animal is sacrificed, removing the skin, viscera, hooves and head, to later weigh and sell per pound.  Miguel initially dedicated himself to farming and raising livestock in the Montes de María, where he learned the trade.  The situation he faced obligated him to leave his lands, to which he returned three years ago, but to instead tend to bees with some friends and to sell meats as he has a customer base in San Jacinto.

This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With part of the loan, he will buy pigs and cows, foods that homemakers use a great deal to prepare special dishes for this coming holiday season.  He will use the other part of the loan to buy materials for honey producing beehives, such as frames, sheets of wax, boxes, and roofs.  His dream, and that of his wife, is to educate their daughters who are currently 6 and 12 years old, so that they can have a successful future as professionals.  He would also like to continue growing his business until he earns enough to have his own house and for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Partially to buy pigs and cows, and partially to buy beekeeping materials such as frames, sheets of wax, boxes and roofs.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Kgrm Group

texts.fr:
Séraphine M. est une femme de 31 ans, et elle est un membre de la groupe Abunzubumwe KGRM, un groupe des femmes entrepreneurs.  Elle vend les fruits à Nyabugogo.   Elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 5 ans et 10 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, elle veut acheter des fruits.  Séraphine voudrait améliorer ses activités, alors elle pouvait vendre les fruits au marché a Nyabugogo.  Son ambition pour sa famille est de rénover sa maison d’habitation.

Note**  Il y a sept personnes dans ce groupe, mais il y a huit personnes dans la photo.  Une de ces femmes était enceinte, alors elle ne travaille pas encore.
texts.en:
Séraphine M., 31 years old, is a member of Abunzubumwe KGRM, a group of women entrepreneurs. 

She sells fruit in Nyabugogo. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and ten. All attend school. 

Séraphine plans to use her loan to buy fruit. In order to boost her operations, she could sell the fruit at the Nyabugogo market. Her goal is to renovate the family home.

Note ** There are eight people in the photo, but this group consists of seven members. One of the ladies was pregnant and is not currently active within the group.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Peri

texts.en: Peri M. lives with her mother, brother and sister. Being the oldest among the children, after Peri’s father passed away, Peri started her business to support the family. Peri’s brother is in the Army and her sister is a student. Peri’s mother has helped in running her clothing and linen business since 2008. Peri has succeeded in having a good clientele. For the upcoming New Year and Christmas season Peri needs to make new orders, for which she has applied for the loan.

loans.use: stocking up on Christmas and New Year orders

loans.name: Arturo Adan

texts.es:
Arturo Adan L. S. tiene 73 años. Es viudo, vive con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Arturo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es cambiar la situación económica para el bienestar de su familia.

Le gusta la música y tener muchos amigos.
texts.en:
Arturo Adan L. S. is 73 years old.  He is a widower, he lives with his children, and lives in the town of Chillanes in the Bolivar Province.

The members of the V.R.C Valle Paraiso (Paradise Valley) are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office in the town of Chillanes.  This service point works with short season agricultural activities like cacao growing, which they have been doing for a long time.

Arturo has worked in agriculture growing cacao for the last two years.  He buys products from Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes fair and in the same store where he makes his purchases.

He is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.  With the support of the loan, it would help him economically to meet his needs.  His plants have to face problems like pests, diseases, and weather variations.  His dream is to change his economic situation for the well-being of his family.

He enjoys music and having many friends.

loans.use: Agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 40 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 20 ans .En 1993, étant déjà fille mère, elle arrête ses études en classe de première et se lance dans la vente des fournitures scolaires pour prendre soin de ses enfants.
Ayant bénéficie d'un premier prêt,il y a quatre mois,il renforce son activité en achetant des cartons de cahiers, des cartons de feuille rames; des cartons de stylos, feutres , crayons de différents couleurs .
Ses recettes ont augmentes de 30.000f a 100.000 fr par jour, puisque son lieu de vente se situe entre des administrations en plein centre ville et un complexe scolaire.
Elle a rembourse son prêt sans difficulté et a eu a faire des épargnes considérables.

Avec le second prêt , elle va aller dans la même perspective en élargissant son activité et renforcer le stock de 
 ses marchandises ,tout en satisfaisant les besoins de ses clients et en faisant plus des bénéfices énormes. 

Cliente très remarquable par son bon caractère ,sa promptitude et sa régularité dans le lieu de remboursement, elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout pour atteindre ses objectifs
texts.en:
A 40-year woman, single with two children, 16 and 20 years of age. In 1993,  already a single young mother, she abandoned her high school studies because of the need to provide for her children abd started a business selling office and school supplies. 

With her first loan, four months ago, she replenished her stock, purchasing notebooks, reams of papers, boxes of  ballpoint pens, markers, and pencils of various colors.  Her sales have increased from 30,000 to 100,000 West African Francs per day, as her stand is located  downtown, in an area with many    offices and  a school building. She repaid her loan without any issues and was able to put away substantial savings. WIth this second loan, she is going to continue the strategy of expanding her business by reinforcing her merchandise stock, meeting her clients' needs and achieving significant revenues. This client  stands out by being reliable, prompt and punctual in her payments. She is set on doing  all she possibly can to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchasing reams of paper, notebooks, ballpoint paints, markers, file folders, boxes of pencils

loans.name: Alonzo

texts.es:
Alonzo es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola de tierras bastante fértiles debido a que cuentan con agua durante todo el año. Se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años  a trabajar en la crianza y comercialización de cerdos. El cría sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y al público en general. El negocio es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos para sostener la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Alonzo desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para lograr que sus cerdos se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a un mejor precio, además desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alonzo is a 44-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún. It is an agricultural zone with very fertile lands due to the fact that they have water all year round, and it is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked for more than ten years raising and selling pigs. He raises his animals in the back part of his house, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good size, he sells them to the businessmen that visit the area where he lives and to the general public. The business is a very important source of income to support his family, which is why he always tries to maintain it in the best way possible.

Alonzo wants to get more balanced feed so that his pigs grow better and can be sold at a better price. He also wants to make some improvements on his pens. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To get more balanced feed so that his pigs will grow better and can be sold at a better price

loans.name: Yhovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yhovana; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar y comprar mesas y sillas para el restaurant.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the LLAPANCHISPAC communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Yhovana. She is 36 years old. She has a live-in boyfriend and 2 children. This member alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner. She serves from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. This member wants to expand her restaurant business. She is requesting this loan to set up and buy tables and chairs for the restaurant.

This member is happy for the loan. She is committed to making the repayment installments.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to set up and buy tables and chairs for a restaurant.

loans.name: Enma Espedicta

texts.es: Enma Espedicta tiene 46 años, es una mujer luchadora y que le gusta trabajar de manera humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 6 años que inicio con esta actividad con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos entre los días que vende y días que no vende, ya que algunas veces no vendía cantidades grandes pero vendía lo necesario para comer. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado entre otras cosas. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos sigan adelante con este negocio que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Emma Espedicta, 46, is a hard working woman who likes to work humbly.  Her economic activity is general merchandise sales.  She started this work over 6 years ago with the goal of supporting her children both on days when she sold and on days when she did not because sometimes she only sold a few items but she always sold enough to afford to eat.

The requested loan is for working capital that will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear, among others.  Her dream is that her children succeed through this business which is her source of support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics, footwear and others.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces maize, beans, and tomatoes. She has been in the farming business for five years now and sells her products to the local market. She is 43 years old and married with six children who are between the ages of 4 and 16 years. All the children attend school except one.

She has requested for a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to improve her family's livelihood. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough water for her dairy cows especially during the dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Titus Mburu

texts.en:
Titus is a 26-year-old single man. He has a motorbike which he uses for a transport service for the people of Kabati Thika. He has been in the business for a period of about one year now with an income of 5,300 Kenyan shillings per month.

Titus has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his first loan from KADET, which he intends to use to buy an extra motorbike. He hopes to expand his transport business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy an extra motorbike

loans.name: Denic Maria

texts.es:
Desnic de 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien asume los compromisos de pagos en conjunta con ella, han pagado los crèditos obtenidos; ambos son docente y dos jovenes luchadores que les gusta el progreso, ella  trabaja como docente de educaciòn primaria  en la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce desde hace 7 años impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesino de la colonia Naciones,  es  habitante de la  zona  Naciones Unida.  
Solicicita su 4to crèdito para comprar materiales de construcciòn  para construir un porche en su vivienda, a la vez agradece a Kiva por el financiamiento anterior esto le permitio mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda al repellar las paredes.  

Esta joven tiene muchos sueños por cumplir uno de ellos es ver su casa con todas las mejoras necesarias que le brinde las condiones comodamente a su familia y otro sueño principal es el de llegar a tener sus hijos y poder darles los mejor, mucho amor y dedicacion.
texts.en:
Desnic is 23 years old and lives with her husband.  They share responsibility for making their loan repayments.  They have both repaid previous loans.

Desnic and her husband are teachers.  They are both determined young people who like to make progress in life.  Desnic is a teacher at Francisco Aaron Joce Elementary School.  She has been teaching children from the rural Naciones district for 7 years.  She lives in Naciones Unidas district.

Desnic is requesting her fourth loan to buy construction supplies so that she can build a porch on her home.  At the same time, she is grateful to Kiva for her previous loan which enabled her to improve her home by plastering the walls.

This young lady has many dreams to fulfil.  One of them is to see her house with all the improvements it needs to provide her family with comfortable living conditions.  Another one of her biggest dreams is to have children and be able to provide them with the best, a lot of love and devotion.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Espuma Del Tunal Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ESPUMA DEL TUNAL" ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO D. MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES Y ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE SOLICITAN. LA SEÑORA ISABEL H. S. TIENE 58 AÑOS, NO TIENE ESTUDIOS, ES VIUDA Y TIENE EN TOTAL 4 HIJOS (2 MUJERES Y 2 VARONES). ELLA SE DEDICA A LOS BORDADOS EL CUAL INICIO HACE 40 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA SUS BORDADOS COMO HILOS,TELA, AGUJAS ETC. LA SEÑORA COMENTA QUE SUS CLIENTES HAN QUEDADO SATISFECHOS CON EL SERVICIO QUE OFRECE YA QUE ENTREGA A TIEMPO SU PRODUCTO, ADEMÁS D. SER MUY BONITOS Y BIEN ELABORADOS. AL MOMENTO D. SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE FELIZ YA QUE ELLA LO VE COMO UNA AYUDA NECESARIA PARA QUE TENGA MAS VENTAS Y MAS INGRESOS PARA APOYAR EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y SEGUIR DANDOLES A SUS HIJOS LA OPORTUNIDAD D. ESTUDIAR PARA QUE SALGAN ADELANTE Y TENGAN UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group is called "ESPUMA DEL TUNAL" and is located in the state of México.  The group has nine members and this is their first loan request.

Mrs. Isabel Hernández Sánchez, 58, never went to school.  She’s a widow and has four children (2 girls and 2 boys).  She’s done embroidery for 40 years and is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her embroidery work like: thread, fabric, needles, etc.  She comments that her customers have been very satisfied with the service she provides because she delivers items on time; besides, they are very pretty and well maD..

She’s happy about the loan because she sees it as a necessary help so that she can have more sales and income to support household expenses and continue to proviD. her children with the opportunity to go to school, get ahead and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: William Ntina

texts.en:
William Ntina N., 43 years old, is a resident of Olokurto-Narok,Kenya. He is married and blessed with four children. He is a wheat farmer, a business he has been running for the last seven years. 

He learned about KADET through a credit officer of KADET. This is his first loan from  KADET which he plans to use to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to generate profit and use it to add a number of acres to his plantation and start a livestock business.


His dreams are to buy and build on plots of land and to provide a better standard of living for his children. He is a conscientious man who can achieve more if funded.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es  propia. Hace más de 2 años decidió generarse sus propios ingresos, así que emprendió su negocio de manera independiente, en un inicio ofrecía los servicios de fotografías y filmaciones, sin embargo se le presentó la oportunidad de  vender licores y yogurt, resultándole muy rentable. Desde entonces realiza la venta de estos productos en la calle, en donde logra buenas ventas. Ella trabaja todos lo días, así asegurar acumular más ganancias, ya que su objetivo es tener un local donde pueda vender. Sus planes es mejorar su negocio en los próximos meses y establecerse, mientras seguirá esforzándose cada día para superar sus ventas. Es su crédito número 4 con MFP, afirma que haber accedido a un crédito fue una experiencia positiva que le ha permitido mejorar en sus ingresos y aprender. Esta muy agradecida por las oportunidades de préstamo a las que ha accedido y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará para incrementar su capital de trabajo en la adquisición de mercadería.
texts.en: Juana is 34 years old and she lives with her husband and their three children in a house that they own. More than tow years ago she decided to start an independent business in order to generate her own income. At the start she provided photography and film services but later she saw the opportunity to sell liquors and yogurt, which turned out to be very successful. Since then she has been selling these products on the street and she has good sales. She works every day in order to accumulate more earnings. Her objective is to have a store from where to sell. Her plans are to improve her business in the following months and establish herself. She will keep putting her best efforts every day to improve her sales. This is her fourth with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she says that having accessed a loan has been a positive experience that has given her the opportunity to improve her business and to learn. She is very thankful for the opportunities that this loan has granted her and she is committed to be punctual with her payments. With the loan that she requests she plans on using it to increase her working capital and to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: to supply her store with liquors and yogurt.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltero  y vive solo. El pretende con el crédito compra la semilla de lechuga y culantro para sembrar en su invernadero. También quiere hacerle una mejoras para así tenerlo en buenas condiciones y amplio para mas producción. El cuenta con el terreno prestado donde creó este invernadero y cuenta con varios años de experiencia en la producción de hortalizas. El quiere generar ganancias para su propio bienestar y así  también ir creciendo como un productor de hortalizas de la zona Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Jonathan, age 28, is single and lives alone. He will use the loan to buy lettuce and coriander seeds to sow in his greenhouse. He also wants to make some improvements so that he has the best growing conditions and can increase his production. He was loaned the land where he has created this greenhouse and he has several years experience of growing vegetables and herbs. He wants to generate income to support himself and to continue expanding as a grower. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans before from any of the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan at good terms and with very low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy seed and make improvements to his greenhouse.

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.fr:
Maman de 55ans ,  mariée , mère de 6 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 23ans et 39ans. Avec son  niveau d'étude  primaire, elle se lance dans la restauration depuis 5ans.
Son restaurant est en plein marché ou elle commence à vendre   dès 7heures pour finir à 16heures.
Sa clientèle est composée des vendeurs du marché et des passants.
Ses recettes journalière sont comprises entre 18000F et 25000f.
Avec le prêt, elle va augmenter son stock de marchandise en réserve, pour cela , elle va acheter:
1 carton de poisson salé, 1 carton de viande de bœuf, 1 filets d'oignon, 10 boîtes de tomate, 1 sac de riz, 2 sachets de sel fin, 5 fagots de bois de chauffe, 1 sac de charbon.
Compte tenu des exigences de ses clients , son ambition est de vendre beaucoup, faire plus de bénéfices et économiser afin d'ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne.
Aider ses petits financièrement en soutenant leurs études.
texts.en:
Maman is 55 years old, married and the mother of six children between the ages of 23 and 39. With only a primary education, she started her restaurant business five years ago.
Her restaurant is in the middle of the market where she starts to sell at seven in the morning until four in the afternoon.

Her clients are sellers at the market and other passersby.

Her daily earnings are between 18,000 and 25,000 cfa francs.

With the loan, she would like to increase her inventory by purchasing:
1 case of salted fish, 1 case of beef, 1 sack of rice, 1 can of oil, 1 bag of onions, 10 boxes of tomatoes, 2 bags of salt, 5 bundles of wood, 1 bag of charcoal.
With her clients in mind, her goal is to increase sales, make larger profits and save money in order to open a more modern restaurant and to help her children financially with their studies.

loans.use: to purchase: 1 case of salted fish, 1 case of beef, 1 sack of rice, 1 can of oil, 1 bag of onions, 10 boxes of tomatoes, 2 bags of salt, 5 bundles of wood, 1 bag of charcoal.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Analiza provides rickshaw (transportation) services. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the business and to use for her personal needs.

Analiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the business and to use for personal needs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Leonora has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 14 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & detergents to resell.

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & detergents

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es natural de Hualahoyo, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al campo, que gracias a las enseñanzas que le dieron sus padres pudo valerse por sí misma en esta actividad. Cuando se casó,  ella y su esposo  forjaron con arduo trabajo su casa, para así proporcionarles bienestar a sus hijos. De esta manera ha logrado consolidar su actual negocio, que es la venta de animales, entre ellos la venta de vaca y toros, que al cabo de un tiempo luego que hayan logrado tener el peso exacto, son vendidos en la feria ganadera o en el camal que es donde recibe buenas ganancias. En adelante desea tener un establo donde pueda albergar más animales y así pueda crecer su capital de trabajo. Es una de las socias más comprometidas, por lo que ha optado solicitar un crédito con MFP, ya lleva dentro de su record 9 oportunidades de las cuales siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. En tanto ha invertido adecuadamente sus anteriores créditos por lo que ha venido creciendo de manera sostenida. Ahora invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: Juana is from Hualahoyo.  She lives with her husband and their four children in their own home.  She has worked in the countryside her whole life and thanks to what her parents taught her she has been able to take care of herself doing this.  When she married, she and her husband built their house with their hard work in order to give their children well-being.  In this way she has been able to form her current business which is the sale of animals, among others, the sale of cows and bulls which at the end of the time needed to reach a certain weight are sold in a livestock market or to a slaughterhouse where they receive good profits.  Looking forward, she would like to have a stable where she could house more animals and thus grow her working capital.  She is one of the most committed members as she has chosen to request a loan with MFP and already has nine opportunities on her record to show her ability to make punctual payments.  As such she has invested her past loans well and has been able to grow her business sustainably.  Now she will invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport expenses. 

Elijah has operated a retail shop for the past six years, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Colibri Group

texts.es:
El grupo Colibri es una UDE (unidad de desarrollo) que esta integrada por 10 personas de nombre y actividad: 
Maria Luisa- Refrescos
Irma- Perfumeria
Maria Adriana- Ropa
Yadira- Lenceria
Susana- Bisuteria
Vianey- Reposteria
Teresita- Papeleria
Maria del Socorro- Estetica y

La señora Nadia que tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta el sexto semestre preparatoria, es casada y es madre de dos hijas de 11 y 9 años de edad que asisten a la primaria. Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de dies años tuvo la inquietud de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de si hogar asi que inicio a vender Topper y home interiors (productos para el hogar), para poder ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gestos del hogar. Ella nos platica que sus productos los vende en la escuela de sus hijos con las mamas de los amiguitos de sus hijos y algunas otras señoras que ella conoce, ella nos dice que sus ventas las realiza por catalogo primero muestra sus catalogos, levanta un pedido y posteriormente cuando sus productos llegan los entrega t recibe el pago por sus productos.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de vasos, platos, catalogos, caserolas, toperes, ollas, cortinas y manteles para continuar con sus ventas. 
Doña Nadia espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y cada dia tener mas clientes para que su negocio cresca y dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
The Colibri group is a Communal Bank that is made up of 10 people whose names and businesses include the following:
Maria Luisa – Beverages
Irma – Perfume
Maria Adriana – Clothing
Yadira – Lingerie
Susana – Trinkets
Vianey – Pastries
Teresita – Stationery
Maria del Rocio – Beauty treatments, and
Señora Nadia who is 33 years old and studied until the sixth semester of high school. She is married and the mother of two daughters, 11 and 9 years old, who are attending elementary school. She tells us that a little over 10 years ago she became anxious to help her husband with household expenses and began to sell Tupperware and home interiors (products for the home) in order to earn a little extra money and help her husband with household expenses. She says she sells her products at her children’s school to the mothers of her daughters’ friends and to some other ladies that she knows.  She adds that she makes her sales by catalog, first showing her catalog, receiving an order and then making a request and later when the products arrive delivering them and receiving payment. 

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of glasses, plates, catalogs, saucepans, Tupperware, pots, curtains and tablecloths in order to continue her sales. Doña Nadie hopes that with this investment her business will prosper so that each day she will have more customers and her business will grow and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to sell Tupperware and other products for the home

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Peggy from Masvingo. She is divorced with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Peggy runs a food business selling poultry. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge faced is insufficient working capital. Peggy has requested a loan of 300 USD to buy more chicks and material for fowl runs. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Peggy plans to supply big institutions.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and material for fowl runs

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 37 years old and married to Augostina. They have three school-going children. 

Boniface has been running a quarry business for five years, making a monthly profit of KES.10,000. He has been loaned KES.30,000 which he plans to use to purchase another quarry site. This is his first loan.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to open a hotel in Kitengela. In the near future he hopes to purchase a lorry to transport the stones to customers.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 40 years old. She is married and has eight children. Rosemarie is the sole breadwinner, and her only income comes from raising pigs and selling them in the future at the local market. Every year, she buys young pigs from the farms near their village. She raises them with the help of her husband and children and then sells the pigs to local butchers. Her monthly profit is about P2,000. She would like to expand her business, as the income from her existing herd isn't enough to provide for her family. She wants to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she hopes that her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to fatten her pig.

loans.name: Ruth Damaris

texts.es:
La señora Ruth tiene 32 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino (vacas) y porcino (cerdos) con la ayuda de su compañero de vida. Tienen más de dos años de realizar esta actividad juntos. La señora Ruth aprendió este trabajo gracias a su mamá, pues ella desempeñaba esta actividad. Por falta de recursos, la señora Ruth tuvo que abandonar sus estudios universitarios en su tercer año de psicología. Debido a esto se dedicó a la crianza de ganado para tener una fuente de ingresos.

Ella compra el ganado en los alrededores de la comunidad donde vive. Cuando una persona le avisa que tiene ganado para la venta, ella va y lo negocia, si le parece lo compra. Una vez comprado, ella tiene que llevarlo a su casa a pie por la calle. Cuando adquiere el ganado en la ciudad ella camina unos cinco kilómetros desde el lugar en donde lo compra hasta su casa.

La señora Ruth solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de ganado de crianza. Si compra  novillas, ella comprará tres; pero si decide comprar vacas lecheras comprará solo una, ya que estas tienen un precio más alto que las novillas. Con el préstamo ella pretende aumentar la producción de leche y de esta manera poderla procesar y así vender productos lácteos. Ella ha visto la oportunidad de tener buenos ingresos, ya que hay personas que buscan los productos lácteos en su casa y ella aún no los tiene disponibles. 

A la señora Ruth tiene planes a futuro, según sea la producción y crianza del ganado, de hacerle mejoras a su vivienda. Ella quiere repellar las paredes, mejorar el corredor y el techo, ya que en invierno tiene varias goteras.
texts.en:
Ruth, 32, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 7 and 2.

She raises cows and pigs with the help of her life partner.  They have been doing this work together for more than two years.  Ruth learned this work thanks to her mother, since she always did this work.  Ruth had to abandon her university studies in her third year of studying psychology because of lack of resources.  Because of this she started raising livestock, to have a source of income.

She buys the livestock on the outskirts of the community where she lives.  When someone tells her they have livestock for sale, she goes and negotiates for it; she buys it if it seems good to her.  Once bought, she has to take it to her house on foot through the street.  When she acquires the animal in the city, she walks some five kilometers from the place she buys it to her house.

Ruth is requesting a loan from the Campo Foundation to buy livestock to raise.  If she buys heifers, she will buy three; but if she decides to buy dairy cows, she will buy only one, since they are more expensive than heifers.  With the loan she is trying to to increase the milk production and in this way be able to process it to sell dairy products.  She has seen the opportunity to have good income, since people are already looking for dairy products at her house and she doesn't have them available yet.

Ruth's plan for the future is to make improvements to her house, depending on the production and raising of her livestock.  She wants to plaster the walls and improve the porch and the roof, since there are various leaks in the winter.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Sreysros (in the photo) is single. She lives with her sister and widowed mother in a village off of National Road number 2, near Phnom Penh City.

Sreysros is a garment worker and she also operates a tailoring business at home when she is free. She is asking for a loan of 1,200USD to build a restroom for her family's use and to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use and to put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a married man with one minor child. He lives in a house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expense is food for his family. For the past four years, Rama has operated a retail shop and his potential clients are his neighbors. His major business challenge is poor sales due to the lack of enough customers. Rama decided to join Yehu because it helps low income earners by giving loans.

Rama is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for his shop. In the future, he dreams of building a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She owns a poultry farm at her home. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed. She generates additional income through brick laying and renting rooms. Her goals and aspirations are to own 2,000 chickens and to own a delivery van to ease on transportation costs. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation of chicken feed. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан жительница района Шахритус. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Два года как занимается торговлей. Гулшан арендует торговую точку на рынке. Она продает детскую и подростковую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки зимней детской одежды.
texts.en: Gulshan lives in the Shahrituz Region. She is 40 years old. She is married. She has three children. She has secondary education. She has been working as a vendor for two years. She leases a sales stand at the market. She sells clothing for children and teens. She is taking out a loan in order to buy winter clothing for children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita believes that "a person who has strong determination will become successful." She is a hard-working mother who is blessed with nine children. 

The main source of their income is through farming. They help each other in managing their farm by planting rice and vegetables for sale. Rosita is also engaged in hog-raising business to earn additional income. They plan to educate all their children so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. 

Despite financial difficulty, they have the strong determination to uplift their status of living. Rosita aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 49 лет. Он женат, у него семеро детей. Его жена работает в школе уборщицей. Сам Хаким занимается выращиванием овощей. В этой области она шестнадцать лет. Целью получения кредита является покупка семян для посева картошки.
texts.en: Hakim lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 49 years old, married and has seven children.  His wife works as a janitor at a school.  Hakim is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for sixteen years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is to purchase seeds for sowing potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old, married and has two children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last six years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode and this is his second loan, which he has planned to use to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the part of the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve, if funded.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47-years-old and is married to Shem. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling tree seedlings for the past six years with a  monthly income of Kes 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Rose will use the loan to buy seedlings for new trees. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to plant tree seedlings in large amounts.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for new trees.

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es: El señor Alex es cliente nuevo es soltero,  vive en la ciudad de La Paz el  trabajaba  en una institución y percibía un sueldo fijo, pero no tenia estabilidad laboral,  decidió emprender un nuevo negocio, se dedica a la venta de ropas  el crédito  lo  invertirá en la  compra de ropa para navidad y poleras  el cliente es trabajador este es su único ingreso que le ayuda para mantenerse, el joven  Alex se siente muy feliz  y agradecido con la institución por  brindarle la oportunidad de seguir adelante con un negocio propio,  el se compromete en  ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Alex is a new client. He is single and lives in the city of La Paz. He used to work in an institution and was receiving a fixed salary but did not have job security, so he decided to start a new business, that of clothing sales. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing for Christmas and t-shirts. The client is hardworking. This is the only income he has to support himself. The young man Alex feels very happy and grateful to the institution for providing him the opportunity to get ahead with his own business. He promises to be a punctual and responsible client.

loans.use: invest in purchasing pants and T-shirts.

loans.name: Hellem Micheal

texts.en:
Hellem Michael is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 9. All of them go to school. 

Hellem runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan from other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase onoins, tomatoes, cabbage, and many other things. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Hellem would like to open many branches of her business and employ others. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Hellem  says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like, onions, beans, and maize.

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, lastimosamente Hilda sufrió la pérdida de su esposo, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; Hilda no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta vivistar a sus hijos y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo, el cual es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Hilda trabaja en su pequeño negocio venta de comida, ella brinda desayunos desde tempranas horas de la mañana, Hilda puede trabajar por un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Hilda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una olla arrocera pequeña, sillas y podrá realizar la refacción de su refrigerador; de esta manera Hilda tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado para poder seguir brindando sus servicios, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 47 year old woman and lives in the city of Ica. Unfortunately Hilda suffered the loss of her husband. Since then she has been devoting all her efforts to get ahead for her family. She is a very nice, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire for improvement. Hilda was not able to study the professional career of nursing that she wanted to, but she would very much have liked to be able to do so. In her spare time she likes to visit her children and on some of these occasions cooks a delicious Arroz con Pollo [chicken with rice], which is her favourite dish.

Of her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, day to day Hilda works in her small business selling food. She offers breakfasts from the early hours of the morning. Hilda can work for approximately 8 hours daily. She feels at home working and believes that she is doing well because of the kind service that she offers her customers.

Hilda is very grateful for the Kiva loans, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to buy a small rice pot and chairs, and will be able to repair her refrigerator. In this manner Hilda will have her business in better condition to be able to continue offering her services, so she will continue working and making efforts to expand her business little by little and thus be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a small rice pot and chairs.

loans.name: Wangnideme Group

texts.fr: WANGNIDEME est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la sixième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Justine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Justine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Justine est mariée à un photographe du nom de Paulin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Justine  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Justine vend de la tomate, du piment et du maïs dans sa région depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Justine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNIDEME, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du piment et de la tomate.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She resides in Koyo, a remote village in the lush hills of Nandihills, in the Rift valley area of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family with two children, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Because of her immense farming knowledge, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and vegetables. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereal; the only challenge she faces is lack of funds. She is requesting a loan to buy cereal. She intends to buy different varieties of cereal to sell in the local market. The market for cereal is never a problem because the demand is high, and she plans to take advantage of that. Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. Rebecca is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. Through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. With this loan, Rebecca’s life will take a positive turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 50 years old and married.

Amy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Amy has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Amy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of clothing

loans.name: Fargana

texts.en:
Fargana was born in 1968 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has 2 children.
She wants to start breeding only Indian hens. This a very kind woman has been in this business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $700 to buy 80 Indian hens.

loans.use: To buy 80 Indian hens

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Vegetable farming is a traditional occupation in southern Moldova, especially in Mariana’s village. Having a fairly large amount of land surrounding her house, this mother of two decided to try growing vegetables in greenhouses. Neither she nor her husband have been able to find steady employment and she has been observing the success of her relatives and neighbors who sell vegetables at the market. She has experience growing and selling produce and wants to now do so more intensively to generate more income for her family. Mariana has many ideas about how to be competitive by growing the right crops in a certain way and she is sure  that she will do well. She is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary materials for construction of a greenhouse so she can grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic covering for her greenhouse and other required materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Both my husband and I work full-time, hard-working jobs in order to support ourselves and our four children.

I stitch outfits for a local boutique. I get $1 USD in profit for every outfit I make. In a given month, I am able to produce only 25 to 30 dresses. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver. The income we earn is just enough to sustain our basic needs.

My husband’s rickshaw is in a very deteriorating condition so we need to replace it with another second-hand rickshaw. Please lend us $325 USD to help us buy another rickshaw.

loans.use: To replace the old rickshaw

loans.name: Carlota Mercedes

texts.es:
Carlota lives in San Martín, Peru. Her business, a general store, is in town and dedicated to selling groceries. Thanks to her husband and her hard work she has been able to set up her store; previously she sold fast food out of a wooden stand in the local plaza. Now she has her own shop and customers.

With the loan Carlota is requesting, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase large quantities of groceries such as milk, rice, sugar and different kinds of noodles.

Carlota is 48 years old, and works hard every day with care to keep moving ahead. She is a member of a local communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carlota pertenece al Banco Comunal El Triunfo, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. San Martín S/N y se dedica a vender abarrotes. Gracias a su esposo y a su trabajo ha logrado incrementar su negocio ya que anteriormente vendía en la plaza de armas de su pueblo en una cajita de madera y lo que vendía eran golosinas, hoy cuentas con su local propio y tiene clientes. Con el crédito recientemente obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00,($333.00) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como leche en cajas , arroz y azúcar en sacos de 50 kg., aceite en docenas, fideos en paquetes de diferentes marcas y para varios usos. La señora Carlota tiene 48 años, trabaja diariamente con mucho cariño y esfuerzo para salir cada día adelante.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of various groceries

loans.name: Adela De Jesus

texts.es:
Adela is a single mother and lives in the Hugo Chávez settlement. Adela is a small business woman and she runs her business out of her house. In the morning she sells fruits and vegetables and at night she sells prepared good. In this way Adela has been able to support her family. She needs money to finish building the front part of her humble abode and thus improve the presentation of her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Adela es madre soltera y habita en el asentamiento Hugo Chávez. Adela es una pequeña comerciante y sus negocios los tiene ubicados en su casa, por las mañanas vende frutas y verduras y por las noches vende comida. Es de esta manera como Adela ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Necesita el dinero para terminar de cosntruir la parte delantera de su humilde vivienda y así mejorar la presentación de sus negocios a sus clientes.

loans.use: To build the front part of her home

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is an enterprising and hard-working mother. Her business selling children's clothing makes her very happy since, thanks to this job, she is able to propel her three adolescent children forward. She brings her wholesale merchandise from the city of Tacna and distributes them to the retailers at the San Jose plaza of Juliaca. She is a single mother and feels happy at seeing how much her children have achieved in their studies. Julia's desire is to acquire a greater volume of products for resale; she is sure that with this showing, her overall economic situation will improve, and in time, her children will even be able to attend the university. To make her dreams a reality, Julia is asking for a monetary loan, that in the hands of this exemplary mother will be very well invested.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Julia es una madre muy emprendedora y trabajadora, su negocio de venta de ropas para niños le viene generando mucha alegría porque gracias a este trabajo va impulsando sola a sus tres hijos adolescentes, ella trae su mercadería al por mayor de la ciudad de Tacna y los distribuye a los comerciantes de la plaza San José de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca.Ella es madre soltera que y se siente feliz de ver como sus hijos han logrado mucho con sus estudios, el deseo de Julia es adquirir mayor volumen de productos para comercializarlos, confiá que con esta proyección su situación económica irá mejorando y así sus hijos dentro de poco tiempo podrán ir a la universidad.Para hacer realidad sus deseos Julia solicita un préstamo de dinero que en las manos de esta ejemplar madre será muy bien invertido.

loans.use: Acquire a greater amount of garments for resale.

loans.name: Ghulzar

texts.en:
Ms. Ghulzar is a low-income woman. She is 42, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region.

Ghulzar has a scanty herd of milk cows and sells 60 liters of milk per day to the local milk processing shop and to the supermarket. The trade is good and Makhbuba sees that she could sell more milk. This requires more cattle in her herd.

Ghulzar decided to buy a calf to breed and hence to increase her monthly turnover. She has applied for a $600 loan to the Normicro Saatli branch to buy a calf and increase the number of cattle in her herd.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Tida

texts.fr:
Tida Sané is married and is the bank treasurer of the Santack village in the Ziguinchor area where she has been living for the past 6 and a half years. She has always reimbursed her loans without difficulty. She buys and sells dead wood, and fruit such as mangos. Tida would like to build her business in order to provide for her needs. She is therefore asking for a 14th loan that she plans to reimburse in 6 months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Tida Sané, mariée est trésorière du banc villageois de Santack à Ziguinchor ou elle est membre depuis 6 ans et demie. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficulté.Elle achète et revend du bois mort, et des fruits ( mangues et mades ).Tida souhaite renforcer ses activités pour parvenir à subvenir à ses besoins . Elle sollicite ce 14ème prêt qu'elle compte rembourser au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and fruits

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and is married with 1 child, age 9 months. Maria is a tailor, and she is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items and cloth items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and cloth items for her business

loans.name: Arik

texts.id:
Arik S. currently lives in Wibisana street Denpasar by renting land then building a semi permanent house on it. The business he is in is meatballs sales. The location is not too far from where he lives. Usually he sells between 11:00AM to 7:00PM. Suyono is already in this business for years, and income is sufficient to support the family with child and wife. This time Suyono's request for loan would be used for capital increase, so that his business could expand.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Arik S. saat ini tinggal di Jl.Wibisana Denpasar dengan mengontrak tanah lalu kemudian membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Usaha sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual bakso. Tempat berjualannya tidak begitu jauh dari tempat tinggalnya. Biasanya dia berjualan dari jam 11 siang sampai dengan jam 7 malam. Suyono sudah menjalankan usaha ini selama bertahun-tahun dan penghasilan yang didapat cukup untuk kebutuhan keluarga bersama anak dan istrinya. Saat ini Suyono bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman yang dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha, sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys B. sells clothing and shoes. She is single, and her income is not sufficient for her and her child. Demand for her goods is high, so she is requesting a loan of $475 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna D. has been a member of the Sokhayi village bank for 6 years. She would like a loan to strengthen her business which consists of buying and selling seasonal fruits which she then uses to produce juices and jams to be resold. This loan will be repaid in one single installment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Anna D. est membre du Banc villageois de Sokhayi depuis 06ans. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce qui consiste à acheter des fruits saisonnier qu’elle va ensuite transformer en jus ou confiture pour la revendre. Ce prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois .

loans.use: Processing of fruits into juices and jams for resale

loans.name: Rose's Alfa Group

texts.en:
Rose is 21 years old. She is a married with two children, ages two months and three years old. She sells vegetables. She works at her business everyday from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Rose now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes, finger millet, maize, and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sohib

texts.ru: Каракулов Сохиб житель района Хуросон.Возраст 63 года.,женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается посевом бахчевых культур.Каждый год на своем земельном участке он выращивает  арбузы и дыни. В этом году клиент получил хороший урожай.Поэтому он хочет взять в аренду грузовую машину и привезти свой урожай в город.Планирует  получить кредит и погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.Если он вовремя сможет реализовать урожай , то он сможет  успеть засеить пшеницу.
texts.en:
Sohib K. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 63 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education and grows melons for a living. Every year he grows watermelons and cantaloupes on his plot of land. This year’s harvest was especially good. This is why Sohib wants to rent a truck and bring his harvest to the city. He plans to obtain a loan and repay it within 12 months. If he sells his harvest in a timely manner, then he will be able to sow wheat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a truck

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban es un buen padre de familia, trabajador y empeñoso en sus labores como agricultor y en la crianza de sus animales, gracias a su hija los puede mantener alimentados  y cuidados, para después ser vendidos en las ferias de los pueblos, como también en los mercados de las ciudades cercanas, donde invierte más por los gastos del viaje, pero también sus ganancias son mayores por el alto costo de venta que consigue fuera.  Por eso Esteban y su hija se ocupan de alimentarlos adecuadamente para obtener mayores ganancias, sin embargo, ahora desea aumentar la cantidad de sus cuyes, y también comprar cerdos y gallinas, así en el futuro dedicarse sólo a la ganadería, que es una actividad más rentable que la agricultura.  Para comprar un cerdo y algunos cuyes, necesita la cantidad que solicita como préstamo, con la promesa de ser responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Esteban is a good father, hard-working, and steadfast in his endeavors as a farmer and in the raising of animals. Thanks to his daughter’s assistance, he is able to care and feed the animals for sale later at both fairs and marketplaces in nearby towns. Traveling to nearby towns increases his costs, but that is offset by the higher asking price he gets there. For this reason Esteban and his daughter take care to feed them properly in order to bring in more profit. Nevertheless, they would now like to increase the number of guinea pigs, as well as buy pigs and chickens, so in the future they might go into animal husbandry full-time, as it is a more profitable business that agriculture. In order to buy a pig and some guinea pigs, he needs a loan in the amount he has requested, and promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying it.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pig and more guinea pigs to increase the number of animals he raises for sale

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun S., 53, and her husband, Mr. Doeun Em, 58, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1973, they have four sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Out of the remaining children: two daughters are silk weaver; one son is a construction worker; and another three children are studying in a local school.

As a silk weaver, she has passed on her weaving business to her daughters. As a farmer, she currently raises pigs and grows rice and other crops on her farmland.  Her husband also works on the farm raising cows, as well as being carpenter.  

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her daughters' business and buy pigs for her farming business.

Mrs. Khoen is pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and pigs

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. Desaguadero S/N. Tiene 45 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos que dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  compro mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes  que funciona  frente a la Plaza de Armas de Juli. Tiene casi 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

Leonor con el fin de tener más ganancias también hace bordados en bayeta y continúa vendiendo en su pequeña tienda.

Con este préstamo de S/: 400.00 nuevos soles que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara gaseosas, galletas, pollo, etc.

Su sueño es irse de Juli y comprarse su casa en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor is a member of "Banco Comunal "Inmaculada Concepción" of the district of Juli, Province of Chucuito-Puno, She lives in Jr. Desaguadero S/N. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children that depend on her. With the first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles she bought merchandise for her grocery store which is located in front of Plaza de Armas in Juli, She has been working with the bank for 1 year.

In order to obtain more income Leonor also embroiders on cloth and continues selling at her small store. With this loan of S/.400.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy soft drinks, cookies, chicken etc. It is her dream to leave Juli and buy her house somewhere else.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.name: Maura Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Maura Rosa C. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maura tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 23 años es licenciado en ciencias actuariales, su hija de 22 años cursa el 4 año de la carrera de licenciatura en ciencias sociales y su otro hijo de 15 años y cursa el 5 año de secundaria, su esposo labora como chofer, los deseos de Doña Maura para con su negocio es incrementar mas el monto de su financiamiento para obtener mas capital de trabajo y llevar a cabo sus propósitos, en sus sueños esta que la institución crezca lo suficiente para llegar a superar la pobreza que tenemos en el país.


 
La actividad económica a la que se dedica es venta de cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, ella inicia este negocio con una pulpería y la mantuvo activa alrededor de 2 años, pero debido a que Doña Maura posee su trabajo de enfermera en el hospital por lo que la pulpería era su otra fuente de ingresos pero esta no la pudo mantener activo debido a que llegaba muy cansada de su trabajo y decide por cuenta propia realizar la venta de cosméticos y es así como con este negocio se forma su medio de trabajo por lo que este le ayuda con los compromisos contraídos para salir adelante, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos en las diferentes casas comerciales ya que en estos días festivos ha recibido mucho pedidos y quiere satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maura Rosa C. is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Her oldest son is 23 and has a degree in actuarial science, her daughter is 22 and is in her fourth year of studying social sciences at the university, and her other son is 15 and is in his 5th year of high school. Her husband is a chauffeur. Maura hopes to get increased financing for her business so that she has more working capital to carry out her plans. She dreams of the institution growing large enough to overcome the country's poverty. She sells cosmetics as a street vendor, a business she has had for 2 years. She started it as a neighborhood store and kept that for about 2 years. But because Maura is a hospital nurse and the store was her second source of income, she could not maintain it because she was tired after work. She decided to sell cosmetics, and with this business she finds the means to meet her obligations. This loan is for working capital so she can buy products from various merchants. She has received many orders during this Christmas season and wants to satisfy her customers' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
A. Nabi is 40 years old, married and the loving father of five children. For eight years, Nabi has been raising cattle and growing crops on his land with his wife, who we see here. He is now planning to sow wheat on his two-hectare plot. He wants to borrow money to buy fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to increase his yield. He also wants to use part of the loan to buy more cattle. To make all of this possible, Nabi is asking for a loan of $725 for eight months. You could become an important part of the Nabi family's life, and he deeply appreciates the trust and support Kiva lenders are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies and purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Gbemileke

texts.en: Gbemileke O. is a 35-year-old married man with 2 children.  Gbemileke owns and operates a shop where he sells spare motor parts.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more motor parts for resale purposes.  He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional spare motor parts

loans.name: Mónica Silvestre

texts.pt:
Mónica Silvestre J. é natural da província da Zambézia uma das centrais do pais, tem 30 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de um filho de 7 anos de idade, apenas sustenta este filho.

Mónica estudou ate 10ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, Mónica mudou se de cidade quando foi contratada pela educação depois de se formar como professora do ensino básico onde teve afectação na província do Maputo.

Mónica trabalha como professora com um horário das 7h as 12h, tem um rendimento mensal de 2900,00mt, vive numa casa própria. Para Mónica este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. assim constitui maior sonho para Mónica a conclusão das obras de forma a ver a sua família em melhor condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Monica Silvestre J. was born in the central province of Zambezia. She is 30 years old, single, and the mother of a seven-year-old child. She only supports this child. Monica went to school until the 10th grade, and then stopped due to lack of finances. Monica left her city after she graduated as an elementary school teacher and was contracted to work in Maputo. Monica works as a teacher from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. Her monthly income is 2900.00 MT, and she lives in her own house. This is Monica’s second loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. Her greatest dream is to finish the construction of her house so that her family can have better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn D. has been educated through primary school, is married with 1 child, and has been selling fish since 1999.  She goes to the seashore to purchase fresh fish; she then processes the fish by smoking it or preparing it in other ways for selling purposes in Boatase, Elmina.  Her husband is employed as a taxi driver.  The loan will be used with the purpose of expanding her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build the family a home.

loans.use: expanding her business

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам кредитор в Микроинвест четвёртый год.Он продаёт женскую европейскую одежду.За товаром ездит сам, в Бишкек и Турцию.Его точка реализации расположена в центре Худжанда.Он благодаря кредитам увеличил оборотный капитал и улучшил жизнь своей семьи.Жена также торгует на рынке материалами.Семья Рустама твёрдо встала на ноги и ведут хороший образ жизни.Рустам благодарен KIVA за беспрерывное финансирование и понимание.Следующий займ он хочет использовать для пополнения товаров.
texts.en:
Rustam has been a client of MicroInvest for four years. He sells women's European clothing, and travels either to Bishkek or Turkey to purchase his wares. His sales outlet is located downtown Khujand. Thanks to financing, he has increased his working capital and improved his family's way of life. His wife also sells fabric at the market. Rustam's family is standing firmly on its feet and they have a good way of life. Rustam is grateful to Kiva for the uninterrupted funding and understanding. He wants to use the next loan to replenish his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Atiya is a 37 year-old lady and a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Atiya is an uneducated lady because she didn’t show interest in education. She is married to A. who runs a grocery shop in the community. He has three years of experience in this business. Atiya is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
