Asia wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a dryer machine for her beauty salon. Bilquis wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Shamim wants a loan to buy beams for her shutter business.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee all loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy groceries.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Хасанова Гулнора- женщина , которая  занимается продажей моркови и картофеля.Она хочет получив кредит закупить крупную партию моркови по оптовой цене и продать в розницу. Гулнора  смогла ценаправлено и удачно использовать кредиты и расширить бизнес. Гулнора благодарна Фонду, за предоставившую возможность в кредит, расширить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Gulnora H. is a woman who sells carrots and potatoes. She wants to take out a loan to make the wholesale purchase of a large lot of carrots to then sell retail. Gulnora has been able to successfully use financing to expand her business. Gulnora is grateful to MicroInvest for the presenting the opportunity for financing to increase her turnover.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetable sales

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Otilia es casada tiene  44 años, tres hijos de 29, que esta trabajando y los de  15 y 6 años que están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Otilia siempre se dedico a su casa, pero por la salud de su hijo que sufría de los bronquios le empezó a dar medicinas  naturales   y como eran caras , ella decidió empezar a vender hace cuatro años.
Desde que Otilia esta en Finca, le gusta como ayudan a que las mujeres salgan adelanté con un negoció y son ayudan para su familia. 
Otilia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de productos medicinales naturales, por que la venta es al contado.
 El sueño de Otilia es crecer en el negocio y salir a vender a provincias.
texts.en:
Otilia is a member of the Communal Bank San Judas Tadeo. Otilia is married, 44 years old, and 3 children, one who is 29 and working and two who are 15 and 6 years old who are studying in the state school. Otilia always dedicated herself to her home, but due to her son’s health who suffered from bronchial problems she began to give him natural medicines, and because these medicines were expensive she decided to start selling them four years ago. Since Otilia has been with Finca she has enjoyed how the organization helps women get ahead with a business and provide help to their families. Otilia needs a loan of 1,400 PEN to purchase natural medicine products to sell for cash. Otilia’s dreams are to expand her business and to travel to sell to other provinces.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase natural medicine products to sell for cash.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj is 64 years old and retired. He lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a senior in a local high school. Since his retirement income is not enough to support his family, he has started his own small business in food retail. Davaadorj visits small country towns around the province and sells food products, including soft drinks, tobacco, baked goods and so on. When he returns to his city, he transports passengers in his van.

Davaadorj has been in this business for the last five years and acquired many customers in the countryside. He works hard to earn enough money to save up for his daughter's university tuition as she starts university next year. He is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Mensi

texts.es:
La señora Mensi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Puerta”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Mensi, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados en su negocio de Servicio Electrónico. Hoy en día administra su negocio y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Lleva 23 años dedicándose a su negocio, por lo que ahora esta muy contenta y orgullosa de haber logrado convertirse en una gran empresaria. Nos cuenta que tiene mucha acogida y clientes fijos, que a diario se presentan a su local.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos de televisores, radios, computadoras como: fly back, yugos, reguladores de voltaje, lectores ópticos e integrados.

Mensi, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños y metas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo laboral.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mensi belongs to the "Virgen de la Puerta" Community Bank, in the district of Bella Vista, province of Bella Vista in the department of San Martin. She is married, 42 years old and a mother of two children, one of them still depends on her for his financial needs. Mensi is a woman who was able to overcome many difficulties along the course of her life. Her desire to move forward has provided her with good results at her business, a maintenance shop for electronics. Currently she runs her business and feels very happy . She has been working in this business for 23 years, so now she is very happy and proud for having become a great businesswoman. She tells us that, as she is very friendly, she has many loyal customers that visit her shop daily. With this loan in the amount of 2,000.00, she will buy spare parts for televisions, radios and computers such as, fly backs, yokes, voltage regulators, and integrated optical readers. Mensi, at her age, is an example to follow for many women who start a business and with perseverance achieve their dreams and goals. She thanks the Manuela Ramos group for helping her get started in the workplace.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for televisions, radios and computers

loans.name: Victoria Bulasa's Group

texts.en:
V. is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 48-year-old married woman with five children in ages ranging from 20 to 28 years. Three of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four-room house where she is staying with ten people. V. takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  

V. stays in Nsooba running a pub, selling only sodas and other cold drinks, excluding beer, in one of the Kampala suburbs. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation cost as she buys from her region. V. sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and daily market dues and rent. She has been in this business for the last ten years. V. has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her fourteenth loan, working all this long with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of sodas. V. is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premise and home 

.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 30-year-old mother of one who sells fabrics and shoes and owns rental houses in Nairobi. Monica has been in these businesses for the past three years. Previously, she sold secondhand clothes.

Monica is requesting her first loan of Ksh 50,000 in order to increase her stock of shoes and fabrics. She hopes to one day own a wholesale shop. In the future, Monica would like to educate her son and build a good home.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes and fabrics

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una madre D. familia D. 64 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo, el último D. sus 13 hijos y dos D. sus nietos en el distrito pesquero D. Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Lleva aproximadamente 30 años vendiendo pescado seco – salado en el Mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo), cada lunes y jueves se levanta temprano para ir al terminal pesquero D. su ciudad a comprar caballa fresca (una variedad D. pescado muy consumido en la región) para procesarla y ofrecerla a sus clientes.

Su esposo se dedicaba anteriormente a la pesca artesanal, pero ahora, debido a su avanzada edad, ya no pueD. trabajar, por este motivo está solicitando a nuestra Institución un préstamo D. 2500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra D. más pescado para mantener su negocio y D. esa manera seguir apoyando a la economía del hogar.

Uno D. sus más grandes sueños es hacer mejoras en la infraestructura D. su casa, ya que el paso del tiempo y la cercanía al mar han deteriorado algunas paredes D. su hogar.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros en cinco oportunidades y en todas ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por este motivo es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 64 year old mother who lives together with her husband, the youngest of her thirteen children, and two of her grandchildren in the fishing district of Santa Rosa, located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Andrea has been selling dried, salted fish in the Moshoqueque Market (the principal market of Chiclayo), for about 30 years. Every Monday and Thursday she rises early in the morning to go to the fishing terminal to buy fresh mackerel (a popular variety of fish in the region), which she later processes and sells to her clients.

Her husband previously worked as a traditional fisherman, but now, due to his age, he can no longer work. For this reason she has asked our institution for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of more fish in order to keep her business going and in this way continue to proviD. for household costs.

One of Andrea's biggest dreams is to improve the condition of her home, as time and the proximity of the sea have caused damaged to some of the walls.

She has worked with us on five occasions and each time showed responsibility and punctuality in turning in the payments, making her an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish to process and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Samoeun C. is a villager in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Saem Voeun, is a salt middleman. In this business, he needs a motorbike to transport the salts. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Samoeun C. decided to ask for a loan to support this purpose. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others two are enrolled in the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the salts.

loans.name: Marta Jeannette

texts.es: Marta Jeannette S. reside en el pueblo que la vio nacer Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Marta tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 3 años.  A pesar de ser tan joven Marta es una persona con el sentido de la responsabilidad muy marcado, ella da todo por su familia que son el motivo del día a día en su trabajo, Marta muy valiente se atrevió a instalar un negocio una venta de ropa, hace tres años el cual ha recibido una gran demanda en la zona, razón por la cual Marta solicita de un crédito para surtir su negocio y así provechar al máximo de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta Jeannette S. lives in the town of Armenia in the department of Sonsonate. She is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 3. Despite being so young, Marta has an innate sense of responsibility. She puts everything into her work so that she can provide for her family. Marta took a bold step in starting her business and it has now been in operation for three years. There is great demand in the area for her merchandise, so she is taking advantage of this opportunity by requesting a loan to restock her business and maximize her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som N. makes a living selling chicken and pork porridge to her new and longstanding customers. She earns approximately $2 US per day. She is 51 years old and married with five children. They live in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Her daughter operates a business designing and sewing clothes, earning $2 US per day to help cover the family's expenses.

Mrs. N. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike to more easily commute to the market to buy goods. The motorbike will also help one of her family members to travel to work more easily and cut back on using public transportation services. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. The photo shows N. with her son.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Catherine Namisango ‘S Group

texts.en: Catherine is a 45 years old, married, with eight children between the ages of 3 and 25. Six of her children still attend to school. She owns a one room house where she lives with four other people. Catherine also takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs expenses traveling to and from villages in the Luwero District, one of the central districts of Uganda, to buy charcoal,. She works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.She uses public transport to and from Luwero. Catherine works seven days a week.  She receives an average of 25 customers a day and sells to people at both retail and wholesale. Her major challenges include the ever increasing prices of charcoal, the rainy season which hinders her customers' ability to reach her, and ever increasing  transport costs. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding her family and medication.  She has been in this business for ten years and joined MCDT ten years ago. This will be her twentieth loan. Catherine joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of second hand clothes . She wants to see her business grow bigger and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 56 years old and happily married with 2 children. She is a hardworking woman. She is a LAPO client. She sells foodstuffs at the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.  Elizabeth is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She is 45 years-old and married with five children. Her husband is also a business man. She is an honest and faithful Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. Kiva partner LAPO is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Walter Teodosio

texts.es:
Walter es socio del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Walter es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Walter se dedica a la crianza de cuy en Carmen Alto en casa de su familia, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 personal, sus ventas los realiza en los recreos. Walter tiene proyectado aperturar un recreo en su casa.
Walter necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en los acabados del recreo.
Los sueños de Walter son aperturar su recreo e implementar un hostal.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita II. He lives with his partner partner, is 48 years old and has 2 children. Walter breeds cuy (guinea pig) in Carmen Alto in his family's house, an activity which he does with the help of 1 person. He sells in the markets, and has plans to open a market in his house. Walter needs a loan of 1200 soles, money which will be invested in the finishing touches of his market. Walter's dreams are to open his market and set up a guest house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing touches for a market

loans.name: Stalin Olmedo

texts.es:
Stalin Vázquez de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, cuanta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar con ella tiene 2 hijos, estudiantes de colegios fiscal.

Stalin aprendió ya hace muchos años atrás a ser mecánico trabajando con su papa en el taller que el tenia, poco a poco pudo reunir dinero para independizarse.

Stalin ahora trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00 reparando y dando mantenimientos a los vehículos, un aproximado de la reparación casi total de una vehiculo es de $ 900.00, uno de los inconvenientes que ahora tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para poder construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere hacer adecuaciones en su casa para poder trasladar el taller de reparación.
texts.en:
Stalin Vásques is 41. He lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. The area has all of the basic services. His wife does the household chores, and they have two children. The children go to public schools. Many years ago Stalin learned how to be a mechanic by working with his father in the shop he had. Little by little he was able to get together enough money to become independent. Stalin now works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. repairing and performing maintenance on vehicles. An almost complete repair of a vehicle costs approximately $900.00. One of the inconveniences he now has is the rains. With the loan he wants to buy cement, rocks, and sand to be able to build his house better. In the future he wants to make adaptations to his house to be able to move his repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, rocks, and sand

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 59 years old. Teresita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $44 whenever she sells her animals.

In 2005, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Munirjon

texts.en: Munirjon M. is married with three children. Munirjon is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about 13 years. During that time he has become very popular at the market and has many clients. The secret of his success is simple: He tries to not only let his customers know the benefits of his products – he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is at with his venture. Munirjon is seeking a loan of $3,000 to re-stock the merchandise in his store. We believe that Munirjon's desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for selling

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness L., a married businesswoman, sells traditional clothes ( Khanga and Vitenge) at Kigilagila ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her  goods wholesale from Mnazi mmoja traditional clothes city market shopping center  and then retails them to her customers. Traditional clothes are regularly used by Tanzanian women in both rural and urban areas, so Agness' business income helps her to meet her family's daily needs and capitalize the business. Agness is now requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods.

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en: Manolo M. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 48 years old. Manolo is separated from his spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Manolo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Manolo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Manolo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Manolo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Manolo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Romulada Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery tiene 45 años lastimosamente se quedo viuda muy joven a los 30 años y con tres hijos pequeños, tuvo que ser muy fuerte y  trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos , su esposo murió en un accidente D. trabajo y desD. entonces vive sola con sus tres hijos D. (21,19,16) años D. los cuales el mayor ha logrado estudiar una carrera profesional (contaduría pública) , el siguiente ha empezado a estudiar ( odontología) y el ultimo esta en el colegio , por lo tanto la  señora Rosmery tiene que trabajar mucho mas hasta que los dos hijos terminen D. estudiar.

Esta familia vive en la ciudad D. Cochabamba en la localidad D. la Maica Central, su principal actividad es la producción D. la leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración D. productos lácteos, actualmente cuenta con 10 cabezas D. ganado lechero.

El préstamo es destinado para la compra D. forraje, lo cual es importante para la buena alimentación del ganado y D. esta manera siga con la misma cantidad D. producción D. leche.

Entre sus metas lo más importante para ella es que los 2 hijos terminen D. estudiar una carrera profesional y aumentar la producción D. la leche para D. esta manera también ahorrar para su vejes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosmery is 45 years old. Unfortunately she became a widow when she was only 30 years old with three young children. She had to be strong and work hard to bring up her children properly. Her husband died in a work accident and since then she has been living alone with her three sons (21, 19, 16). The oldest has finished professional studies as a public accountant, one has started studying odontology and the youngest is in school. Therefore Mrs. Rosmery has to work hard until her two sons finish their studies.

The family lives in the town of Cochabamba in the neighborhood of Maica Central. For a living she produces fresh milk for a dairy product factory. At the moment she has 10 milking cows.

The loan will be spent on buying forage, which is important for the good diet for the cattle to continue with the production of the same quantity of milk.

The most important of her goals is that her 2 sons finish their professional studies and increase the milk production in order to save money for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase forage for milking cows.

loans.name: Sayllap Group

texts.en:
Abdul Aziz has a small shop selling mobile cards. He is married with four children and he is responsible for paying their school fees and expenses. Every morning he wakes up early and goes out to his shop to start his work. He has been involved in this business for three years and wants to expand it. He needs this loan to purchase more mobile cards. He is a very hardworking man and he is confident that he will progress soon.

Abdul Aziz is the leader of Sayllap Group. He lives in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He reA. admires this loan process.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline es una joven de 29 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos con estudio en primaria, su esposo trabaja en un zoológico, y junto han logrado la construcción de su casa, aunque falta por hacerle mucho, lo importante es que han logrado el objetivo de un techo para sus hijos, Jacqueline se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosmético y los que los cliente le encarguen, lleva cinco años en las ventas el cual comenzó con ahorros y dinero que su esposo daba, pues esta difícil la citación económica por eso trabajo para poder cubrir los gastos y para hacer las mejora a la casa, con este financiamiento pondrá piso a su casa ya que aun es de suelo y repellara las paredes para una mejor higiene y una  mejor estructuración de la casa. Su meta es lograr aumentar el inventario de su negocio en la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29, married, and has two children who attend elementary school. Her husband works at a zoo. Together they have built their house, even though there is a lot left to do. The important thing is that they have achieved their objective of a roof over their children’s heads. Jacqueline sells clothes, cosmetics, and other things that customers order from her. She has been in sales for five years. She started with savings and money that her husband gave her. The economic situation is difficult, so she works to be able to cover the expenses and to make improvements on the house. With this loan she will put down a floor in her house because it is still a dirt floor. She will plaster the walls for better hygiene and to improve the structure of the house. Her goal is to increase the inventory in her business of selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, and bricks to put down a floor and plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Mout

texts.en:
Mr. M., 53, resides in Kompong Tom Province and earns a low income. He is a good and determined father who has tried to feed his seven children since they were young. Two of them are now married; the remaining five are single. His wife is a rice cultivator. To pursue a daily income, M. works as a day laborer who is also hired by people to do anything for a fee. 

M. says that the current income is not enough to support them, so he decided to request a loan of $600 to purchase a horse with a cart attached for the propose of starting a taxi service. By doing this, he hopes he will have ability to generate more income to help meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart for use as a taxi

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Sot O., 47, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. O. sells ice-creams for an income of USD 5 per day. His wife grows garlic to sell, earning an income of about USD 2.30 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

O. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike to transport ice creams to sell. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike to transport his ice-cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help fund his eggplant and tomato crops

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa Y. sells smoked fish and tomatoes at Elmina. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally made oven with firewood to smoke her fish.  Adowa has no educational background.  She is divorced and has seven dependants. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and tomatoes for resale. She hopes to reinvest back into her business should there be any form of increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
N. Margret is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children Margret has had a business selling food like matooke and sweet potatoes for two years.  

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits, sometimes to buy food and to take care of herself.  In the future, Margret hopes to own a house.    

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva, which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more food like matooke

loans.name: Geltrodis

texts.en:
Geltrodis A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also manages a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. Her husband is a seaweed farmer and she sometimes helps selling seaweed in the market. Geltrodis works hard to provide for her family and improve their living conditions.

Geltrodis joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita D. R., 37, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She has three children, all of whom are enrolled this school year. By the grace of God, Nenita has managed to pay for her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send them all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Nenita as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Nenita basically buys general merchandise from wholesalers, then sells it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of that sort. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Nenita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: To make a living, Liezel B. sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables to community members. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Palabotan Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. Liezel has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Liezel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Liezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to invest in expanding the business. Liezel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Palabotan Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel C. is from Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 60 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. Isabel owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2006, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Mascot Group

texts.en:
Aminata M. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Kano, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, about 35 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children. Two of the children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

For four years now, Aminata has been selling toothpaste, toothbrushes, biscuits, cigarettes, etc. This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Yo buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, biscuits, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: John Deere

texts.en:
John Deere M. is a married man who lives in Brgy, Orong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating three business ventures: motorcycle operator, buy and sell of livestock and charcoal. His wife, Helen M., who is 40 years old, works as a housewife and helps her husband in the business activities.  They have two children who are 13 and 20 years old. John Deere joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, John Deere has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for his fourth loan, he is borrowing PHP 29,500, which he intends to use to fund his business operations so that he could continue to save up for the future of his family and the business. John Deere M. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of his dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund his business operations

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of four children from Lebanon. For the past few years, he has made his living as a professional driver. He operates a van service for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. His main route is between his town and its surroundings. He has obtained a first Kiva loan and he is thankful for it. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to perform maintenance work on his van in addition to changing its tires. These improvements will enable him to provide his service to more passengers.  In the future, he is planning to purchase a second van to increase his business level and therefore his family's income.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his van in addition to changing its tires

loans.name: Martha Eloisa

texts.es:
Martha Eloisa H. L. tiene 42 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Martha Eloisa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es esforzarse más..

Le gusta la costura y tener amigos..
texts.en:
Martha Eloisa H. L. is 42 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 2 children.

The 'Vall Paraíso' solidarity group is located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group works on short-cycle agricultural tasks such as growing cacao.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Martha Eloisa has been growing cacao for 2 years.  She buys her products in Matilde Esther and sells them in Chillanes market and in the district.

She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her cacao crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to work even harder.

She likes to sew and have friends.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her cacao crops

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard T. is 58 years old and is married with 8 children. He has a beer depot in Kawaruju trading center and his customers are mostly bars and retail shops. He is able to make 40,000 in weekly profits in addition to the income he obtains from agriculture and rentals. This is a self initiated business and he needs a loan to be able to buy more beer for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beer for resale.

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en: Khadijeh is 41 years old and married.  She has owned a clothing shop since 2009 and has 12 years of  experience. She is requesting her second loan from Al Majmoua in order to add men's clothing to her business.  Khadijeh is a brave woman who has worked hard to reach her levE. in the market. Khadijeh’s clients come from nearby villages as well as her relatives and friends. Her experience with Al Majmoua helped her expand her business and taught her how to manage her business. Khadijeh is hoping to open another branch in the future with a third loan.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothes

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Abejitas” se conforma por 19 emprendedores y  ubica en la comuna de San Bernardo. Sus negocios se basan principalmente en ventas de ropa, juguetes, comida rápida y helados.
María, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra en 2º fila, sentada en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha y sostiene un bastón en su mano, ya que padece de hemiplejia en la mitad de su cuerpo, lado izquierdo, hace muchos años. Ella vende ropa usada, ropa nueva, artículos de paquetería y toallas de mano, hace 7 años. 
Su lugar de venta es una feria cercana a su casa,  en donde trabaja 4 días a la semana, incluyendo los fines de semana. Ella traslada su mercadería sola en un carro. También vende en su casa los demás días.
Con este préstamo comprará perfumes, blusas de lycra, piscinas y flotadores inflables para niños.
Además de los ingresos por sus ventas, María cuenta con una pequeña pensión de dinero y con el pago por arriendo de 2 piezas, las cuales están en la parte de atrás de su casa.
Su sueño es tener un bazar y  paquetería en su casa.
María está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, por la ayuda que le han dado a través de los préstamos, ya que siente que tiene oportunidades para surgir y por la confianza que le han demostrado con esto.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
Las Abejitas (The Little Bees) communal bank is made up of 19 entrepreneurs. It is located in the town of San Bernardo. Members’ businesses are based mostly in clothing, toy, fast food and ice cream sales. 
María is the president of this group. She is in the 2nd row in the picture, seated in the 1st spot from left to right. She has a cane in her hand because she has suffered for many years from hemiplegia in the left half of her body. She has sold second-hand and new clothing, stationary and sewing supplies and hand towels for the past 7 years.
She sells her items at a market close to her house. She works there four days a week, including weekends. She moves her merchandise alone in a car. The rest of the week she also sells from home. With this loan she will buy perfumes, lycra blouses and children’s pools and floats.
In addition to the income from her sales, María receives a small pension and payment for renting 2 rooms in the back of her house. 
Her dream is to have a stationary and embroidery shop in her home.
María is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza for the help they have given her through these loans. She feels that she has opportunities to rise up. She thanks them for the faith they have shown in her through this. 
San Bernardo is a city located 18 km. south of the main square of Santiago (the capital of Chile) using a straight line. It is know as the capital of folklore culture; every year in January they have the “International Folklore Festival”. This is an event where the country’s roots come together. Musical groups from all over South America meet. There is also a “Traditional Crafts Fair”. Artisans from Chile and other nearby countries participate. Later, in April, the “One Thousand April Cuecas” event takes place. The whole town is made to dance cueca (a traditional Chilean dance) during the event.

loans.use: Perfumes, clothing and children's pools and floats

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulita; ella tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de sombreros, pulseras trenzados todo esto hecho a base de cuero ,la misma socia realiza estos trabajos ,ella trabaja desde su casa para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria y a pedido ,la socia se siente feliz ya que este trabajo le trae muchas satisfacciones especialmente económicas, a la vez la socia vende pasto por las noches en su casa (alimento para cuyes, conejos) siendo estas dos actividades que realiza para sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulita is a member of the "PACHAPACCARI" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Paulita is 41 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling leather hats, leather bracelets and leather braids.  She makes her products at home and then distributes them to her customers who request them.  She makes some of her sales as an itinerant street vendor and she also fills orders.  She is happy since this work gives her a lot of satisfaction, especially financially.  In the evenings, Paulita also sells animal feed from her home (guinea pig and rabbit food).  She carries out both these business activities to get her family ahead in life.

Paulita is requesting this loan to buy materials for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Tilebaldy

texts.en:
Tilebaldy B. is 63 years old, married, and has six grown children.  Tilebaldy and his wife are pensioners. To earn additional income, they are engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating. With initial capital of 8,000 KGS, they managed to develop a farm with three cows, ten sheep, twenty goats and three horses. In 2008, Tilebaldy took his first loan from Bai Tusum and Partners and repaid it without any delays. Now Tilebaldy has applied for 30,000 KGS for purchasing ten sheep. With the additional revenue, he plans to help his son in business. 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela A. is from the Malaubang district (barangay) of Ozamiz City. She is 61 years old. Pamela is widowed and has two grown up children. To make a living Pamela owns and operates a business in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling banana cue (a caramelized banana dessert). Pamela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Pamela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pamela is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pamela from GDMPC. Pamela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Patrocinia G. es la presidenta de Comité, se dedica al comercio minorista. Desea invertir su dinero en compra de ropas, zapatillas, sábanas, almohadas, etc. para aumentar sus variedades de productos y obtener más ganancias, ella está muy feliz con el crédito obtenido, porque gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya ha mejorado considerablemente su ingreso.
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, coordinaron una reunión un grupo de señoras para comunicar sobre el programa Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras, les parecieron muy interesantes los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre San Cayetano debido a que asi se llama el Santo Patrono de su comunidad, actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo.
Todas las integrantes son personas muy activas, quienes desean invertir sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades y objetivos.
texts.en:
Patrocinia G. is the president of the group which works in retail. They want to invest their money to purchase clothing, shoes, sheets, pillows, and more in order to increase the variety of products they sell and increase their profits. Patrocinia is very happy with her current loan, because thanks to the Paraguayan Foundation (Kiva Field Partner), she has considerably improved her income.

This group of women meets in the city of Paraguarí to discuss their Women's Entrepreneur Group and they all seem very interested in the benefits provided by the program. The group is named San Cayetano because he is the patron saint of their community. The group is currently in its sixth loan cycle. All the members are very active individuals who want to invest their loan in their respective businesses and goals.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pillows, clothing, and sheets

loans.name: Milton Francisco

texts.es:
Milton de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador  que por medio de su familia que tienen talleres  de ebanistas el sigue con la misma actividad como una tradición familiar.

Ahora labora en su taller de 8h00 a 18h00 diariamente arreglando todo tipo de madera mediantes pedidos.  Con el apoyo del préstamo desea comprar madera, laca, sellador para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere comprar maquinas para producir más en su negocio y poder  atender otros tipo de trabajo que tiene.
texts.en:
Milton, 53, is a hard-working man.  His family has long made a living making and selling furniture and he is continuing the tradition with his own workshop.

Milton works in the shop every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm.  He makes furniture to order, using all kinds of wood.  He will use this loan to buy supplies of wood, lacquer and sealer to stock the business with the supplies he needs to earn his living.  His future goal is to buy equipment that would allow him to increase production and take on other kinds of work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for furniture-making business

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo tiene 45 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su pareja y su  hijo en el caserio de Mocape, cerca de la ciudad de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz. Teofilo se dedica a la comercialización de pescado en el mercado local. También se dedica a la venta de animales menores como ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos. Desea ampliar su ganado con la compra de más animales para criar y vender y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en:
Teófilo, 45, lives in his own house with his spouse and son in Mocape hamlet near the city of Olmos, an agricultural zone that’s quite commercial and belongs to Lambayeque Province and is located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural part of the district and does not have the basic utilities: water and electricity.  

Teófilo works selling fish at the local market.  He also sells small farm animals like: sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl.  He wants to expand the livestock business buying more animals to raise and sell and also buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.  Because of this he’s thought it convenient to request a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy more livestock and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Christ Is The Way Group

texts.es: La Sra. Olga  es divorciada, tiene 2 hijos y tiene 44 años de edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Cristo es el Camino” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Olga  trabaja desde hace  10  años en la venta de verduras en un puesto en el mercado, este trabajo surge a raíz de su divorcio tuvo que trabajar para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que olga no quería depender economicamente de su ex esposo y es así que trabajo muy duro y apesar de todo su  deseo de superación eran más  grandes que sus problemas, gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha construido su casa, se compro un terreno, sus hijos cuentan con educaciòn.Olga nos cuenta que como mujer y madre se siente orgullosa por sus logros,nos cuenta que es  feliz y tiene una buena calidad de vida. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Olga  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Olga is divorced, she has 2 children, and she is 44 years old. She is a member of the communal bank named "Christ is the Way", a group made up of 10 members who all have various business types. Olga has had her vegetable stand business for the past 10 years in the market. This business was established following her divorce when she had to work to support her children. Olga did not want to financially depend on her ex-husband and so she worked very hard. Despite everything, her wish to improve herself was greater than her problems. And thanks to her efforts and dedication she has managed to secure a better income, she has built a house, purchased a plot of land, and her children went to school. Olga tells us that as a woman and a mother she feels proud for her achievements. She says that she is happy and that she has a good quality of life. The loan that was granted to her was to purchase merchandise. We know that Olga will achieve her goals through a great deal of work and effort and that the loan through Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her stand.

loans.name: Eda Maria

texts.es:
Eda de 59 años de edad, casada, con una familia de seis hijos, todos casados hoy en día. Su esposo es jubilado. 
Eda tiene su propio negocio, el alquiler de cuarto, iniciando por iniciativa propia al tener un cuarto vacía el cual nace la idea de alquilar, lo que le funciono logrando alquilar otro más. 
Ya que con los ingresos de alquiler paga los gastos básicos de luz, agua,  así como gastos personales.
La demanda de alquilar por sus clientes se ha mantenido, lo cual quiere comenzar a construir otro cuarto lo que no cuenta con todo el capital, busca financiamiento en Afodenic para comenzar hacer un cuarto en donde comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar y que espera a futuro terminal por este medio que le es más viable la construcción.
texts.en:
Eda is 59 years old, married, and she has a family of six children. They are all married now. Her husband is retired.

Eda has her own business, renting a bedroom. She started out under her own initiative. When she had a vacant room she thought of the idea to rent it. It worked out well so she wants to rent another one. The rental income pays for the basic expenses, including electricity, water, and other personal expenses.

The demand by clients wanting to rent has been steady, which is why she wants to start building another room. She does not have the entire capital funds she needs so she requests a loan from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner), to start building the room. She will purchase construction materials such as building rocks, sand, cement, and steel. She hopes to finish building it in the future and this is the most viable way to build.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as building rocks, sand, cement, and steel.

loans.name: Umurava Group

texts.en:
Leoncie is 27 years old, and she is not yet married. She owns a general store in which she sells many items that are commonly used at home such as soap, sugar, salt, matches and so on. Generally the group members own small businesses in their homesteads. The group is made up of mostly women and a few men. They usually combine their businesses with farming when it's farming season.

Leoncie is requesting a loan to buy more items such as sugar, soap, salt, matches, etc.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, matches, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. 
Teresita has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish to sell.
Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 54 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.She is married and a mother of seven adult-aged children.
Juliana has a food business in the city. Food is in great demand by humans; that's why Juliana invested in this business. She sells good viand, tasty desserts and refreshments in her food stall to earn a living. Juliana has been running this food business for six years. She earns PHP 15,000 per month. Juliana requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase kitchen utensils to be used in food preparation. Juliana has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Juliana hopes to have her own restaurant that generates excessive profit.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils to be used in food preparation.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora e independiente, a sus 44 años vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez realiza estos bellos bordados en faldas típicas de su región. Su trabajo lo realiza diariamente en su casa, pero los fines de semana los lleva al mercado local de su zona para venderla a los comerciantes de trajes típicos. Es por eso que cada día tiene que  avanzar regularmente para que  tenga más prendas que vender. Para ella es clave tener siempre disponible y a la mano sus materiales. Por otro lado cría cerdos que luego de 3 meses son vendidos en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Afirma que le gusta trabajar más en el bordado porque no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico pero si de mucha creatividad, además su trabajo no tiene pierde porque su producto no es perecible como los alimentos. Por ahora aprovechará las festividades de su zona ya que hay más demanda de las prendas que vende. Afirma que le agrada trabajar de manera grupal con MFP como lo viene haciendo desde hace 12 ciclos de trabajo de las cuales tiene un buen record de puntualidad en sus pagos y lo seguirá demostrando en el futuro. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor para aprovechar estos meses donde tiene mayor demanda de los bordados.
texts.en: Maria is a hardworking and independent woman. She is 44 years old and lives with her 2 children in their own home.  Since childhood, she has made beautiful embroidery on the traditional skirts of the region. She does her work from home everyday but on weekends she takes them to the local market to sell to the traditional clothing merchants. This is why every day she has to get ahead in order to have more clothing to sell. For her it is key to always have her materials available. On the other hand, she raises pigs that she sells after 3 months in the livestock fair of her community. She states that she likes to work more with the embroidery because it doesn't require as much physical strength but does require a lot of creativity. Also, it doesn't have any losses, because she doesn't have to pay for feed. For now, she will take advantage of the area's festivities since there will be more demand for the clothes she sells. She states that she likes to work with the group from MFP as she has done for 12 work cycles during which she has had a good payment record as she will continue to have in the future. With the money she is asking for, she will invest in buying thread and fabric wholesale to take advantage of these months, when there is a higher demand for embroidered clothing.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Wakeur  Mareme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité créé le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois le 7 juillet 2011 est baptisé Wakeur Marème, il est composé de vingt cinq femmes qui habitent la même localité et sont parentes, amies et voisines; elles s'activent dans l'élevage,la tannerie, la confection de nattes et le commerce. 


La responsable Marème âgée de 26 ans est célibataire sans enfant mais a sa nièce en charge,elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits divers et fait parallèlement de l'embouche ovine et bovine. Elle est tout à fait à droite habillée en sari noir avec des fleurs jaune rouge .


Elle achéte ses parfums, chaussures,habits, denrées alimentaires..... dans la capitale et les pays limitrophes et vend dans son village; elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 9 ans.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des moutons pour l'embouche et des marchandises pour renforcer son commerce afin de gagner plus de revenus.

Elle souhaite avoir une autonomie financière et pouvoir acheter une parcelle de terrain pour y construire un magasin.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité créé le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois le 7 juillet 2011 est baptisé Wakeur Marème, il est composé de vingt cinq femmes qui habitent la même localité et sont parentes, amies et voisines; elles s'activent dans l'élevage,la tannerie, la confection de nattes et le commerce. 


La responsable Marème âgée de 26 ans est célibataire sans enfant mais a sa nièce en charge,elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits divers et fait parallèlement de l'embouche ovine et bovine. Elle est tout à fait à droite habillée en sari noir avec des fleurs jaune rouge .


Elle achéte ses parfums, chaussures,habits, denrées alimentaires..... dans la capitale et les pays limitrophes et vend dans son village; elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 9 ans.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des moutons pour l'embouche et des marchandises pour renforcer son commerce afin de gagner plus de revenus.

Elle souhaite avoir une autonomie financière et pouvoir acheter une parcelle de terrain pour y construire un magasin.

loans.use: Faire du commerce et de l'embouche ovine.

loans.name: Karen Rossmary

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Karen que nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad donde nací y donde realizo mis actividades económicas, Yo me dedico a la elaboración de productos lácteos como por ejemplo yogurt y manjar. Ya son cuatro que me dedico a este negocio y me va muy bien. Yo requiero el crédito para comprar insumos y máquinas. Mi sueño es ser mayorista y repartir a colegios, centros comerciales e instituciones privadas”.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” (Let’s Go Together) Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is there.

This is where we meet Karen, who was born in the city of Cusco (Perú).  She is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She tells us, “I currently live in the city where I was born.  That is where I conduct my business activities.  I sell dairy products like yogurt and pastry cream.  I have been is this business for four years, and it is going very well for me.

“I need this loan to buy supplies and machinery.  My dream to be a wholesaler and to distribute to schools, commercial centers, and private institutions.”

loans.use: to buy supplies and machinery.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr:
Adidjatou est une femme  de 50 ans. Elle est mariée å un monsieur qui est retraité. Elle a 3 enfants qui sont tous actuellement dans la vie active. Le premier a 28 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Adidjatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1989. Elle achète et revend des potasses à toute personne. Elle vend ses marchandises dans un marché local de Lomé. 
Adidjatou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des potasses. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adidjatou voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins en alimentation et santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adidjatou is a 50-year-old married woman with three children who have entered the workforce. The oldest is 28 years old, and the youngest is 22. Her husband is retired.

Adidjatou has been a reseller since 1989. She buys and sells potash to anyone and everyone. She conducts her sales at a local market in Lomé.

Adidjatou is seeking a third loan through WAGES to buy potash. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She plans to use the profits to provide for her family’s needs with respect to food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy potash for resale

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle arrête ses études en classe de troisième, ayant considérée sa charge et pour venir en aide sa famille elle ouvre une boucherie a domicile et achète des cartons de cuisses de poulets, des cartons de viandes, ailes  de poulets.
Elle vend en moyenne 10.000 frs à 40.000 frs par jour.

A l’octroi de son prêt elle va acheter les produits dont la demande est forte et les produits qu’elle n’arrive pas à acheter a cause de son faible capitale, tel que cartons de queue, cartons de poissons soles et bars, cartons de poules a bouillir et les cotes de porcs.

Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une chambre froide chez elle et de faire la vente en gros des vivres frais.  Avec ses bénéfices, elle va contribuer à payer les études universitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: The client is 47 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She stopped her studies in the third grade. Having considered her responsibility and to help her family, she opened a home-based butcher shop and sells containers of chicken thighs, containers of meat and chicken wings. She sells, on average, 10,000 to 40,000 frs a day. Upon the granting of the loan, she is going to buy the products whose demand is high and the products that she hasn't been able to buy because of her low capital, such as containers of tail, containers of fish (sole and bass), containers of boiled chicken and pork chops. She aims to open a cold room at her house and to wholesale fresh food. With her profits, she is going to contribute to pay for the university education of her children.

loans.use: To buy containers of poultry and beef

loans.name: Zamirahon's Group

texts.en:
Zamirahon is the leader of this group. She is 55 and divorced. She has raised a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter is a teacher at school.

Zamirahon works as an operator in the Kyrgyz Post Office. Her monthly salary is 5,000 KGS. In order to earn additional money to support the family, she also breeds livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

In the future Zamirahon plans to purchase a piece of land for cultivating agricultural products. She also wishes to build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase uniforms for employees and for marketing costs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 30-year-old, married woman with 3 school-age children. Evelyn lives in Gala, Ozamis City.

To earn a living, Evelyn operates a general store. She has operated this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products for her general store.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Evelyn hopes to save money to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her general store

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 22, single, and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In 2009, she opened a shop to provide clothes and accessories for renting for parties, special occasions, plays and dancing performances.

Yen would like a loan to buy fabric and materials to make more clothes for renting. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her and her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes for renting.

loans.name: Damacio

texts.es: El señor  Damacio, nacido en la comunidad de Padilla de la ciudad de  Chuquisaca de 57 años, dedicado a la agricultura conjuntamente con su señora esposa desde hace  26 años , actualmente radica en la comunidad de Tupac Katari, de la localidad de la Guardia,  El señor tiene su parcela propia y esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de semillas para sembrar maíz y maní y también para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, junto con su hija Pascuala quien le ayuda en la siembra y en la comercialización de sus productos,  el señor Damacio esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Damacio is a native of the community of Padilla in the city of Chuquisaca. He is 57 years old and makes a living in agriculture working alongside his wife for the past 26 years. He currently resides in the community of Tupac Katari in the locality of La Guardia. He has his own plot of land and is requesting the loan to purchase seeds to plant corn and peanuts. He prepares the land with daughter Pascuala, who helps him with planting and also selling the products. Damacio is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant corn and peanuts.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear and cosmetics. Virginia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies and to pay for laborers' salaries for her rice farming business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies and pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 64 years old lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to four children. All of them have their own family already. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
